loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man with ten children. Six of his children currently attend school, while four children have graduated from school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He explains that his greatest monthly expenses are for food and school tuition fees.

To earn a living, he operates a goat meat business. Specifically, he buys and then sells goats at the market to nearby butchers. Charles's primarily challenge as of late has been the high cost of transporation. In the future, he hopes to expand his business (and to solve much of his transportation problem) by establishing a slaughterhouse. Charles is now seeking a loan in the amount of 40,000 KES ($500) to purchase goats for re-sale purposes. He decided to join Yehu because it enables him to access financial services.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional goats

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen P. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old, married and has seven children. Her eldest child is 23 years old and the youngest is only 5. To make a living, Aileen owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Aileen wishes to have all her children finish college and have bright futures.
Aileen joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Aileen is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Cosme Olivio

texts.es:
Cosme Olivio N. R. tiene 60 años, vive en Unión Libre con su esposa,  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No Tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. DIVINO NIÑO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Cosme Olivio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Agro Servicios San Jacinto y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener su propio carro 

Le gusta ver televisión y hacer muchos amigos
texts.en:
Cosme Olivio N. R. is 60 years old; he lives with his common-law spouse in the canton of Ventanas, in the Los Rios province. He doesn't have children. 

The members of the communal bank "Devine Infant" is located in the community of Estero Lindo in Ventanas. It is a group of 12 members who are short-term agriculturists who plant corn and rice. 

Cosme Olivio is an agriculturist who plants corn and rice. He purchases his products in Agro Servicios San Jacinto and he resells them in the same location. 

He requests a loan to plant corn and rice, to purchase products and seeds. With the support of the loan he will be able to meet his needs, and to face the difficult challenge of plagues, illness, and the changing weather. His dream is to have his own car. 

He enjoys watching television and to make many new friends.

loans.use: To purchase products and seeds.

loans.name: Husein

texts.ar:
حسين يعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية هو متزوج وله 3 اولاد له في عمله 20 سنة يتميز عمله بالدقة والصدق لديه خبرة كبيرة
في هذا المجال فهو يحب عمله كان للقرض السابق الاثر الجيد على عمله وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل من عائلته واولاده وساهم في زيادة البضائع في المحل حيث انه هو المحل الوحيد في نطاق الضيعة لذلك يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديد للمحل 
وتوسيع العمل
texts.en: Husein is married with three children. He likes his market where he has been working for 20 years.  Husein is known for his exhaustive work experience and for being honest and thorough. His previous loan from Al Majmoua had a positive effect on his business. He used it to increase goods at his market, the only one in his neighborhood. Husein was fully supported by his family and children during his previous loan cycle. He wants to get a new loan from Al Majmoua to buy new goods and to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell and expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more agricultural products to sell

loans.name: María Tempora

texts.es:
María tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Carrasquillo del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. En el negocio varios años y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Gracias a esta actividad ella junto a su esposo ha podido mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora su anhelo es tener una tienda mayorista en la zona mejorando de esta manera la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María, 34, is married living with her family in Carrasquillo hamlet which is in the Tambogrande agricultural district, an agricultural zone located in Piura region over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

She has a general store in her house where she sells her neighbors varied daily use items and groceries.  She’s been in business several years now and has an established base of regular customers.  Thanks to this activity she and her husband have been able to support the family during all this time.

María wants to expand the business buying more merchandise to meet customer demand.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

María is a responsible, hard working woman whose dream is to have a wholesale store in the area thus improving her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
la señora Maria Santos F. tiene 65 años de edad, es viuda y no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive en la aldea El Polvo desde hace ya mucho tiempo, sus hijos viven en los Estados Unidos y a veces recibe ayuda de ellos.
Maria se a dedicado a la cria de ganado, Maria las ordeña y la leche que saca la vende, y la que le queda  hace rosquillas y quesadillas.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materieles para la fabricacion de las rosquillas y quesadillas.

doña Maria Santos es una mujer seria no le gusta mucho conversar, pero es muy trabajadora y toda su vida se ha dedicado a la ganaderia.
 
su mayor tiempo lo utiliza para cuidar de su ganado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Santos F. is 65 years old, a widow, and she does not have children who depend on her. She has lived in the community of El Polvo for a long time. Her children live in the United States and she receives support from them sometimes.

Maria raises cattle. She milks them and she sells the milk that is produced and whatever is left she makes into donuts and quesadillas.

The loan will be used to purchase ingredients to make donuts and quesadillas. 

Maria Santos is a serious person who doesn't like to talk much but she is very hard working. She has been dedicated to raising cattle all her life. 

The majority of her time is taken up with the care of her cattle.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, water, cinnamon, and sugar to make donuts.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 32 años de edad. Actualmente, María vive en la ciudad imperial de los Incas, Cusco, Perú. Ella trabaja en la empresa SILSA (Servicios de Limpieza Integrados). La empresa SILSA actualmente se encarga de hacer limpieza del Seguro Social del Cusco y ahi trabaja Maria. En esta oportunidad Maria requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para hacer pintar la casa y otros arreglos que necesita la casa. El sueño de María es abrir un snack.   

Maria es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Los Diamantes” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Maria was born in the city of Cusco and she is 32 years old. Maria currently lives in the imperial city of Los Incas, in Cusco, Peru. She works with the company named SILSA (meaning Integrated Janitorial Services). The company named SILSA is responsible for the janitorial services to the hospital in Cusco and that is where Maria works. Maria currently requires a loan to meet some personal needs, specifically to have her house repainted and to carry out other improvements necessary for the house. Maria’s dream is to open a snack bar. 

Maria is a responsible person and she is a member of the communal bank named “The Diamonds” of Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner) located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to have her house painted and to carry out other necessary home improvements

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet P. is from the village of Lagunde, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 49 years old. Juliet is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, chocolate and milk powders, shampoo, soap and biscuits. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2009, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and beverages. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Juliet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and beverages

loans.name: Christophe

texts.en: Christophe is 30 years old and single. He sells fish and cooking oil. His business has enabled him to build his own house where he lives. Christophe is requesting a loan to buy more fish and cooking oil for his store. He hopes to reinvest the profit from his loan into his business.

loans.use: to buy fish and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is married with two grown children. She lives in Melitopol and owns a flower sales business. So far she has 2 vending locations where she offers a variety of flowers that can please the tastes of the most demanding customers. Larisa has been in the trade for 15 years. She has 30,000 Grivnyas in working capital. 

Larisa is requesting a 15,000 Grivnya loan to open a new vending location to add to the existing two that she already has. Larisa is planning to re-invest income that is generated in the further development of her business and construct a greenhouse for flowers that she can grow on her property.

loans.use: to open an additional vending location

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 57 years old and married. She lives in the community of Sta. Josefa Agusan del Sur. Her husband is a farmer and a Brgy. Kagawad in their community.  For eight years, she and her husband have been tilling their small rice farm to be able to raise their children.

With the loan coming from Community Economic Ventures Inc., she will buy fertilizers and other farm inputs.

Nilda has four children. Her eldest child is 24 and her youngest child is 14. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger farm and more profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ramazan

texts.en:
Ramazan is 48 years old. He is married with two children. He started his livestock breeding business in 2005. He is very experienced and has special skills in livestock care that help him to develop his business. He raises and sells livestock and sells meat and milk. 

Ramazan is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase more cattle. Increasing the number of cattle will enable him to increase the milk and meat produced and will provide a more secure income for his family. The income will enable Ramazan to support his family, take good care of his livestock and supply his customers with quality milk and meat.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and one cow

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Gay

texts.en:
Gay is a 40 year old married woman with 3 school-aged  children. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products. She had been doing this work for 15 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 5,000.

Gay is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 to purchase additional products to sell to the people of the community. She will buy vinegar, soy sauce, noodles, canned goods, and coffee. She hopes that through the loan, she can obtain more customers.

In the future, Gay hopes that her business will expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy vinegar, soy sauce, noodles, canned goods, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es: Blanca Flor, tiene la edad de 50 años, está en unión libre, vive con su conyugue y su hijastro. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para la siembra de su café. Ella cuanta con el terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo y tiene el terreno ya sembrado por lo cual lo que le hará es darle una pequeña  abonada para su buena producción este próximo año. Ella quiere logra de esta próximas cosecha mejores ganancias para el bienestar de su familia y seguir adelante con sus proyectos de vida. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Blanca Flor is 50-years-old and lives in a common-law marriage with her partner and stepson.  She plans to use the loan to purchase agricultural additives for growing coffee.  She has a piece of land that is appropriate for growing coffee and it is already planted.  What this will do is fertilize it a little for good production in the coming year.  She would like to have better profits in the next harvests for the well-being of her family and to get ahead with the projects in her life.  This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She hasn’t received other loans from state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her this loan with ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow coffee.

loans.name: Claudia Emerita

texts.es:
Claudia, es una mujer de familia, vive con sus padres y hermanos, está soltera y en su familia son agricultores y también venden meriendas, su padre es agricultor y su madre vende las meriendas, ella colabora con ellos en las diferentes labores.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, para la siembra que por el momento tiene con su familia, este préstamo le ayudara muchísimo para comprarse el abono y fortalecer la siembra.
Su aspiración es tener cada año buenas cosechas, que con la ayuda de préstamo puedan brindar el cuido adecuado al cultivo, teniendo siempre la buena disposición de trabajar.
texts.en:
Claudia is a woman in a family. She lives with her parents, brothers and sisters. She is single and her family farms. They also sell snacks. Her father is a farmer and her mother sells snacks. She works with her family doing different jobs.
Actually, she is requesting this loan in order to buy agricultural products for planting crops. She is growing crops with her family. This loan would help a lot with the purchase of fertilizer and support for the plantings.
Her goal is to have a good harvest each year. With the help of this loan she can adequately support the plantings and therefore have the desire to work on the farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the plantings.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe works hard to support her family. Cleofe is married and has a business that sells personal products in the Philippines. 

Cleofe requested a 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more personal products to sell. 

Cleofe has been in this business for 12 years. 

Cleofe would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more personal products to sell

loans.name: Ruby Elena

texts.es: Ruby  de 49 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos enlas edades de 8 y 28 años; allí se dedica al comercio y tiene un villar, donde ofrece los servicios de juegos y vende refrescos y bebidas. Su actividad emprendedora surgió porque siempre le ha gustado ser independiente, tener sus propios ingresos y sobre todo, para poder apoyar el bienestar de sus hijos. Su esposo es su gran apoyo y también trabaja en el negocio, especialmente los fines de semana; en su negocio sus ventas las realiza diariamente y de contado. Su mayor desafío es tener el capital suficiente para realizar sus sueños, como el de comprar el local donde funciona su negocio. Su meta es lograr incrementar sus ventas mediante la inyección de capital de trabajo, que es lo que justamente planea con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en un mayor volumen refrescos, bebidas y acondicionará físicamente su negocio. Sus índices financieros reportan utilidades que potencializan incrementos futuros no menores del 40% las cuales planea reinvertir  y ampliar sus posibilidades de crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en:
Ruby is 49 years old and lives in the town of Soledad with her husband and two children, ages 8 and 28. There she manages a billiard hall where she offers games and sells soft drinks and beverages. This enterprise came about because she always enjoyed being independent and having her own income, but most of all she wanted to provide for the welfare of her children. Her husband is a great support and also works in this business, especially on the weekends. Ruby generates cash sales in her business on a daily basis. Her greatest challenge is not having enough capital to fulfill her dreams, such as buying a location where she can operate her business. Her goal is to increase her sales so that she can inject more operating capital, which is what she plans to do with her Kiva loan.

This is her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Ruby will use the funds to buy a large volume of soft drinks and beverages, as well as physically remodel her business. Her financial indicators report a potential increase in profits of no less than 40%, which she will reinvest in order to improve the chances of growing her business.

loans.use: to pay for physical renovations to her business and to buy a large volume of soft drinks and beverages.

loans.name: La Arnie Lee

texts.en:
La Arnie is a 25-year-old married woman with one child. She has been selling motorcycle parts and other similar products for four years. Her business is located in a shop near her home. According to her, she has regular customers and she is glad because her husband is her helper in their business. She would like to buy a stock of spare parts so that she could minimize her expenses in going to and from the place where she buys her products.

La Arnie is requesting a loan in the amount of P35,000 in order to buy a large quantity of spare parts such as tires, oils, motorcycle accessories, mufflers, fenders, chains, and sprockets for her spare parts shop so that she can continue to sell. According to her, the money she earns will be used to repay the loan, improve her family’s standard of living, and save some funds for the preparation of schooling of her daughter. She works hard because she would like to attain success in business and in her life. She hopes that through her business she would be able to fulfill her goal which is to become a successful business woman and model mother to her daughter and friends.

loans.use: to buy tires, oils, motorcycle accessories, mufflers, fenders, chains, and sprockets for her spare parts shop

loans.name: Dorinda

texts.en:
Dorinda is 66 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 7 children.

Dorinda works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase 30 kilos of big fish to sell. Dorinda has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. 

In the future, Dorinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 30 kilos of big fish to sell

loans.name: Celeo David

texts.es:
el sr. Celeo David tiene 51 años de edad, vive en unión libre y es padre de 3 hijos, Celeo se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, tiene muchos clientes ya que el vende sus productos a un precio justo, ademas son de buena calidad.
Celeo utilizara el credito para la compra de abarroteria y asi surtir su negocio, desea tenerlo bien surtido para tener mayores ventas y asi obtener mas ganancias.
su meta es tener un mercadito en el cual venda muchos productos y asi tener satisfechos a sus clientes.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Celeo David is 51 years old, lives in a common-law marriage, and has three children.  Celeo works selling popular consumer products.  He has a small store in his home.  He has many customers since he sells his products as a good price and they are of a good quality.  

Celeo will use this loan to purchase groceries to stock his store.  He wants to have it will stocked to have more sales and therefore earn more money.

His goal is to have a small market where he will sell many products to satisfy his customers.  He needs his income to get ahead with his children.

loans.use: to purchase butter, oil, sugar, flour, beans, tortillas, bread, coffee, candles, drinks, flashlights, batteries, toothpaste, toilet paper, soaps, juices, and milk.

loans.name: Felipe Jesus

texts.es: El señor Felipe De Jesús se dedica a brindar el servicio de taller de bicletas, tiene 5 años de tener este negocio con ciertos ahorros que tenia logro obtener su propio negocio pues siempre se esmera en brindar un excelente servicio, es por eso que día a día disfruta de realizar esta actividad. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de llantas, rines, cadenas, asientos, spray, aceites entre otros repuestos. Su sueño es tener un lugar estable donde vender sus productos y ofrecer sus servicios.
texts.en: Felipe de Jesús provides bicycle repair services; he’s had this business for five years. He used certain savings he had to get a business of his own because he always strives to provide excellent service and this is why he enjoys doing the work he does every day.  The reason for the loan is to buy tires, rims, chains, seats, spray and lubricants among other spare parts.  His dream is to have stable place in which to sell his products and offer his services.

loans.use: to buy tires, rims, chains, seats, spray and lubricants.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is married and has 2 children. Felicia sells banku and yams at Takoradi. She also sells different types of frozen fish and meat, which she has done for 5 years. Her husband is a sand-winner (extractor of riverbank sand). Felicia uses her income to assists her husband to take care of the home. Felicia will use the loan to obtain frozen fish to sell.

loans.use: to obtain frozen fish to sell.

loans.name: Toktobubu's Group

texts.en:
Toktobubu, 64, is the leader of this group.  With her husband, who is a retiree, she has raised six children - two sons and four daughters. All the children are married, employed and live separately with their own families. Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 6000 soms, Toktobubu purchased a calf for breeding. Since then, the couple has been breeding farm animals. Toktobubu also sells dairy products, through which she earns about 2000 soms per month. With the money received from the loan, she wants to purchase sheep for breeding, fattening and reselling.  In the future with the profits gained from this activity she plans to improve her living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Glane

texts.en:
Glane is a married woman having one child. Glane is 30 years old, residing at Happy Valley, Tambulig, ZDS, Philippines. 

Glane owns and operates farmland, planting & harvesting corn for sale to earn a living and she's been two years in this business. Each month, she earns 15,000 doing this type of work. 

She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Glane is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Glane wants to make improvements to her house and to have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

location.town: Happy Valley  Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 60 years old and married with three children.

Salvacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Salvacion has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from selling meat and vegetables.

Salvacion aspires to save enough money to build a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María Juana  tiene 39 años de edad es casada tiene 6 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 20, 18, 12, 6, 4 y 6 meses de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.

María se dedica a la agricultura y quehaceres domésticos en la casa. Las compras y las ventas  los hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para poder sembrar maíz comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá invertirlo en la agricultura para poder obtener buenas utilidades.
El sueño es poder tener un micro mercado. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la sequedad del tiempo o mucho invierno.En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.

Con la ayuda del préstamo anterior pudo comprar lo necesario para la siembra como: abonos y fertilizantes, abonos agrícolas. La situación económica de la familia ha mejorado. La relación con la familia se esta fortaleciendo aun más.
"Esta muy agrdecida por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
María Juana is 39 years old and is married with 6 children.  She lives with her husband and her children ages 20, 18, 12, 6, 4 and 6 months in the Guaranda Province of Bolívar.

She is a member of the group VRC VENTANAL which can be found in the community of Guantuncoto, in Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda Parish, at a distance of 30 minutes from the loan office.  The group members work in various activities, including agriculture, cattle, raising small animals like pigs, chickens and sheep, sales and construction.

María works in agriculture and in domestic work at home.  She buys and sells in Guaranda.  She is asking for a loan in order to plant corn and purchase seeds and fertilizers.  With the help of the loan she will be able to invest in agriculture in order to obtain better yields.  Her dream is to be able to have a mini market.  The challenges that she faces include drought or too much winter.  In her free time she likes to enjoy the carnival festivities.  

With the help of her previous loan she was able to purchase the necessary items to plant such as fertilizers.  The economic situation of her family has improved.  Her relationship with her family has grown even stronger.  "She is very thankful for the help provided."

loans.use: to plant corn and purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Cresentia

texts.en:
Cresentia is 35 years old and is married to Peter, who is a high school teacher. The couple is blessed with four children between five and sixteen years old. For the past 11 years, Cresentia has been a dairy farmer and she earns a monthly income of 16,600 KES. 

Cresentia is requesting her first loan with KADET to buy hay and molasses and to pay for veterinary services. She intends to use the anticipated profits from her loan to start rearing poultry. Cresentia hopes to be a large-scale dairy farmer in future.

loans.use: to buy hay and molasses

loans.name: Nicolasa Del Rosario

texts.es:
Nicolasa, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de tortillas, lo comenzó por iniciativa propia debido a la necesidad de darles lo mejor a su familia, trabaja todos los días debido a la demanda de sus clientes.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar maíz, leña, gas, bolsas, de esa forma podrá tener  la materia prima y obtener  mejores ingresos y cada día mejorar más la  atención a sus clientes.
El sueño de Nicolasa tener un negocio más grande en mejores condiciones seguir trabajando con nuestra institución y darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Nicolasa lives with her husband and their two children. She has worked selling tortillas for several years. She started this business through her own iniciative because of the necessity to give her family the best. Due to her customers' high demand, she works every day.

She will use this loan to buy corn, firewood, gas, and bags, and in this way, she will be able to have more primary materials and make better income, improving her service to her customers every day.

Nicolasa's dream is to have a bigger and better business, to continue working with the lending institution, and to give her family the best possible life.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, gas, and bags.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia sigue en su negocio de venta de zapatos  y ropa interior como polos y medias,la socia vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los zapatos y ropa interior como polos y medias.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatos y ropa interior al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maribel continues in her business of selling shoes and underwear, including polo shirts and hose. She sells her goods in the streets from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. Through these transactions, she is able to advance her children. 

Maribel's dream is to have her own shop where she can sell shoes and underwear, including polo shirts and hose. She is requesting this loan to buy shoes and underwear at wholesale. Maribel is happy about the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy shoes and underwear at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is 27 years old, she sells phone and computer accessories to earn a living. She has been in the business for 2 years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy computer and phone accessories for sale.

loans.use: To buy computer and  phone accessories

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, a mother of four, is a housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi with her family. Her husband who can drive wants to use his skill. Due to lack of financing, they are unable to buy a rickshaw. Her husband wants to have a proper source of income to support their family. As a dedicated and supportive wife, she is requesting a loan so that her husband can buy a rickshaw.
 
This loan is essential for them as they will become self-sufficient. They plan to save this money for the future. Her husband aims to expand his business in the future through his hard work and dedication.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw.

loans.name: Cesiri Group

texts.fr:
Bakary est le monsieur qui  tient la tête du mouton sur la photo. Il est  un  malien  non scolarisé. Il est âgé de  36  ans, marié Père de 04 enfants, âgés de 8mois à  14 ans dont 1 est  scolarisé. Sa femme est une ménagère. 
 Bakary  fait  l’élevage des béliers, Il prend le prêt avec le RMCR pour acheter  des béliers. Il s’approvisionne  dans  les foires environnantes  et revend  ses béliers  en ville.   Il  exerce ce métier, il y a plus de 12 ans. Dans ses ventes, il gagne environ  10000 FCFA de profit par Bélier. Le profit qu’il gagne lui permet de  subvenir à certains besoins de sa famille notamment habillement, frais scolaires et médicaux.  Il est souvent confronté aux  couts élevé  des frais de transport   mais organise généralement  le voyage avec  certains éleveurs  de sa localité pour relever les défis. Bakary  est solvable depuis qu’il travaille avec le RMCR.
Dans l’avenir,  Bakary souhaite avoir  un prêt  plus  élevé pour acheter beaucoup plus de béliers afin d’avoir plus de profits.
texts.en:
Bakary is the man holding the sheep in the photo. He is from Mali, and growing up, he never received an education. He is a 36-year-old married father to four children aged between eight months and 14 years old. Only one of his children is currently attending school. His partner stays at home as a housewife.

Bakary earns a living by raising livestock. He is taking out this loan from RMCR in order to purchase rams. He gets his supplies from the local livestock markets then resells his rams in town. He has been doing this for over 12 years. He earns around 10,000 FCFA in profit from the sale of each ram. These profits allow him to meet some of his family's needs, notably their clothing, as well as their school and medical fees. He often runs into difficulties like inflated transportation costs, but he generally organises trips alongside other local livestock farmers in order to circumvent this. Bakary has been solvent ever since he started working with RMCR.

In the future, Bakary hopes to take out a larger loan so he can purchase even more rams and thereby earn a greater profit.

loans.use: to purchase sheep which will then be resold.

loans.name: Miroslava

texts.en: Miroslava S. was born on Kardjali. She is 32 years old and is still single. Maria has graduated agronomy but already then she has worked in the field of trade. After her graduation she has spent two years working in England but she is not satisfied and comes back home. For two years she has worked in different trade companies and then decides to start own trade business. She rents a stall in one of the trade centers of the town and starts to sell children clothes on it. Miroslava wants to open a new stall and needs to buy a car with which to supply clothes for her stalls. The needed loan is $ 2 000.

loans.use: To buy a car with which to supply clothes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a client of Kraban Support Foudation and needs a loan of $650 to buy a washing machine and also build a permanent structure for her business. She keeps her accounts properly and knows about the TEACH Lending program.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is married with a two-year-old daughter. He sells groceries in downtown Kamenka-Dneprovskaya. His kiosk is located in a very busy place which is why there are always many customers who come to buy groceries from Alexei. He is a hard worker and works long days to make sure his family has everything they need.

Alexei has been running this kiosk for three years. Presently, his gross income is about $2,600 a month. He has around $2,200 in inventory. Lending services from “Nadiya Ukraine” have promoted the expansion of his small venture. Recently, Alexei started attending a Christian church. This has had a positive effect on his trade and helped him be more customer-friendly.

Alexei’s business is the only source of income for his family. He realizes this responsibility and is doing his best to meet the needs of his young wife and little daughter. Today he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new refrigerator to keep the meat he sells in his kiosk fresh. Alexei is hoping that one day he will be able to generate enough profit to open his own little grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator for meat storage

loans.name: Carmen Amalia

texts.es:
12 years ago, Carmen started her own business selling groceries. At the time, her husband was unemployed and her household debts were increasing. She also had to cover the cost of school for her two children. Thanks to the business, they were able to get ahead. Fortunately, the high-quality service that she offers has allowed her to remain in business for a long time. She gradually increased her inventory and fixed up her store to meet the needs of her customers.

At this time, Carmen is seeking a loan of $925 to buy merchandise. She would like to expand into the sale of fruits and vegetables and continue to increase business. She is offering to repay the loan in 8 months. The wellbeing of this family is in your hands. Contribute to the growth of their business. They greatly appreciate the confidence and support that you offer.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 12 años Carmen inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, en ese momento su esposo se encontraba desempleado y las deudas de su hogar iban en aumento y también tenían que cubrir los gastos de la escuela de sus dos hijos y de esta manera es como lograron salir adelante. Afortunadamente el buen servicio que ofrece le ha permitido estar en el negocio durante tanto tiempo, poco a poco fue surtiendo mejor y acondicionando su tienda para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.

En estos momentos, Carmen solicita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en al compra de mercancía porque desea incorporar la venta de frutas y verduras y seguir creciendo con su negocio, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 8 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos agradecen mucho la confianza y ayuda que les brindas.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Sra. Olga, 47, is the mother of 5 children. She belongs to the Banco Comunal Manos Unidas (United Hands Community Bank) in the district of Manantay in Ucayali in Peru. Her partner is a worker at a sawmill. There are lots of sawmill workers in this very isolated place and no restaurants within an easy distance, so Olga took the initiative to set up a business providing meals to the workers.

With a first loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$94), she decided to buy kitchen utensils. With a recently-granted loan of S/.2,000 (US$639, approximately) from Manuela Ramos, she will buy 3 bags of charcoal--fuel for cooking--10 kilos of rice, 5 kilos of beans, 1 set of spoons, 1 set of plates and vegetables that she needs to prepare her meals. Olga and her partner are happy because they can be near one another despite the distance from the city and because they're generating income to cover basic household expenses. As of now, she can serve 30 workers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Olga tiene 47 años y es madre de 5 hijos, pertenece al Banco Comunal Manos Unidas, del distrito de Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali. Su cónyuge es trabajador de un aserradero, en el lugar hay muchos trabajadores que, en condición de peón, trabajan en los aserraderos, sin embargo dada la distancia no hay restaurante cerca, por ello Olga tiene la iniciativa de cocinar y dar menú a los trabajadores del lugar.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.) decide comprar utensilio de cocina. Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000 (US$ 639 aprox.) comprará 3 sacos de carbón (combustible para preparar los alimentos), 10 kilos de arroz, 5 kilos de frijol, 1 juego de cucharas, 1 juego de platos, y verduras que diariamente lo requiere para el menú. Olga y su cónyuge están contentos ya que ambos están cerca a pesar de la distancia de la cuidad y además ambos están generando ingresos para cubrir todas las necesitadas básicas de su hogar. A la fecha puede atender a 30 peones del lugar.

loans.use: Buy charcoal, foodstuffs and other supplies for restaurant business.

loans.name: Delete

texts.en:
ABDALAH, age 42, is the father of 3 boys. He and his wife have started businesses within the past two years to support their family. In February, 2006, Abdalah opened a shop called “Genge Duka” (Swahili meaning “a small market shop”). There, he sells vegetables, sodas, ice pops, and general-needs items. His shop has around 45 customers each day, and from them, he makes a profit of around $9. In the past, Abdalah has taken out two successful loans and hopes to take out a third loan, which will also be used to build up his shop’s inventory. 

In January of this year, Abdalah’s wife was able to open her own breakfast café, which brings a profit of about $2.50 a day. Because of starting these businesses, Abdalah and his wife say that they no longer have problems paying general expenses such as school fees and hospital bills.

Abdalah belongs to the group Songambele (Swahili for “going forward”), which consists of 21 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Tojy

texts.en: Tojy B. lives in B.Gafurov; she is married and has a child. She has been an active client of MicroInvest from 2003. Her business is stable. She trades in Panjshanbe Bazaar where her shop is located. She has a good assortment and she is working in the bedding material (cloth) and bedding selling. She has experience in business for 22 years. But working in Panjshanbe Bazaar, T.B. meets hard competitors--that is why she wants to widen the existing assortment of the bedding by importing new varieties.

loans.use: Purchase of new bedding materials and bedding to sell

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en: I am Samina B. from Borewala, a small town in Punjab, a province in Pakistan. I and my brother sell clothes to make our living. Last year, I took a loan for my business and as a result of my business expansion I bought a TV and a cow. I am also saving and collecting dowry for my marriage. I need a loan to further expand my business. The other women who are in need of loans are: Sobia B., who requires a loan for her husband who wants to start his own embroidery business, as he currently embroiders for someone else; Kalsoom B.‘s husband supplies wood to various brick furnaces and now he needs a loan to improve his business; Rasool B. needs a loan to buy her husband a donkey cart; and Naseeba B. is a widow who wants a loan to buy her son a rickshaw on installments.

loans.use: Expand clothing sales business

loans.name: Ntenjeru Tubeere Bumu Group

texts.en: Being a businessman has helped Zeblon, the chairperson, succeed. The 54 year old resident of Ntenjeru in Kayunga district is a farmer who raises cassava, maize and banana on his 3 acre plantation. He is married with 12 children of which 1 is at Kyambogo University, 2 in secondary school and 2 in primary school while 6 are out doing their own businesses. He has been in business for six years and the loans have helped him on his plantation, especially with paying manpower.  He has gotten high quality yields that generate enough income to buy sacks of charcoal from far away villages for sale at a profit. And this being a rainy season, the price of charcoal is high to his advantage. He intends to buy more bags of charcoal with this loan. He is so committed and hard working and all members agree that the previous loans have helped them rise from the rugs.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and pay manpower on his plantations.

loans.name: Asha Bakari Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Asha B. is 22 years old and is a single woman. Asha owns a small shop, which she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 8am to 7.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Asha has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in charcoal and fire wood selling and food vending.

loans.use: to buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato is a man that loves and values nature. Ever since he was a young man, he has dedicated himself to agriculture and ranching. His economic situation did now allow him to pursue higher education, but he has always tried and keeps on trying to exert himself to improve his quality of life. In this way, he hopes to provide the opportunity to become professionals to his three youngest children. With love, patience, and the support of his family, every morning Fortunato dedicates himself to caring for this cattle to later process their nutritious milk into delicious cheeses to sell in the city of Ayaviri.

In addition to this work, he dedicates himself to agriculture, and activity that he has managed to keep up and improve his quality of life. Now, due to the inclement weather, Fortunato wishes to look ahead and purchase fodder to feed his calves and lambs. Consider that with this investment, he will have the assurance of food for his little animals during these hard times. Your indispensible help will allow Fortunato to face these difficult times.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Fortunato es un hombre que ama y valora la naturaleza, desde muy niño se ha dedicado a la agricultura y ganadería, sus posibilidades económicas no le permitieron seguir estudios superiores, pero ha siempre tratado y sigue tratando de esforzarse para mejorar su calidad de vida y así darles la oportunidades de convertirse en profesionales de éxito a sus 3 menores hijos.Con mucho cariño y paciencia durante todas las mañanas con el apoyo de toda su familia don Fortunato se dedica a ordeñar sus vaquitas para luego procesar su nutriente leche y elaborar con dedicación y paciencia deliciosos quesos para venderlos en la ciudad de Ayaviri. Adicionalmente a esta labor se dedica a la agricultura, actividad con la que esta logrando sostener y mejorar su calidad de vida.Pero ahora, viendo las inclemencias del tiempo Fortunato desea prevenir y comprar forraje para la alimentación de sus becerritas y corderitos, considera que con esta inversión tendrá asegurada la provisión de sus animalitos para tiempos difíciles. Tu indispensable aporte permitirá afrontar difíciles momentos a don Fortunato.

loans.use: Purchase fodder to feed his calves during this scarce season

loans.name: Rose's Mbele Kwambele Group

texts.en:
Rose is 36 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 13 and 5 years old. Rose has been selling food since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Joyce, Tatu, Hamida and Mary, who sell milk and soft drinks.

loans.use: To buy more food itemsfor her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of a wide range of products for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana T., 46, is married with 5 children and lives in Fusi Safata, Samoa. She has been growing taro for 4 years and selling it to the public and villagers 2 days per week. Her husband helps her on her plantation and also runs a taxi.

This will be Susana's first loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (US$291). SPBD loans are Susana’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This loan will be used to purchase agricultural chemicals and to repair Susana's house.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural chemicals

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 55-year-old married mother of 8 children. She buys vegetables such as sukuma wiki (kale), onions, and tomatoes in bulk and sells them to her clients in small quantities. She requires a US$500 loan to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more stock of vegetables for sale

loans.name: Amelamedji

texts.fr: Amelamedji Mawussé est propriétaire et gérante d’un bar-restaurant à Kpalimé, une ville située au sud-ouest du Togo à 120 Km de Lomé la capitale Togolaise. Agée de 33 ans, Mawussé est mariée et mère de deux enfants et a acquis une expérience très riche en art de cuisine et de service ce qu’elle pratique depuis une certaine période. Avec cette chance de Kiva et ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, elle désire faire davantage de stock de tubercules, de mais pour les plats de « fufu » et de la pâte, et aussi des boucs pour mieux satisfaire ses clients. Elle apprécie cette opportunité qui lui permettra de participer plus à la prise en charges des besoins de la famille par les profits qu’elle va dégager.
texts.en:
Amelamedji Mawussé is the proprietor and manager of a pub in Kpalimé, a town situated in the southwest of Togo, 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Mrs. Mawussé, 33, is married and the mother of two children. She has acquired a lot of varied experience in the art of cooking and serving meals which she has been working at for quite some time.

With the chance that Kiva offers and this third loan from FECECAV, she would like to stock more yams, maize to make "fufu", and also some goats to better satisfy the demand of her clientele. She appreciates this opportunity which will allow her to participate more fully in supporting her family through the profit she will earn.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing yams, sacks of maize, and goats

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. M. is a 50-year-old wife and mother, with six children. She is resourceful and very enterprising. She has supported three children through high school with her business. The other three are currently in school. She is a food vendor and sells local foods like "kenkey and fish". Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains and eaten with hot pepper or fried fish.  Many people enjoy it as breakfast, lunch and supper. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to afford her production expenditure. This has affected production quality adversely. She needs the loan to inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and maintain quality as well. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like maize, fish, vegetables and firewood. Grace is a member of a group called "Nyame Mma" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like maize, fish, vegetables, vegetable oil and firewood.

loans.name: Raida Paulina

texts.en:
Raida Paulina C. O. is a member of her community bank, Llapanchik, which is Quechuan for “everyone together”. Raida lives in Ayacucho with her husband and two children 18 & 16. Raida and her family work daily at a small store which is in their house.

She will use her loan of 1600 soles to increase her business and invest in it by purchasing groceries including milk, oil, corn and rice to sell from her store. She is currently saving for her dream of sending her children to the University where they can earn their degree and become professionals.

loans.use: To increase her business and invest by purchasing groceries including milk, oil, corn and rice to sell from her store.

loans.name: Paulina António

texts.pt:
Paulina António M. é natural da cidade de Maputo no bairro chamanculo, tem 40 anos de idade, é separada mãe de um filho com 10 anos de idade e estuda na 5ªclasse, para alem do seu filho sustenta a sua mãe e um sobrinho que vivem juntos.

Paulina estudou até 10ªclasse e parou por situações sociais, logo que teve problemas para continuar com os estudos, juntou se com pai do seu filho e juntos viveram durante 8 anos, pois isto ela volta a casa da mãe e por sua vez a mãe corta uma área de terreno para ela construir a sua casinha onde vive até data hoje.

Paulina neste momento vive de negocio onde consiste na venda electrodomésticos, as quais adquira na Africa do sul com destaques aos T.V, assim compra uma T.V pequena por 450 rands e vende por 1800,00mt e compra T.V grande por 600 rands e vende por 2800,00mt, desta forma consegue mensalmente 36000,00mt das vendas e poupa 5000,00mt.

Paulina com este empréstimo pretende aumentar a sua mercadoria e este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de melhorar as suas condições habitacionais.
texts.en:
Paulina António M. is a native of the city of Maputo in the Chamanculo district. She is 40 years old, separated, and the mother of a 10 year-old son who is in the 5th grade. Besides her son she also supports her mother and a nephew who live together. Paulina studied until the 10th grade and stopped because of social situations. As soon as she had problems continuing with her studies she got together with the father of her son and they lived together for 8 years. After that she returned to her mother's home and her mother cleared an area of land for her to construct a little house where she lives today. Paulina makes a living from a business that consists of selling household appliances which she acquires in South Africa. Her focus is on Televisions. She purchases a small T.V. for 450 rands and sells it for 1,800MT and purchases a large T.V for 600 rands and sells it for 2,800MT. In this way she is able to make 36,000MT monthly from her sales and save 5,000MT. Paulina intends to use this loan to increase her merchandise. This is her first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. She intends to pay it off before the term so she can solicit another loan to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of household appliances

loans.name: Fortaleza Divina Group

texts.es:
hola nosotros somos el Grupo Fortaleza Divina, somos personas luchadoras, responsables y con muchos deseos de superarnos y salir adelante, todos vivimos cerca y tenemos mucha experiencia en nuestras actividades diaras.
nuestro grupo se forma de esta manera:
Henry S.: soy el cordinador del grupo y me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de cuadros de pintura, tengo muchos clientes, mi obras la mayoria son por encargo pero tambien salgo a vender en las afueras de los hoteles mas prestigiosos de nuestra ciudad capital.
Doña Fermina elabora y vende baleadas ella tiene una pequeña galera en la esquina de su casa, ella tiene muchos clientes ya que su negocio esta muy cerca de una escuela.
el Señor Jorge L. se dedica a la reparacion de articulos electricos como ser estufas, televisores, refrigeradoras y otros, cuenta con un pequeño taller y de esta manera sale adelante con su familia.
todos en estos momentos necesitamos de un credito para sacar adelante nuestros negocios por tal razon estamos solicitando del mismo.
texts.en:
Hello. We are the “Fortaleza Divina” (Divine Strength) Group. We are hard-working, responsible people with great desire to improve ourselves and be successful. We leave near each other and we have a lot of experience in our daily professions. Our group is made up of following people: Henry S.: I am the coordinator of the group and I make and sell paintings. I have many customers. My works are primarily commissioned but I also sell outside of the most pretigious hotels of our capital city. Fermina makes and sells “baleadas” (a typical Honduran dish similar to a burrito). She has a small stand on the corner near her home. She has many customers as her business is very close to a school. Mr. Jorge L. repairs electronic items like stoves, televisions, refrigerators among others. He has a small shop and in this way supports his family. Today we all need a loan to help grow our businesses so therefore we are asking for one at this time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for each of our businesses

loans.name: Khafiz

texts.en: Khafiz M. is a hard-working man. Over the last 13 years, he has been focused on strengthening the family business – sheep sales – so he can provide for his children. Khafiz has a wife and three daughters who always try to help each other and to help him with the business. Now Khafiz has decided to expand his business raising animals in order to increase his profit. He will care for the animals for a short period of time and then sell them at his city's large stock shows. Therefore, he has requested 1,200 USD for the term of 15 months.

loans.use: Purchase ten sheep

loans.name: Miriam Marleny

texts.es:
Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Miriam es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Miriam junto a su mama tienen un restaurante llamado Don José, actividad que realiza todos los días, durante todo el día, para lo cual cuenta con 8 personas que se encargan de la cocina y atención.
Miriam necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Miriam son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y tener un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Miriam is a partner of the Banco Comunal Morenita II. Miriam lives with her significant other; she is 30 and has two children. She, along with her mother, have a restaurant called “Don Jose”; activity that Miriam does every day, all day long, helped by 8 people who take care of the kitchen and customer attendance. Miriam needs a loan of 600 soles which will be used to buy rice and sugar. Miriam’s dreams are for her children to finish school and to have her own business.


Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Nancy Delfina

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando.
Nancy es casada, tiene 35 años, dos hijos de 14 y 3 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Nancy se dedica a la venta de tamales, es un negocio familiar, sus padres hacían tamales, ella creció viéndolos trabajar y a la edad de siete años ella ayudaba, actualmente ella y su hermano tomaron el negocio, tienen diez trabajadores, hacen dos mil tamales semanales. 
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para la compra de maíz, hoja de plátano, achote, ajonjolí.
En Finca encontró gran ayuda gracias a los prestamos que realizan, pudo invertir y comprar varias cosas para su negocio, compro su cocina a gas, encuentra en el Bancomunal compañerismo, tiene muchas amigas.
El sueño de Nancy es crecer como micro empresaria.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the “Mujeres Progresando” (“Women Making Advances”) cooperative bank. Nancy is married, 35 years old, and the mother of two children ages 14 and 3 who attend the state school. Nancy dedicates herself to the sale of tamales, which is a family business. Her parents made tamales, and she grew up watching them work and started helping them at seven years of age. Currently, her and her brother have the business. They have ten workers and make two thousand tamales per week. Nancy needs a loan of 1200 soles to purchase corn, banana leaves, achote (annato, a spice), and sesame seeds. In Finca, she found a great deal of assistance thanks to the loans they helped her obtain. She was able to invest in her business and purchase a number of items for her endeavor, such as a gas stove. She finds companionship in the bank, and has many friends there. Nancy’s dream is to grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nancy needs a loan of 1200 soles to purchase corn, banana leaves, achote (a spice), and sesame seeds.

loans.name: Susan

texts.es: Susan tiene 20 años, vive en la casa de sus padres con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a los bordados, trabajo que realiza en su  casa durante todo el día después de atender a sus pequeños. Luego de trabajar durante un mes, vende toda su producción, por medio de su hermana que se dedica a llevar sus bordados a quienes los solicitan, generalmente existe mayor durante las diversas festividades típicas de la zona. Susan ha notado que con el correr del tiempo los ingresos para su hogar se han ido incrementando debido al esfuerzo que realiza con sus bordados.  Es por ello, que para el futuro quiere seguir dedicándose a esta actividad produciendo cada vez más, y para ello también comprara un puesto de venta donde ofrecer sus bordados. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, por su parte se compromete a ser una persona muy diligente en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en sus bordados, va a comprar telas y pagará una parte de lo que cuesta adquirir su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Susan is 20 years old and lives in her parents' house with her husband and their two children. She has been embroidering for three years, working from home during the day after taking care of her little ones. After working for a month, she sells everything she's made through her sister, who takes the embroideries to people who request them. There tends to be more demand during the region's various festivals. Susan has noticed that over time her household earnings have grown thanks to her embroidery work. Because of that, she'd like to continue this work in the future and produce greater quantities. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to being responsible with her payments. She will use the requested loan for her embroidery, buying fabric and paying a portion of the cost of securing a market stall.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for her embroidery

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is married to Martin and they have six children. She runs a business selling food in the local Belo Market in her village. With this Kiva loan, Bridget intends to purchase bags of beans, corn and Irish (potatoes) for resale.

Having a good location in the market and knowing the popularity of her produce, Bridget is confident that her business will be successful. With her first loan from GHAPE she purchased similar items and did well repaying the loan. With the proceeds from her last loan she expanded her business.

Bridget mentions that she lives in tough circumstances, always “suffering in the hands of thieves.” She also had to experience the passing of her child. She wants to be able to provide for her children now. With the profits from this loan, Bridget wants to pay for her children’s school fees and hopes to continue expanding her business. GHAPE loans are good for Bridget because the conditions are agreeable to her.


About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase beans, corn and Irish (potatoes) for resale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam S. bakes and sells bread to customers. She is 38 years old and married to a peasant. Mariam has no children at all. In order to enhance her business, she requests a loan to purchase necessary materials for baking bread. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she will be able to purchase a bus that will she will use for her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase baking bread materials.

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar M. Arshad Group

texts.en:
Parveen akhtar baji is a 30-year-old lady who has resided in Multan, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Her husband's name is M. A. and he has a business selling embroidered scarves. He buys scarves from the cloth shops, sells to the community and earns an income. Parveen baji performs her duties as a mother and as a wife very efficiently. Her family is very happy with her good nature. She is applying for a loan to buy scarves to expand her husband’s scarf-selling business. 

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality. Mumtaz ilahi baji and Hashmat baji each want a loan to buy scrap for their scrap business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy scarves to sell

loans.name: Rufina Antonia

texts.es: Rufina Antonia M. D. R. vive el municipio D. Soyapango ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Rufina tiene  40 años D. edad, tiene dos hijos Geraldina D. 21 años D. edad que está cursando 2do año D. bachillerato y José D. 12 años D. edad  que estudia 6to grado. Rufina es una madre muy trabajadora para sacar adelante a su hijos, ella se dedica a la confección D. ropa y para aumentar sus ingresos los días sábado y domingo elabora almuerzos y pupusas, este crédito ella lo solicita por que quiere comprar tela para fabricar prendas D. vestir y también quiere comprar suficiente materia prima para la elaboración D. las pupusas.
texts.en:
Rufina Antonia M. D. R. lives in municipality of Soyapango located in the department of San Salvador. Rufina is 40 years old, and has two children; Geraldina is 21 years old and in her 2nd year of high school, and José who is 12 years old is in 6th graD.. Rufina is a mother who works hard to get her children ahead in life; she dedicates herself to making clothing and to increase her income she sells lunches and pupusas (a stuffed thick tortilla like El Salvadorian dish) on Saturdays and Sundays. This loan that she has solicited is to purchase fabrics to make clothing, and she would also like to purchase enough basic materials to make pupusas.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic materials.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma M. is from the town of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 35 years old. Norma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a business venture in the transportation services sector operating a cart pulled by a horse, which is called a "kalesa" business. "Kalesa" is one of the oldest forms of transportation in the Philippines. It helps in providing transportation services to local community members.  
 
Norma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting a new loan of PHP 5000, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the  loan taken out by Norma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. The loan was also a big help in providing daily allowances for her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Bellas Flores Group

texts.es: El grupo “Bellas Flores” están representados  por la señora Georgina y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales realizan diferentes actividades como la venta D. frazadas, abarrotes, motos, ropa, comida y otros se dedican al transporte público D. pasajeros en zonas urbanas. Son socias con bastante experiencia en el rubro por lo que no tienen mucho temor a la competencia del mercado pero si les interesa crecer en sus negocios para tener la capacidad D. brindarles a sus hijos una mejor educación y una mejor calidad D. vida. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos, mercadería y para el mejoramiento D. sus herramientas D. trabajo que coadyuvaran a mejorar sus ingresos diarios. Todas las socias del grupo tienen experiencia  en grupos solidarios gracias  a los trabajos con instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen D. la responsabilidad y la solidaridad que se requiere para obtener un financiamiento bajo esta modalidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Goergina is the representative for the group “Bellas Flores.” This group has twelve members who work in different areas like selling blankets, groceries, motorcycles, clothing, and food. Others proviD. transportation for passengers in urban areas. These members have a lot of experience in their fields, which is why they are not afraid of competition. They would, however, like to grow their businesses in order to proviD. their children with better educations and an improved quality of life. The loans will be used to buy supplies and merchandise, and also to improve the tools of their trades which will help them make more money. All the members of the group have experience with solidarity groups because they have worked with similar organizations. They understand their responsibilities and that they have to work together to get loans

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is fifty-three years old. She is married and has given birth to nine children, some of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming and commercial town in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana.

Adwoa is a trader. She trades in fresh groundnut and spices such as pepper. She supplies mostly local restaurant operators in her community and also sells at her local market. Adwoa treks to other towns to sell on their market days as well.

She has been in business for twenty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to make more profit. She aspires to give all her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy groundnut and pepper.

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
BOLDBAATAR D. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. He has three sons, two of whom are university students; the youngest is in kindergarten. He has run a taxi business since 2006 and has gained much experience in the last three years.

During this time, his business has been quite successful, as Boldbaatar has increased his working capital from 250,000 to 1,000,000 MNT. He must operate the business as well as pay his sons' tuition fees from his profit and savings. He is requesting a loan in order to increase his available working capital and purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.use: purchase  spare parts for his car

loans.name: Mujeres De Combate (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El BANCO COMUNAL MUJERES DE COMBATE esta conformado por 7 socias emprendedoras y seguras de lo que desean en la vida, viven en el barrio de Huizhil perteneciente a la parroquia Baños, a unos 20 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, es uno de muchos lugares hermosos que tiene la ciudad,  teniendo una vegetación exuberante y tierras fértiles para el cultivo, su gente es muy amable y calida como nuestras socias quienes nos brindan sus testimonios.

La Sra. Olga perteneciente al banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, vive en Huizhil, tiene 37 años de edad, casada  fruto de su amor procreo 5 hijos de 18, 14, 13, 11, 9 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian, su hijo mayor ingresa este año a la universidad Estatal de Cuenca, su hija se encuentra estudiando en el colegio Garaicoa, y sus 3 últimos hijos en la escuela de la comunidad.

El esposo de Rosa Olga trabaja en la construcción y se apoyan en las buenas y en las malas. Olga tiene un negocio de helados y lleva trabajando desde que tenía 14 años de edad, comenzó a vender de otras personas hasta llegar ha tener su propio puesto de helados.
Nos cuenta que le va muy bien por que vende en el bar de la escuela de su comunidad, también realiza entregas en tiendas. Además tiene otro negocio  en su casa de crianza de unos pocos animales.

El préstamo que realiza en la fundación es para la compra de un refrigerador por la demanda que tiene de sus helados y además  necesita para ampliar su negocio.

El sueño de Rosa Olga es ver a todos sus hijos terminar los estudios superiores y ser buenos profesionales.

La Sra.María Gregoria es una socia activa del banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, vive en el Barrio el Paraíso que pertenece a al parroquia Baños, tiene 54 años de edad, esta casada y procreo 5 hijos de 38, 35, 33, 30, 28 años de edad, todos sus hijos se encuentran casados y viven independientemente cada uno con la familia que formaron. Viven en casa propia que es fruto del esfuerzo y  trabajo de su juventud, su esposo es su mejor amigo y compañero, el es quien le ayuda en su negocio.

Gregoria es comerciante de ropa, tiene un puesto propio en el centro comercial de la feria libre de Cuenca, trabaja hace muchos años en su local, su horario de trabajo es de 9 a.m. a 6:30 pm

Trabajó con la Fundación Espoir unos 4 años se retiro por un corto tiempo y de nuevo regresa por los buenos beneficios que obtiene y su facilidad de pago que le brindan.

El préstamo que realiza es para la ampliación de su negocio comprando más mercadería para damas, caballeros y niños,  surtiéndole mucho más, su sueño es de ya no tener deudas.

La Sra. María de Lourdes Minchalo vive en Huzhil y se integro a las socias del banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, tiene 47 años, es soltera y nunca llego a casarse, nos cuenta que mejor es estar sola que mal acompañada, vive con su mamá que tiene 74 años de edad, no viven en una casa propia.

María se dedica a la venta de granos  tierno y maduro como arveja, poroto, maíz, etc, y también a la venta de verduras y frutas de la región y otras ciudades. Esta actividad  la realiza desde la edad de 15 años en las afueras del mercado de la feria libre en Cuenca los días miércoles, sábado y domingo siendo su horario de 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, con nostalgia  nos dice que no ha llegado a tener un puesto propio.

Este es  su primer crédito en la fundación y espera realizar  más créditos de acuerdo a sus necesidades. El préstamo que realiza es para la compra de verduras, frutas, granos y otros productos de la región y de otros lugares y tener un mayor surtido para ofrecer a sus clientes, también para la compra de medicamentos para su mamá que por su avanzada edad sufre de algunas enfermedades

Su sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia y un carro para salir a otras comunidades con su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres de Combate" is formed by 7 hard-working women who are sure of what they want in life. They live in the Huizhil neighborhood, in the Baños parish, about 20 minutes outside of the city of Cuenca. It is one of the many beautiful areas in the city, with lush vegetation and fertile land for cultivating. The people are kind and warm, like our members who give us their testimonies.

Sra. Olga, a member of the "Mujeres de Combate," lives in Huizhil. She is 37 years old, and married with 5 children, who are 18, 14, 13, 11, and 9 years old. All of her children are students.
