Her oldest son entered the State University of Cuenca this year. Her daughter is in the Garaicoa school, and her other three children are in their community school.

Rosa Olga's husband works in construction, and they support each other in good times and in bad. Olga has an ice cream business, and has been working since she was 14 years old. She began to sell for other people until she could have her own ice cream stand.

She tells us that it is going well because she can sell int he snack bar in her community school. She also sells to stores. In addition, she has another business in her home, taking care of some animals.

Her loan will be used to buy a refrigerator because of the demand for her ice cream, and because she needs it to grow her business.

Rosa Olga's dream is to see all her children finish higher education and become professionals.

Sra.María Gregoria is an active member of the communal bank. She lives in the Paraíso neighborhood, in the parish of Baños. She is 54 years old, married, and has five children, who are 38, 35,33,30, and 28 years old. All her chilren are married and live independently with their families. She lives in her own home, which is the result of her effort and work in her youth. Her husband is her best friend, and he helps her with her business.

Gregoria sells clothing. She has her own stand in the commercial center of Cuenca. She has been working for many years in that place. She works from 9 am to 6:30 pm.

She worked with the Espoir Foundation for four years. She left for a short time, but has come back again for the benefits she can receive, and for the ease of payments they provide.

The loan she requested is to increase her business, buying more merchandise for women, men, and children, with a greater variety. Her dream is to not have any debts.

Sra. María de Lourdes Minchalo lives in Huizhil, and joined the members of this communal bank. She is 47 years old, and has never been married. She says that it is better to be alone than in bad company. She lives with her mother, who is 74 years old, and they do not have their own home.

María sells soft and hard grains, like peas, beans, corn, etc. She also sells vegetables and fruits from her region and other cities. She has been doing this since she was 15, in the outskirts of the market in Cuenca, on Wednesdays, Saturday, and Sundays. She works from 6 am to 6 pm, but she tells us that she has not been able to have her own stand.

This is her first loan with the foundation, and she hopes to get more loans as she needs them. The loan is to buy vegetables, fruit, grains, and other products from the region and from other places, so she has a greater assortment to offer her customers. She will also buy some medication for her mother, who suffers some illnesses due to her age.

Her dream is to have her own home, and a car to go to other communities with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase their businesses by buying a refrigerator; assorted clothing for women, men, and children; vegetables, grains, fruits, etc.; offering a more varied stock for their customers

loans.name: Edicely

texts.es:
Edicely tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de refrescos en una de las calles principales de su ciudad. Sus herramientas de trabajo son: un balde, un cucharón y vasos, al inicio de su negocio no contaba con un lugar fijo de ventas y caminaba largas horas por diferentes lugares de su localidad. Pero ahora ya tiene una zona donde ofrece diariamente deliciosos refrescos y debido a la calidad de sus bebidas, Edicely ha adquirido clientes regulares, por quienes se anima a seguir mejorando en su negocio.
Esta es la quinta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona muy activa en su banco comunal y lo que la caracteriza es la puntualidad en el cumplimiento de sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de una carreta de ventas y un balde nuevo para seguir vendiendo sus refrescos.
texts.en:
Edicely is 26 years old and lives with her husband and 4 kids in their own house. Since she was 12 she's been selling refreshments at one of her town's main street for a living. Her work tools are: a bucket, a ladle, and glasses. At the beginning of her business, she didn't have a fixed place and used to walk for hours around her community seeling her beverages. Now she has a specific spot where she offers her delicious refreshments every day, and because the quality is so good, she has gained some regular clients, which brings her the enthusiasm to keep improving her business. This is the 5th time she takes a loan from MFP and she is very punctual in making the payments. The loan she's asking will be used to buy a beverage selling cart and a new bucket so she can keep selling her refreshments.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a beverage selling cart and other tools for her business

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Maria es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Maria vende cosméticos por catálogos, que ofrece a amigos y familiares, además Maria prepara harina de cereales que prepara en su casa y los vende a pedido.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Maria sueña con tener un puesto para vender sus productos y tener una casa propia.

loans.use: Para la compra de cereales.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina M. is from the village of Bayabason, Maramag Bukidnon. She is 39 years old and married with three school-age children. To make a living, Fedelina sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Fedelina has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Fedelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fedelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Fedelina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fedelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Can Wange Pe Alanyo Jenniffer Group

texts.en: A. Jenniffer is the representative of this loan group. She is married with four children, three of whom go to school. For the past six years Jenniffer has had a business selling smoked fish. She is requesting a loan to add capital into her business by purchasing fish to sell direct to customers and also in the market place. She is a promising businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To add capital into her business by purchasing fish for resale

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience sells groceries and drinks. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is an energetic woman and she is optimistic about the growth of her business. Patience is 38 years old and happily married. Her husband is a trader. They live in Edo State, Nigeria.

Patience hopes to make more profit during this high season. She applied for a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredient for her café business.

loans.name: Romulo, Jr

texts.en:
Romulo P. Jr. is a 62-year-old married man who lives in the village of Sitio Buhi-an, Brgy To-oy, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. He earns his living by selling fish, and owning and operating three motorcycle tricycles, a rice farm and a fish pond.

Romulo’s wife, Erlinda, helps him run the business.  They have eight adult children who also help in increasing the family income by engaging in driving of the motorcycles. 

Romulo joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 in the hope that he would be able to improve the quality of life of his family. With the help of his loans  from NWTF-PD, he has been able to increase his family's income by engaging in fish vending, driving three tricycles, and running the rice farm and a fish pond.  Now, he earns an average monthly income of Php 90,000 from his business activities.

Romulo is a member of good standing. His previous loan of Php 29,000 was used to fund operations of his fish pond, rice farm and fish vending, and had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now, he is borrowing his seventh loan in the amount of Php 29,000, which he  intends to use on the fish vending business and motorcycle operations. Romulo is working hard to achieve his dreams and aspirations for his family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of  thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program,  NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" -- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for motorcycle and fish vending

loans.name: Mrs. Yan Prach Village Bank Group

texts.en: This is a village bank loan consisting of seventeen people who live in Smau Khchei village in TaK. province. Mrs. Yan P. is the elected village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a 0.5 hectare field of land where she cultivates rice. She is also a pig breeder. Since her breeding pig business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing another pig for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Nu Non, is a driver who make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Yan P. is the mother of four children who are all enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a pig for breeding.

loans.name: Arminda Esperanza

texts.es:
la sra Arminda Esperanza M. C. tiene un puesto de venta de variedad en ropa para caballeros, damas y niños. Su negocio esta ubicado en el Boulevar de esta ciudad de Danli frente al estadio,  Arminda tiene 6 seis años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar.
Doña Arminda es una mujer luchadora ya que anteriormente laboraba para una fabrica de tabacos despues 
tomo la desición de dedicarse al negocio, ya que el trabajo en la fabrica le perjudicaba la salud.
Es soltera por viudes, su esposo fallecio hace 4 años y  quedo a cargo del hogar con 2 hijos que con 
esfuerzos y ganancias de su negocio les ha brindado el estudio y ahora sus hijos son profesionales. 
el año pasado con las ganancias que le genero el mismo se compro un vehiculo que lo utiliza para su negocio y ha mejorado su vivienda.
texts.en:
Arminda Esperanza M. C. has a stand where she sells a variety of clothing for men, women, and children. Her business is located on the boulevard in the city of Danli in front of the stadium. Arminda has been doing this type of work for six years. It is notable that during this time she has known how to run the business. Arminda is a fighter who previously worked for a tobacco factory. Later she made the decision to devote herself to business because working in the factory damaged her health. She is widowed, and therefore single. Her husband died four years ago, and she was left with the responsibility of a household with two children. With effort and the earnings from her business she educated her children, and they are now professionals. Last year she used the earnings she generated to buy a vehicle that she uses for her business, and she has improved her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants, skirts, blouses, children's outfits,  underwear, sports t-shirts, socks, and ankle supports

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr: K. Agnès est née en 1960 à Comé, dans le departement du Mono. Agnès est divorcée et vit depuis 3 ans au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, capitale économique de Bénin.  Agnès vit avec ses deux enfants, tous scolarisés.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Agnès vend des tissus, par le système de distribution.   Agnès n’a jamais été à l’école. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Agnès s’approvisionne. Agnès exerce cette activité depuis environs 10 ans.  Elle a déjà obtenu des crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Agnès sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé pour acheter des tissus et éventuellement d’autres marchandises.  Un jour, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Agnès K. was born in 1960 in Comé, in the Mono region. She is divorced and has been living in the Zogbo quarter of Cotonou, Benin´s economic capital, for the past 3 years. She lives with her two children, both of whom attend school. In order to meet her family´s needs, Agnès sells fabric via a distribution network. She did not attend school herself. She sources her goods from Benin´s international market, and has been involved in this business for the past ten years. She has already received loans from ALIDé, all of which have been repaid. Agnès is seeking another loan from ALIDé in order to purchase more fabric, and eventually other merchandise. One day she would like to buy a plot of land.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fabric

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes del Socorro Z. posee un tramo en el merado central de Chinandega de venta de refrescos desayunos y almuerzos, su financiamiento lo ocupo para terminar de remodelar su negocio ya que dio a hacer un portón para su tramo y lo dio a pintar.

La señora Z. es comerciante desde hace 40 años viene al mercado a las seis y media de la mañana y se va a las cuatro de la tarde siempre la viene a dejar su esposo y tiene una sobrina que le ayuda en su negocio.

Ella inicio su negocio con capital propio  de C$ 5,000.00 con una cuenta de ahorro que tenia en el banco popular antes ella era ama de casa  es casada, tiene cuatro años y medio de trabajar con ceprodel, doña Mercedita dijo que se sentía muy agradecida con estos créditos por que le han ayudado a crecer su negocio
texts.en:
Mercedes del Socorro Z. has a stall in the central market of Chinandega. She sells soft drinks, breakfast, and lunch. She used the loan to finish remodeling her business. She had a door made for her stall and she painted. Mrs. Z. has been a merchant for 40 years. She arrives at the market at six thirty in the morning, and she leaves at four in the afternoon. Her husband always drops her off, and she has a niece who helps her in the business. She started her business with 5,000 NIO, which she had in a savings account in a popular bank. Before that she was a housewife. She is married. She has been working with Ceprodel for four and a half years. Mercedita said that she is very grateful for these loans because they have helped her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel her business and buy sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy crates of eggs to stock her business

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: Maria Francisa tiene la edad de 67 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosa de horno y destace de cerdo, pues siempre ha buscado la manera de mejorar sus ingresos. Esta no es la primera vez que tiene experiencias con financiamientos por lo que sus experiencias han sido muy importantes para el crecimiento de su negocio.  Hace más de 31 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que dio inicio desde muy joven y fue por iniciativa propia ya que su esposo había fallecido y estaba buscando la forma de generar sus ingresos. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de leña, maíz, queso, mantequilla entre otras cosas. Sueña con obtener otro medio de ingreso.
texts.en:
Maria Francisa is 67 years old. She dedicates herself to selling baked goods and is a butcher. She has always looked for a way to increase her income. This is not the first time that Maria has had experience with financing. Her experiences have been very important for the growth of her business. She has dedicated herself to this business for more than 31 years. She took the initiative to begin the business when she was very young and her husband had passed away and she was looking for a way to generate income. Currently, Maria is requesting this financing for working capital to buy firewood, corn, cheese, butter, and other goods. Her dream is to obtain another source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mously

texts.fr: Mously N. est âgée de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Ses 7 ans et demi d'existence dans le Banc Villageois de DANKH-SENE lui on permis d'avoir une bonne expérience en matière de crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, avec son prêt elle achète deux bœufs qu'elle engraisse pendant 4 ou 5 mois et revend dans les marchés hebdomadaires.
texts.en:
Mously N. is 36 years old, married and the mother of five children. After 7 ½ years in the DANKH-SENE “Banc Villageois” loan group, she has acquired a solid experience in credit loans. She fattens cattle, and with this loan intends to buy two oxen for fattening during 4-5 months, after which they will be resold in local markets.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reinforce and promote her cattle-fattening activity

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 37 años, es una mujer muy noble y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus suegros junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace  mas de 10 años se dedica a la compra y venta de quesos, con ayuda de su hija, quien se encarga de verificar las cuentas al por mayor del negocio. Cada vez que acude a sus proveedores, se asegura que esté en buenas condiciones el producto, para luego ser distribuidas al cliente, que la esperan cada dos veces por semana en sus domicilios.  Ella está muy contenta con su negocio, porque le permite cuidar a su familia. Hay momentos en que no ha logrado vender toda la mercadería, por lo que el producto pierde su calidad. En adelante planea comprarse una refrigeradora con nevera amplia, de esa manera lograr conservar los quesos. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido nuevamente en ser responsable en sus cuotas. En su grupo solidario, es una compañera muy respetada. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá incrementar el capital de su negocio, por que sabe que cuanto más clientes tenga, mayores serán sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosario is 37 years old. She is very hard working and ethical, and lives in her in-law’s house with her husband and three children. For over 10 years, Rosario has been buying and selling cheeses with the help of her daughter, who is in charge of checking the wholesale accounts of the business. With every visit to the suppliers, she makes sure that the product is in good condition, in order for subsequent distribution to the customer, whom she then visits twice a week in their homes. Rosario is very happy with her business as it allows her to take care of her family. There are times when she hasn’t managed to sell all her merchandise, which means the product can no longer be sold. In the future, Rosario plans to buy a refrigerator with a sufficiently sized cool box in which she can store her cheeses. This is her twelfth loan with MFP, and she has once again made the commitment to honour the terms of the loan repayments. In the cooperative, Rosario is a much respected member. The loan she seeks will allow her to increase business revenue, as Rosario knows that the more customers she has, the more profit is made.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cheeses.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a citizen of a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She has been living in it with her family for over fifteen years. Her husband's name is M. M. who is involved in an ice selling business. He sells ice in different shops and markets. He provides them with ice blocks two times per day and generates income for his family. He has been doing this work for the last six years. 

Naseem is a very caring lady. She stays at home and does household work. She is fond of cooking and cooks delicious and healthy food for her family. She is applying for a loan from Asasah for her husband so he can purchase more ice blocks and increase the profit of his business.

loans.use: Purchase ice blocks to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida A. is from the village of Malalinta. She is 47 years old. Leonida is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonida operates a motorcycle transport service. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Leonida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. The previous loan was used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be Leonida's fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Kuña Tory Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre  Kuña Tory, se conformó en fecha 28 de Octubre del 2.008, con mucho esfuerzo y esmero ya en el 3º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Catalina  S. quien se dedica al lavado de ropas para ayudar a su familia con los gastos, nos comenta que con el crédito pudo comprar pudo un lavarropas con el su trabajo se aliviana bastante además de lavar mayor cantidad de ropas.
 Ella       nos comenta que mediante este trabajo la economía de la familia mejoró bastante ya que actualmente posee además del ingreso de su marido quien se dedica a la pesca y venta de pescado.
texts.en:
The Woman's Committee named Kuña Tory was created on October 28th, 2008. Thanks to much effort, it is in its 3rd cycle. One of its members is Mrs. Catalina S., who works washing clothes in order to help her family with expenditures. With her previous loans Catalina was able to buy a washing machine, which saved her time and allowed her to wash more clothes. Catalina reports that, thanks to previous loans, her family is much better off and earns a higher income in conjunction with Catalina's husband's income from selling fish.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine

loans.name: San Jose De Chupaca Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal San José D. Chupaca ubicado en la Comunidad D. Chupaca, distrito D. Acoria en Huancavelica, el cual inicia su segundo ciclo con 12 socias, las cuales se dedican a diferenctes actividades comerciales y agricolas en la Región.

Gladys es socia y Presidenta del Bancomunal, es casada y tiene 04 hijos, todos varones, quienes se dedican a estudiar, pues anhelan ser profesionales. Gladys se dedica a la venta D. ganado, los cuales compra pequeños y los hace crecer fuertes y robustos, los cuales venD. en las ferias. Gladys, ahora que pertenece a Finca se siente más motivada a continuar trabajando. Gladys solicita un nuevo préstamo, con el cual quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, comprando mas ganado. El sueño D. Gladys es que su negocio sea granD. y rentable y tener una tienda en su casa.

Bertha es socia y Tesorera del Bancomunal, es casada y tiene 02 hijas, las cuales ya van a la escuela. Bertha se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, tienda que abrió hace 06 años y era la única en su comunidad, ahora su comunidad cuenta hasta con una feria. A Bertha le gusto la idea D. ahorrar y saber que siempre pueD. disponer D. ellos con Finca, se siente muy contenta D. pertenecer a su grupo comunal. El próximo préstamo que reciba Bertha lo invertirá en mercadería para su negocio. Bertha quiere tener la tienda mas granD. y con mas variedad  D. su comunidad.
texts.en:
The San José D. Chupaca communal bank is in Chupaca, Acoria, in Huancavelica. It’s starting its second cycle with 12 members who are in a variety of commercial and agricultural activities in the region. Gladys is a member and the president of the communal bank. She’s married and has four sons who are students because they want to become professionals. Gladys raises cattle. She buys them young and makes them grow strong and robust. She sells them at the livestock markets. Now that Gladys is a member of Finca she feels more motivated to continue working. She is asking for a new loan to invest in her business buying more cattle. Gladys’s dream is that her business be large and profitable and to have a store in her home. Bertha is a member and treasurer of the communal bank. She’s married and has two daughters who are in school. Bertha sells groceries in a store she opened 6 years ago when it was the only one in her community. Now, her community even has a market. Bertha liked the concept of savings and she knows that with Finca she can always count on them. She is happy to be part of a communal bank. The next loan Bertha receives will be used to buy stock merchandise for her store. Bertha wants to have the largest, best stocked store in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.es:
Lázaro tiene 63 años de edad, reside en el municipio El Divisadero, Departamento de Morazán, es soltero vive con una hermana y dos sobrinas, Es albañil (trabajador en construcción), y  también cultiva  maíz.
Durante la mañana trabaja de 7:00am- 1:00pm trabaja de albañil en construcción y por las tardes se dedica a la siembra de maíz. Lázaro solicita un préstamo para compra de  fertilizante que le permitirá obtener una mejor cosecha.
El sueño de Lázaro es ayudar a la hija para que termine los estudios y tenga un mejor sistema de vida.
texts.en:
Lázaro is 63 years old, he lives in the town of El Divisadero, in the Morazán department; he is single and lives with a sister and two nieces. He is a mason (he works in construction) and he also crops maize. Every morning he works as a mason from 7 am to 1 pm, in the evenings he engages in planting maize. Lázaro is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer that will help him obtain a better harvest. Lázaro’s dream is to help his nieces so that they can complete their studies and enjoy better life conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his maize crops.

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Man K. is an older woman and a widow. Man K. has learned how to combine different kinds of tree roots for natural medicines and she uses her knowledge to earn an income in order to meet the needs of the family. Man K. also travels to sell her medicine by walking around her community. She now has three single kids and two who are married and live away from home. Man K. is concerned that she is hardly walking to sell and she dreams of having a vehicle to pick up her medicine, but she doesn’t have money yet to buy one. Therefore, Man K. would like to borrow a loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Kyegwisa Bakyara Twimukye, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
Hard-working K. Ovia has, over the last 16 years, been overseeing her growing spare parts business in Kyegwisa trading center in Ibanda. With a monthly net profit of $107, this married lady has enjoyed the good graces that have come with running this lucrative business.

Consequently, she has made enormous progress in educating her four children, which is a concern in the family. Her first priority after acquiring this loan is to purchase more hardware inventory with the sole objective of turning her business into a big supply store for motorcycle and bicycle spare parts. This will help her earn more sales revenue to take care of her family's needs.

Ovia belongs to a group of members who hold each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for motorcycles and bicycles

loans.name: Xiomara Del Rosario

texts.es:
La joven XIOMARA DEL ROSARIO G. C. es comerciante y reside en el casco urbano del municipio de Condega.

Ella solicita un préstamo con el objetivo de comprar productos lácteos al por mayor para luego revenderlo y obtener una ganancia.

Ella empezó este negocio con su esposo desde hace unos 4 años hasta lograr establecer una buena clientela y buena demanda de los productos. Ambos hacen dos viajes por semana para comprar los productos lácteos y el resto de la semana lo distribuyen a su cliente y también recogen el dinero de la parte que distribuyen al crédito.

Ella espera que con el financiamiento pueda comprar mas productos y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas y por ende los ingresos.

Xiomara es casada y tiene una hija que aun no esta en edad escolar.

Este es el segundo préstamo que Xiomara solicita en Ceprodel en un periodo de un año, argumentando que dicho préstamo le ha dado un impacto positivo ya que ha logrado aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
XIOMARA DEL ROSARIO G. C. is a merchant living in greater Condega. She is asking for a loan to buy dairy products at Wholesale for subsequent resale to obtain a profit. She started this business with her husband about 4 years ago and has established a good customer base and demand for her products. Both of them make several trips per week to buy dairy products which they distribute to their customers the rest of the time and collect payment on items they sold on credit. She hopes the financing will make it possible for her to buy more products so that sales will increase and consequently so will income. Xiomara is married and has a daughter who is still too little to go to school. This is Xiomara’s second loan with Ceprodel in a one year period. She states that the loan has had a positive impact in that it has brought about an increase in sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy products at wholesale.

loans.name: Lucy Wanjiku

texts.en:
Lucy Wanjiku is 44 years old and married to Samson Kamande, who is a teacher. They have three children. Lucy is a poultry farmer and has been in the business for a period of about three years with a monthly profit of 10,000 Kenyan shillings. 

She wants to use the loan to buy broilers. She was introduced to KADET by staff and this is her first loan. She hopes to build a greenhouse.

She would like to see her family live successfully so her children will achieve their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To buy broilers

loans.name: Leah Ene

texts.en:
Leah has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last year.  She is 42 years old, married to T. Ndungo, and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to buy two cows and five sheep which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.use: To buy two cows and five  sheep which she will rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es: Jackeline, de 26 años,  es una joven muy emprendedora con ilusiones de progresar, vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos y de sus 3 hermanos. Con mucho esfuerzo, Jackeline viene mejorando las condiciones de la vivienda de sus padres en la que vive. Trabaja como profesora de ingles, en su mismo barrio a 10 minutos de su casa, en donde enseña a niños de 5 a 8 años. Por tanto el sueldo que percibe desde hace 4 años, le ayudó para que poco pueda construir su casa, ya que desde pequeña era su sueño de tener una casa muy bonita, y lo cual lo viene ejecutando. Ahora le falta revestir las paredes e instalar el inodoro y la ducha.  Se siente muy contenta de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, es por ello que desea construir el segundo nivel de su casa, para que sus padres vivir de la renta de dicho inmueble. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea continuar con reiterados apoyos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará cemento, arena fina, para revestir las paredes de su casa.
texts.en:
Jackeline, 26, is a very enterprising young woman with dreams of progress. She lives in her parents' home along with her three siblings. With much effort Jackeline has been making improvements to her parents' living quarters where she lives. She works as an English teacher in her own neighborhood, ten minutes from home, where she teaches 5- to 8-year-old children. Therefore the salary she has been receiving for four years now has helped her, little by little, to be able to build her house. It has been her dream since she was little to have a lovely home, a dream she is making reality. 

Now she needs to cover the walls and install the toilet and shower. She feels so happy to be able to improve her family's quality of life, and wishes to build a second story to her house so her parents may live off rental income from the same. 

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make all the payments on a timely basis since she hopes to continue with repeated loan support. With the loan she seeks she will purchase cement and fine sand for covering the walls in her house.

loans.use: To purchase cement and sand for covering the walls of her home

loans.name: Wala'

texts.en:
Wala' is a young woman from Gaza city in Gaza Strip. She is the mother of two sons and married to Muhammad, who runs an aluminium production workshop. Muhammad makes windows and doors and installs them with construction co-workers. Wala's husband needed a large amount of aluminium to meet current demand and he wanted to pay the supplier in cash. Therefore, Wala' came to FATEN for a loan to help her husband pay for the needed material. The workshop is helping the family cover their expenses and live a decent life.

Wala's husband, Muhammad, appears in the photo in his workshop as Wala' is a religious woman and doesn't want to show her picture online.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
 
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of aluminium

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a young mother of three sons and five daughters. Her husband is a National Palestinian Authority employee. Fatima wanted to help her husband support their big family and also fill her free time when her children are in school, so Fatima started selling clothes almost a year ago in her house.

Fatima came to Kiva's partner, FATEN, and borrowed a loan to purchase a large amount of clothing to sell and increase the store's returns as she became well-known in the area and more women visited her house to buy kids' clothing.

The picture shows Fatima in her house.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: Purchase a large amount of kids' clothing to sell

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is 27 years old and married with no children. He runs a boutique in Rugarama district in Rwanda.  He`s been in this business for six years and sells cosmetics and other personal products like soap, Vaseline etc. and he currently employs one person in his store.  He works at the business from 7am until 4pm every day except Saturdays.  

This is his second loan requested through Vision Finance Company and he plans to buy more cosmetics to increase his business inventory.  He would like to use any profits to reinvest in the business and save for the future.

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 32 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 12.  Alex decided to become a businessman and started a small store selling food and other household items, as he believes it will be more profitable than farming and agriculture.  This is his fifth successful years in business.  His shop is open from 6 in the morning until 11 in the evening, every day except on Sundays.

Alex has requested a loan to purchase more stock for his store and to resolve some family needs such as paying school fees for his children and buying good quality food.  This loan will be very helpful to his family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for store, pay school fees, and buy food for family

loans.name: Lentoyian  Kasana

texts.en:
Lentoyien Kasana P. has been in livestock trading for 10 years in Bissil market in Kajiado which is a very busy market and most of his customers are also livestock traders. She earns a profit of Kshs.4, 000 per month.

She is 56 years, married to Saibulu Kasana 60 years old. Lentoyien was introduced to KADET LTD by World vision staff, and has no history with any other MFI. She is applying for first loan of Kshs.50,000 which she intends to use the whole amount to purchase  livestock that is sheep and goats to rear and sell in the festive season.

The anticipated profit she will use to start transporting meat to Kenya Meat Commission, and in the future she desires to become a prominent business person. She describes herself as outgoing lady

loans.use: To buy livestock like sheep and goats to rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Bladimir

texts.es:
Bladimir es  soltero, vive con u madre y trabaja en una carpintería de aluminio, donde elaboran puertas, ventanas, etc. Tiene su casa propia ubicada en la urbanización Copacabana de la ciudad de El Alto. 
El crédito que ahora solicita será utilizado en la compra de material de construcción (arena, cemento, ladrillos, etc.) para construir una habitación más en su casa y tener más comodidad.
 Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO y el segundo via Kiva. El análisis de sus ingresos y gastos indica que puede ser sujeto de crédito, además de que su historial de pagos con IMPRO es bueno.
texts.en:
Bladimir is single, he lives with his mother, and he works in a metal shop where they make doors, windows, etc. He has his own home located in the community of Copacabana, in the city of El Alto. 

The loan will be used to purchase construction material (sand, cements, bricks, etc) to build another bedroom for their improved comfort. 

This is his fourth loan through Impro (Kiva Field Partner) and the second through Kiva. Following a study of his income and his expenses it was concluded that he is eligible for a loan. In addition, his payment history with Impro has been good.

loans.use: To build a bedroom in their home.

loans.name: Zaher

texts.ar:
زاهر في عمر 34 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية والاستهلاكية له في عمله 3 سنوات يريد دائما التطور
والتقدم في العمل يسعى ان يؤمن لعائلته الاستقرار والدعم المادي والمعنوي يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى توسيع المحل
وزيادة البضائع يسعى دائما الى زيادة مدخوله وتطوير عمله
texts.en: Zahir is 34 years old and married with three children. He  works in a grocery store and has three years experience. He continually aspires to develop and evolve his business and hopes to give his family stability and secure them financially. Through the requested loan from Al-Majmoua, he wants to expand his business by purchasing more goods to sell, thereby increasing his income.

loans.use: To attain the means of purchasing more goods to sell at his store

loans.name: Mutai Development Association-Jinja Group

texts.en: M. Sulaiman is 50 years old and a member of the Mutai Development Association-Jinja. For the last six years, he has made a living by selling  charcoal, firewood and milk to people in his town. He began by selling charcoal only, but gradually expanded his product offerings. He is diligent, focused and hard-working, and exudes confidence when you meet him for the first time. His businesses generate an income of 200,000 shillings a month, and with 10 children to support, he plans to use his portion of this group loan to buy more charcoal and firewood to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and firewood to sell to his customers

loans.name: La Nueva Vida En Cristo Solidarity Group

texts.es: La señora Maria Catalina tiene 5 hijos del cual solo uno es menor de edad, los otros trabajan en el negocio también de frutas y verduras. Su problema principal es cuando no hay frutas que vender, ella tiene que dedicarse a otra alternativa de negocio. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de frutas, lo que hace ella es venderla en el mercado oriental en donde obtiene buenos precios al por mayor. José Luis es otro integrante del grupo, el habita en La Concepción, tiene un hijo de año y medio. Su éxito consiste en esperar hasta que haya poco producto, es cuando el precio incrementa y el aprovecha a sacar la producción. En su negocio tiene bastante competencia, sin embargo como el compra las cosechas el precio de costo es mucho menor que el de la competencia lo que le permite jugar con los precios del producto.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Catalina has 5 children. Two are still minors and the others work in the fruit and vegetable business like her. Her main problem is when there is no fruit to sell, she has to find other work to do. She will use this loan to invest in the purchase of fruit that she will sell in the western market where she gets a good wholesale price.

José Luis is another member of the group. He lives in La Concepción and has a one and a half year old son. He has been successful because he waits until there is little product available, and when the price goes up he takes advantage to move his product. There is a good deal of competition in his business, but nevertheless, since he buys at harvest time his cost is much lower than that of the competition, which allows him to play with the prices of his products.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es:
Luis Humberto M. M. tiene 68 años, Es viudo vive solo en  el Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R. C CALZADO SOLIDARIO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto   el Calzado pertenece al Cantón San Miguel, a media hora de la oficina esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, papas fréjol, y a la cría de animales de corral y ganado vacuno.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas, fréjol y a la cría de ganado vacuno. Compra sus productos en el mercado de San Miguel cada semana y los vende en la feria de los jueves en San Miguel.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de sus cultivos y comprar comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar la situación económica.

Le gusta que los créditos sean de un monto mas alto ya que los productos están mas caro.
texts.en:
Luis Humberto M. M., 58, is a widower living alone in San Miguel Canton, Bolívar Province; he does not have any children. 

The “CALZADO SOLIDARIO” communal bank is located in Calzado which belongs to San Miguel Canton and is located half an hour from this office.  It has 12 members who are short cycle corn, potato and broad bean farmers; they also raise cattle and barnyard animals.

Luis is a corn, potato and broad bean farmer and raises cattle.  He buys his supplies in the San Miguel market every week and sells them at the Thursday farmers market in San Miguel.

He is requesting the loan to buy seed for his crops and to buy feed for the animals.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and weather fluctuations.  His dream is to improve his economic situation.

He likes that the loans are for larger amounts because supplies prices are more expensive.

loans.use: to buy seed for his crops and feed for his animals.

loans.name: Warner

texts.es:
Warner Álvarez V.  es un hombre muy trabajador, conocido por su gran carisma y don de gente en Guanacaste.
El trabaja en el área  de turismo, y necesita un préstamo de ₡594 000 ( quinientos noventa y cuatro mil colones) para comprar los materiales necesarios para mejorar  las condiciones de su casa. El quisiera más adelante invertir para la construcción de habitaciones de  alquiler, ya que en la zona hay mucho turista.
El es  socio de la empresa de crédito Comunal  la Garita, una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Warner Álvarez V. is a hard-working man known in Guanacaste for his great charisma and his ability to get along well with people.
He works in tourism, and he needs a loan of ₡594 000 ($1200 USD) to puchase the necessary materials to improve the condition of his house.  He would like, later on, to invest in the construction of rooms for rent, since there area a lot of tourists in his area.
He is a member of the comunal credit company "Comunal la Garita", one of the 110 member businesses of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Burungu Karambi Womens Group

texts.en: Richard is a member of Burungu Karambi Women's Group where each member guarantees the others in accessing the loan. He is 54 years old and married with three children. He lives in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for a year, after diverting from the sale of fresh foods for over 10 years. He has the challenge of limited funds to meet the demands of his customers and his dream is to own a wholesale shop. Richard intends to use the loan to buy sugar, soap and salt for sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly N. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. Milly owns a pub. She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. 

Milly has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more crates of beer and jerry cans of local gin. The main business challenges for Milly include defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully-stocked bar. 

Milly lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, medication and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and jerry cans of local gin

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina tiene 25 años, es una mujer casada, Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la vena de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que le gusta su actividad y conversa con sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, colonias, bolsos, calzado y ropa interior. El deseo de Rosa Argentina es terminar de construir su casa que por proporcionarla a sus hijos lo necesario no ha podido comprar los materiales.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina, age 25, is married and has three children in her care.  She sells general merchandise for a living and has been doing so for seven years.  She is a hard worker who enjoys what she does and talking to her customers.

The loan she is requesting is to buy clothing, colognes, handbags, shoes and underwear.  Rosa Argentina's dream is to finish building her house.  She has been unable to buy the required materials until now because her children's needs have always come first.

loans.use: To buy clothing, colognes, handbags, shoes and underwear.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband's business of selling garments. He puts the garments on his cart and sells them by visiting different parts of the city. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years.

With the loan, he will buy garments in larger quantities which will help him offer more variety to his customers and earn bigger profits. Naseem is confident about the positive growth of her husband's business and about the better financial future of her family. 

She herself is a housewife and stays at home to perform her daily household duties. She is a very active and responsible person and does her duties very responsibly. She has given birth to eight children. Her two elder sons operate an embroidery business; the other four are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education and stay at home.

loans.use: To buy garments in bulk for resale

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1957 à Souloukoro,  Madame Aminata est une femme mariée, mère de 8 enfants, qui vit dans une famille  polygame dans le quartier Kouloukoro  de la ville  de Koutiala. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance de continuer les études, très tôt elle s’intéressa aux activités commerciales notamment à l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires  et bien d’autres articles divers. Nantie d’une douzaine expérience dans ses  activités de vente de condiments et d’articles divers, elle est très sollicitée et appréciée. 
Pour pouvoir combattre les petites ruptures qu’elle subit et qui lui fait perdre de la clientèle, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle  il y a 7 ans.  Après 8 prêts   solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous correctement  remboursés, elle est à son 4eme prêt  individuel dont les précédents ont été bien remboursés.  
Elle compte acheter, 4 sacs de 25 kg d’oignon, 3 cartons de savons traditionnels, une douzaine de paires de sandales et une demi douzaine de perles pour la ceinture. 
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Koutiala et effectue sa vente  au marché  de Kouloukoro,  à une clientèle constituée essentiellement de femmes, en détail et  au comptant. 
Avec le renforcement de son fonds de commerce, elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105.000FCFA  par mois  qu’elle envisage utiliser  pour payer les  intérêts du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso,  participer aux dépenses familiales et s’entretenir elle même ainsi que ses enfants. 
Madame Aminata compte toujours sur les financements de Soro Yiriwaso  pour être grossiste de condiments au grand marché de Koutiala.
texts.en:
Born around 1957 in Souloukoro, Mrs. Aminata is a married woman and a mother of eight. She lives in a polygamous family in the Kouloukoro neighborhood in the city of Koutiala.
Not having had the opportunity to study, she got interested in commercial activities at a very early age, notably buying and purchasing condiments and many other miscellaneous articles. Thanks to a dozen years of experience selling condiments and miscellaneous articles, she is very much in demand and appreciated.
Seven years ago, to fight small product shortages she experienced and which caused her to lose some of her customers, she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance organization to increase her customer satisfaction. After eight solidarity loans (group loans), all of which were successfully repaid, she is now in her fourth individual loan; previous loans have been successfully repaid.
She intends on purchasing four bags of onions, three packages of soap and many other small articles with this loan. She gets her supplies from Koutiala's great market and retails cash at the market in Kouloukoro, to a clientele mainly composed of women.
By strengthening her commercial interests, she hopes to make an average monthly profit of 105,000 FCFA, which she is planning on using to repay Soro's loan interests, to participate to the family's expenses, and to support herself and her children. Mrs. Aminata still counts on Soro Yiriwaso's funding to be a condiment wholesaler at the great market in Koutiala.

loans.use: purchase of various products.

loans.name: Xevera

texts.en: Xevera is a mother of four children who are ages 4-18 years old. She is 41 years old and she is very hard working. She owns a general store in which she sells different kinds of items which include cooking oil, soap, rice, etc. Xevera has done this business for two years. This business enabled her to achieve several things such as buying a cow from which she gets milk for her family. The business has also fed her family as well as educate her children. She needs a loan to buy more items such as cooking oil and soap and fill her store in order to make more profits.

loans.use: Buy more items for her shop such as cooking oil, soap, etc.

loans.name: Fokaben I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Fokaben I sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fissaba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KOROTIMI, deuxième debout à gauche,                       compte acheter les intrants et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de  riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  12.500 FCFA environs en de fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Fokaben I are married women who average 43 years of age and four children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Fissaba, a village in the Commune of Massigui, in the Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their work as winter begins. The crops grown include rice and peanuts. The group members are on their fifth collaborating with the institution. 

With this new loan, KOROTIMI, who is standing second from the left in the photo, intends to buy farm inputs and to cover the cost of plowing in order to maintain a half hectare of rice and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the city of Massigui to a customer base composed of women and men. KOROTIMI plans on making an average profit of about 12,500 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, and manure

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia, natural de la ciudad de Sivia tiene 44 años de edad, madre de 01 hijo llamado Aldair de 12 años por quien vela a diario y en futuro promisorio hacer de él hombre de bien. Ella esta casada con Felipe de 59 años y cuentan con casa propia situada en la comunidad de Triboline anexo de la ciudad de Sivia. Teodosia desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a ganarse la vida y pagar sus estudios con el esfuerzo de si misma, ella tuvo una infancia muy dura de la cual tuvo que salir adelante, cuando tenía 19 años se independizó de sus padres y dejó de ser empleada de hogar y abrió su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes, instalada en la casa de sus padres. Desde entonces empezó a vender productos y con el transcurso del tiempo más sus ahorros acumulados compro su propio lote de terreno donde actualmente se sitúa su bodega. Ella es una mujer de armas tomar y señala que uno logra su propósito a base de perseverancia. Hoy se siente a gusto con la actividad que realiza y con los buenos ingresos que obtiene, es mas, ella tiene casi todos los productos que sus clientes requieren y sumarle la buena atención que da  al cliente, hace que la bodega de Teodosia sea tan concurrida.
Ella necesita el crédito para seguir prosperando y prestando el buen servicio a sus consumidores. Necesita comprar mostradores y mesas para exhibir con mayor estética sus mercaderías y sabe que lo logrará gracias al apoyo de los financistas. Este es su quinto  crédito de Teodosia y esta muy contenta de saber que obtendrá el apoyo de ustedes, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo sugerido y  esta muy contenta  de pertenecer  a su banca comunal. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles comprará, mostradores y mesas para exhibir mejor sus productos.
texts.en:
Teodosia, 44, is a native of the city of Sivia.  She has a 12-year old boy named Aldair, the light of her life, for whom she works hard to provide a good future.  She and her husband, Felipe, 59, live in a house they own in the Triboline neighborhood of Sivia.  Teodosia learned very young that she had to earn her way in the world and she even paid for her own schooling.  She had a tough childhood, but she managed to overcome it.  She started supporting herself at 19, working as a cleaner and opening a general store in a space in her parents' house.   She's sold lots of merchandise since then and was able to save enough eventually to buy the land where her store now sits.  She is a determined woman and says that perseverance is the key to success.  She is pleased with her business now and with the income that it's generated.  She has almost all of the products that her customers want and that, along with her attention to service, make her general store one of the busiest around.  
Teodosia needs this loan so that she can continue to prosper.  She will use the loan to buy counters and tables for exhibiting her merchandise in the best possible way.  This is her fifth loan and she knows how valuable past loans have been for supporting her business.  She is happy with her community bank and grateful to all of you for your past support.  Teodosia will use this loan of 3,000 new soles to buy counters and tables to display her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy fixtures for her general store.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula de 46 años de edad, vive con su esposo en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo el servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace 3 años aproximadamente Paula se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesdad como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos,etc) y de combustible, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su nivel de vida.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías y cubrir otros gastos personales, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones de su casa.  Paula es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener más comodidades para su esposa.
texts.en:
Paula, 46, lives with her husband in her own house which only has electricity.  It is located in the district of Mórrope which belongs to the department of Lambayeque.  This area is known for its agriculture, livestock farming and artisan craft activity.

For approximately three years Paula has been selling basic need items such as milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet tissue, tuna, eggs, etc., as well as fuel.  She runs her business out of her house for comfort and safety reasons.  Her earnings are used to cover household expenses and improve lifestyle.

In order to expand her business she is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy merchandise and pay for personal expenses.  Her only goal is to increase business and offer more products to her customers, and pay back the loan and meet household obligations.  Paula is a responsible, dedicated, hard-working person who does all she can to make her husband more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store and cover personal expenses.

loans.name: Machell

texts.en:
Machell is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Machell has a shop that sells t-shirts, blouses, sandals & beauty products. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for 6,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy additional products from Natasha & Avon. 

Machell has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Machell hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products from Natasha & Avon

loans.name: Eliecer

texts.es:
Eliecer es un señor de 35 años de edad, el cual vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada el Upala de San Carlos, en la provincia de Alajuela.En Alajuela existen cinco parques nacionales, una reserva nacional de fauna silvestre, cinco zonas protectoras y varias reservas forestales. También en la provincia se ubica el Museo Juan Santamaría, el cual exhibe artesanías producidas localmente. Esta zona ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña.

Desde hace varios años que Eliecer tiene este negocio de actividad agrícola, ya que cuenta en estos momentos con el propiedad que le heredaron sus padres, pero le falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que los vecinos de su comunidad se vean beneficiados. Dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante.

Actualmente Eliecer está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de semillas de maracuyá. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Eliecer es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Delirio, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Eliecer is a 35-year-old man who lives with his wife and children in a community called El Upala de San Carlos, in the province of Alajuela.  There are five national parks in Alajuela, a national wild animal reserve, five protected zones, and several forest reserves.  The Juan Santamaría museum, which exhibits locally products handicrafts, is also in this province.  This area is the primary grower of coffee and sugarcane nationwide.

For several years, Eliecer has had his agricultural business.  He currently has a property that he inherited from his parents, but he lacks the principal for his business to grow so that his neighbors in his community can benefit from it.  He says that the project is very interesting.

Currently Eliecer is requesting a micro-loan of ¢500.000 (five hundred thousand colones), to buy passion fruit seeds.  With this, he hopes to grow his business and significantly improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Eliecer is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Delirio, which is one of the 110 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  This will be his first loan, and he hopes to use it to continue growing on a personal financial basis.  He also actively participates in the credit organization in his community.

loans.use: to buy passion fruit seeds.

loans.name: Seleverio

texts.en: Seleverio is a 36-year-old married man with four children and he lives in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after the family and his dream is to have as many income-generating businesses as possible. For five years, he has been selling animals and this has enabled him to provide basics for his family. His challenge is the ever-increasing animal prices and his desire is to diversify into the transport sector and buy a motorcycle. Seleverio needs a loan to buy a motorcycle for transportation purposes.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transportation purposes.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita  is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Rosita  has a shop that sells firewood & also bananas. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy  stocks of firewood for resale.
Rosita  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosita  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of firewood for resale

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel es casado, tiene 25 años de edad, cursó 6 años de educación primaria, se dedica a la construcción de vivienda, como también a la sastrería, inició su negocio con solo una máquina y hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a tiempo completo a la confección de tejidos.

solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo para la compra de telas e hilos de diferentes colores, ya que espera en el futuro con tener mas trabajares.
texts.en: Miguel, 25, is married.  He completed six years of elementary school.  He works in home construction but also as a tailor.  He started his business with just one sewing machine and to date has 4 years’ experience.  He has his wife’s support who is a full-time textile weaver.  He’s asking for the loan to buy fabric and thread in different colors because he’s expecting more jobs in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Faapito

texts.en:
Faapito is 18 years of age.  She is married and has one child. Faapito owns and operates a business venture, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community.  She has 1 year of experience in this business. 

Faapito needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 240 talas or US $100 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Faapito joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Faapito's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  est âgée  de 35 ans.  Elle vit au Sénégal  et gère  une école de couture dans la localité ou elle habite. Elle a choisi son activité par amour. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC et a déjà remboursé 3 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et fournitures qui seront utilisés pour la confection de boubous prêts  a être  portés  et qu’elle va revendre a sa clientèle. Les bénéfices que va générer son activité lui permettront de se prendre en charge et  de soutenir ses proches.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou is 35 years old. She lives in Senegal and runs a sewing school in the town where she lives. She chose her business by passion.

She is a member of the local U-IMCEC branch and has already repaid three previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to purchase fabrics and supplies, and make ready-to-wear tunics she will then sell to her customers.

The benefits generated by her business activity will enable her to support herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and supplies, and make tunics for sale

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is married and has three children. She is 49 years of age and runs a hog raising business. Daisy is inspired with her belief that nothing happens unless first we dream. Daisy dreams of uplifting their living standards to give the best quality of life to her family.  With the guidance of her dream, Daisy works hard to obtain it. She engages in managing a hog raising business as her way to help her husband carry their family out of poverty. Daisy wants to maintain her business and further take care of her family needs. 

She needs additional working capital to work out her business. Thus, she is requesting a loan of Php 25,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Gisma

texts.en:
Gisma is a 42-year-old married woman with six children between the ages of 8 and 18. She has operated a business selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan for three years. She has one employee.

Gisma has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She says that the extra income from this loan will helps her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 47 years old and lives in Paglaum Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with two sons.

Zosima has a clothing business and earns approximately 8,000 PHP each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase used clothes for her used clothing business.

Zosima has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Zosima hopes to open her own shop to display for her RTW (Ready to Wear) products.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes to sell

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar tiene 38 años de edad es casado tiene 5 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 4, 19, 15, 14 y 1 año de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Julio se dedica a la agricultura, avicultura y construcción. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, líquidos. 
Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá mejorar la situación económica de la familia.  El sueño es poder tener un micro mercado y otras actividades más buenas qué generen ganancia.
El desafíos al que se enfrenta es la sequedad   del tiempo o a veces el invierno.
En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar las festividades del carnaval.
Con la yuda del crédito anterior pudo comprar las semillas, abonos agricolas, la situación de la familia ha mejorado, la producción ha aumentado para el beneficio de la familia.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 38 years old, married, and has 5 children. He lives with his wife and children, aged 19, 15, 14, 4, and 1, in Guaranda, Bolivar province.

Julio is a member of the “Ventanal” (Large Window) Communal Bank, composed of residents of Guantuncoto community in the parish of Julio Moreno, Guaranda canton, some 30 minutes from our offices. The inhabitants of this community are dedicated to differing activities, such as agriculture, cattle raising, caring for pigs, chickens, and sheep, commerce, and construction.

Julio is involved in farming, chicken raising, and construction. He makes his purchases and sales in Guaranda. Julio is requesting a loan to buy manure, seed, fertilizer, and liquid supplies.

With the aid of the loan, he will enhance his family's economic situation. Julio's dream is to have  his own micro-market, plus other better activities, to generate earnings.

The challenges he confronts are seasonal drought and, at times, the winter. In his free time he enjoys festivals such as carnival.

Aided by the last loan, he was able to buy seed and manure. His family's situation has improved and production has increased to the family's benefit.

loans.use: buy manure, seed, fertilizer, and liquids for his crops.

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan, 60, is married  and resides with his wife and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is a driver in the Ministry of the Interior in Phnom Penh city. His wife runs a grocery store at home. His son is a garment worker. 

Ngan requests a loan of USD $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for his son to commute to work. 

In the future, he would like to run a poultry farm, build a kitchen and send his child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for his son to commute to work.

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr: Agée de 31ans, Henriette est responsable du groupe de deux personnes. Mariée et mère de trois enfants, elle a un maquis-bar et s'est spécialisée dans la vente de mets africains et de boissons. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés de la place. Pour étendre son activivé et répondre aux préoccupations de sa clientèle, elle préconise le financement d'un micro-crédit à Finadev. Elle pense maximiser son profit et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Thirty-one-year-old Henriette is the head of a two-person group. A married mother of three, she has an eatery-bar and specializes in selling African dishes and beverages. She stocks up at local markets. To expand her business and satisfy her clientele, she is seeking a micro-loan from Finadev. She would like to maximize her profits and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy 5 cases of SOBEBRA drinks, 5 boxes of frozen products, vegetables, and miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
A la tienda de abarrotes le hace falta más mercancía que es latería, botanas y productos, por lo cual la señora Maria De Los Ángeles esta solicitando este crédito para surtir su pequeño negocio.
  Doña Maria De Los Ángeles empezó su negocio abarrotes con dos cajas de refrescos y día tras día la demanda de sus ventas fue creciendo ahora cuenta con dos refrigeradores bien surtidos de refresco; su negocio tiene un poco de todo pero le hace falta comprar mas mercancía por mayoreo porque así le sale mas económico y podrá brindar mas variedad  de producto a sus clientes; la señora Maria De Los Ángeles es viuda y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad y a quienes les quiere dar lo mejor. 
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en: María de Los Ángeles is asking for this loan to stock her small store which lacks more canned goods, snacks and products.  She started her grocery store with just two cases of soft-drinks and day after day demand for her sales increased until now she has two refrigerators that are well-stocked with soft-drinks.  Her business has a little bit of everything but she needs to buy more merchandise at wholesale because that way it’s more economical for her and she can offer more variety of products to her customers.  María de Los Ángeles is a widow and has two children in her care that she wants to give the best to.  She plans to repay the loan with part of the profits she earns in the business.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is an entrepreneur who works with a small team of socially minded partners to improve lives for farmers throughout Kenya. Her work involves training farmers and building market linkages with suppliers of environmentally friendly products that are needed within local communities. Over the last several years, Joyce has worked with thousands of low-income farmers that grow tea, coffee, flowers, and vegetables. She started Boma Safi Limited to support the many farmers who lack access to sustainable energy and products that alleviate poverty. 

The Boma Safi product line now includes solar energy solutions, as well as clean cookstoves, water purifiers, and women's health products. These goods are sold directly on farms, as well as in rural open-air markets and two small shops that Joyce now operates. Boma Safi (meaning "clean home" in Swahili) has quickly built a reputation as a trusted voice in the East African Fair Trade community.

Joyce leads a small team that conducts workshops on farms across Kenya, demonstrating the positive aspects of solar when compared to traditional energy sources such as candles, kerosene, and disposable batteries. With years of experience selling a variety of solar products, Joyce began working with One Degree’s team in Kenya in 2012 after collecting feedback from farmers about BrightBox, a new solar energy kit that powers lights, phones, and radios. During workshops, farmers would exclaim "stima!" - meaning electricity - when seeing BrightBox lights in action, and Joyce knew she found a winning solution.

Since September 2012, Joyce has already sold hundreds of BrightBox systems to farmers. She already has requests for many more, which she would like to provide before the holidays.
