While happy with her initial success, Joyce has been selling to farmers on a regular cash basis, while many others cannot afford to pay upfront. These same lower-income farmers are sadly stuck spending $10-$15 per month - a considerable portion of their income - on lighting and phone charging.

To break this cycle and provide renewable energy to these farmers, Joyce would like to start offering flexible payment terms to those who need it most. She seeks support from Kiva lenders to make this happen.

Joyce will use funds for 150 BrightBoxes, which will be used to energize and empower farming households across the region. Farmers will be able to collect BrightBox systems immediately and pay for them over several months. Since they are currently spending money on polluting, unsafe, and inefficient energy, most will save enough to recoup costs in 4-5 months and never worry about fuel or fire again. With your help, Joyce will help farming families eliminate energy expenses, improve safety, and allow their children to read into the night.

loans.use: to pay for solar energy systems and offer financing plans to lower-income farmers.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 28-year-old lady and a married mother of three whose husband provides additional income for the family.

Joyce operates a salon, a business she has done for the last nine years, and it's flourishing as depicted in the uploaded photo of Joyce plaiting one of her customers.

This marks her first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase hair weaves, shampoo, beauty soaps and nail polish.

With the anticipated profits, Joyce will be able to repay her loan and purchase a hair dryer.

In the future, she hopes to own a hair training college.

loans.use: to purchase hair weaves, shampoo, beauty soaps and nail polish.

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en: Farrukh is a sociable and hardworking man. He is 27 years old. He sells fruits in the local market of Kulob city. Before Farrukh`s wife sold children`s clothes, but she has now stopped her business and began to help him. Farrukh wants to expand his business and support his children. His main problem is lack of money. He hopes that with the Kiva lenders he will be able to purchase wholesale fruits and increase his business. Farrukh is thankful to you in advance.

loans.use: To buy wholesale fruits and expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at their home to improve access to sanitation and a water source.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more cakes, milk, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal gracias a sus ventas es como ha logra salir adelante, ella solicita por tercera ocasion otro crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor ya que le ha ido muy bien en sus ventas y asi poder seguir teniendo mejores ingresos economicos.

loans.use: compra de mas ropa por mayor

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Mr. L. is married with three children. His first son was recently admitted to college, which has strained his business. He first came to us with a request of a $429 loan to enable him purchase a new power saw for his business. He successfully repaid the loan and requested for a 2nd loan of $725 With tis loan, he intends to buy more timber plus other items that he requires in his furniture business. He is a well-respected person in the community known for his honesty and hard work. He is employing 4 other persons in his business, which is contributing to employment and general well-being of the community.

loans.use: To buy Timber

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: "I have owned this business for four years and I have no cause to regret it. Though I am 53 years old, my numerous customers always give me satisfaction," says Mrs. Patricia O.. She needs a loan of $500 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more cooked food and drinks for sales

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 49 years old. Twice a week she goes to the market in San Cristobal de las Casas to purchase fresh flowers brought by people from other communities who sell flowers that are typical to each region. Later at home she separates the flowers into bouquets which she then sells in the village of Akala, which is located two hours from where she lives. She hopes to invest in a small store in Akala to finally establish herself in the area. She is part of the Grupo Ecatepec 1.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

JUANITA TIENE 49 AÑOS. DOS VECES A LA SEMANA VA AL MERCADO DE SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS Y COMPRA FLORES NATURALES, YA QUE AHI LLEGAN GENTES DE LAS COMUNIDADES Y VENDEN LAS FLORES QUE SON TIPICAS DE CADA ZONA, LUEGO EN SU CASA LAS SEPARA POR MANOJOS Y LAS VA A VENDER AL PUEBLO DE AKALA LUGAR UBICADO A DOS HORAS DE DONDE ELLA VIVE. ESPERA INVERTIR EN UN LOCAL EN AKALA PARA INSTALARSE DEFINITIVAMNETE EN ESA ZONA. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO ECATEPEC 1.

loans.use: COMERCIANTE

loans.name: Maria Bibiana

texts.es:
María Bibiana is a married woman with four children. Her oldest is going to high school and working at the same time. The three little ones go to primary and elementary school. Maria's husband is a factory worker. Maria started her business because their income was too modest for such a large family and she wanted to help out with the family expenses. She started working from home selling a small number of things like sodas, tortillas and milk. Little by little her clientele grew .Now her husband and kids help her out with the store.
Maria is asking for a loan of $475 to buy more merchandise, specially fruits and vegetables . Her customers have been wanting those for a while now. She'll repay the loan in 6 months. Maria Bibiana thanks you for supporting her and her family.

Spanish

María Bibiana es una mujer casada y tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales el mayor estudia en la preparatoria y trabaja, los tres pequeños estudian., dos en la escuela y el último en preescolar. Su esposo trabaja como obrero en una fábrica y sus ingresos no eran suficientes para poder mantener el gasto familiar y fue por eso que María Bibiana decidió ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar, trabajando desde su casa, empezando con muy pocas cosas que vender en su tienda como refrescos, tortillas y leche. Poco a poco sus ventas se fueron incrementando y así ella poco a poco fue surtiendo de más productos y a la vez creciendo con su negocio. Su esposo y sus hijos la ayudan en sus tiempos libres en la atención de la tienda.

María Bibiana está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para comprar mercadería para su negocio y así conservar sus clientes, además de incluir en sus productos frutas y verduras que son muy pedidos por sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en seis meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que le das para poder continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Maria is married with 4 kids and her husband is a taxi driver. She started her business when she was young by helping out her mother selling used clothes in busy places. Little by little she started to enjoy the business and 5 years ago she went it alone. She started her own business from her house and then in popular markets. She did this as her and her husband's earnings did not cover the household costs, but now she earns a bit more than her husband. Maria now has a small stall from which she sells her products.

Maria would like a loan of $475 so that she can refurbish her shop and acquire more merchandise so that her clients see a well presented business with good products. She will repay this loan in 6 months. She thanks you for the support that you can offer so that her business can go forward and keep on improving.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

María está casada y tiene 4 hijos, su esposo es taxista, ella empezó con su negocio desde joven ayudando a su madre con la venta de ropa usada en las colonias populares, y poco a poco fue agarrándole gusto al negocio del comercio, y hace cinco años atrás ella se independizó y comenzó con su negocio propio vendiendo en su casa y luego en mercados populares, ya que lo que ganaba ella como trabajadora de ayudante de su madre y su esposo como taxista no les alcanzaba para cubrir el gasto familiar y ahora ella puede ayudar con un ingreso un poco mejor a su esposo, actualmente María ya tiene un pequeño puesto donde ofrece sus productos.

María esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para poder remodelar su local y adquirir algo más de mercadería para que sus clientes vean que el negocio tiene una buena presentación así como sus productos, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses y les agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindas para continuar con su negocio y mejorar cada vez más con el mismo.

loans.use: Refurbishment and to buy merchandise/Remodelación y compra de mercancía

loans.name: Sumiyati

texts.en: Sumiyati is a 29 years old and is married. She sells sheets on credit and goes door to door to sell her products. She usually earns an income of $16.5 per week. Her husband Ujang is a driver and usually earns $3 per day. She needs more capital to expand her business. Sumiyati is a member of MBK and requests an IDR 500,000 loan. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid is a 23 year old man. He lives is south Lebanon in the Nabatieh region. Rashid comes from a poor background but made it on his own and was able to open a barber shop. He needs a loan of $500 to buy the required products to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: Rashid would like to buy the required products to run his barber shop.

loans.name: Subhani's Group

texts.en: I am Subhani M., and I am a mother of five: two of whom attend school. I belong to a small town called Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan. Last year, I started a grocery shop with the loans we received from Asasah, a microfinance institution. Currently, I require another loan to buy stock for my store. The other women who need loans with me are: Shazia B., who needs a loan to expand her beetle nut shop; Zahida B., who needs loan to buy a cow; and Sakina B., who will use the loan to buy a cow; and Arshad B., who requires a loan to expand her milk business. I help these women because I want to help these women to have an important place in their houses and help them provide income for their families.

loans.use: Buy stock for the grocery store

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is a single mother who supports herself and her daughter with a small clothing sales business. Svetlana originally started her business from her home but has now been able to move into a little space at an indoor mall in Novaya Kahovka. She has been in business for about three years. Her monthly profit is typically between $400 and $1000.

Svetlana has requested a six month loan of $500 to help purchase new inventory to sell. A conscientious, well educated entrepreneur, she asked detailed questions about our organization before taking her first loan. She is pleased with the financial services available to her and we look forward to many more opportunities to assist her with her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase of a wide range of products to sell in her community.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita has been a member of the Comunal Bank Muchuy Warakaq, which means "wealth" in quechua, for the past 10 years.

Margarita is 41 years old and has 2 children. She sells animals such as hens, rabbits, and guinea pigs in the "April 12" market. Margarita has steady providers that sell her merchandise at her stand . Margarita also has a small grocery store where her husband and daughter work.

Margarita needs a loan of 2000 soles, with which she will buy hens, rabbits, guinea pigs, sugar, rice, oil, and noodles.

Margarita dreams of buying a car so that her son can work, roofing her home, have a better stocked grocery store and that her children are able to study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Muchuy Warakaq que significa “Abundancia” en quechua hace 10 años.

Margarita es conviviente, tiene 41 años y 2 hijos, Margarita vende animales menores como gallinas, conejo, cuy en el mercado 12 de abril, Margarita tiene proveedores fijos que le traen a su puesto. Además Margarita tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa donde venden su esposo e hija.

Margarita necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuy, gallinas, conejo, azúcar, arroz, aceite y fideo.

Los sueños de Margarita son comprar un carro para que trabaje su hijo, techar su casa, tener una tienda de abarrotes más surtida, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.

loans.use: To buy hens, rabbits, sugar, rice, oil, noodles, and guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es:
Investment of the first loan:

Angel could buy all necessary agricultural supplies to satisfy the demands of his customers. In other words, he could buy everything in time to finish his harvest as planned and sell all of his products.

Business development:

His stable has allowed him to own land in order to grow rice for the most part. 20 years of experience attest the quality and quantity of his products.

Personal information:

Angel is 43 years old, single and has no children. His home is made of reed and wood. One of his aspirations is to buy more land in order to produce more.

Use of the second loan:

With this new loan, Angel will buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment and other necessary supplies. He will also rent machines and hire labour in order to profit from the winter season and to save irrigation. The advantage of this business is that it is situated in the highlands of this coastal region.

Previous Profile: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=11780

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Inversión de Primer Préstamo:

Ángel pudo comprar todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios para atender la demanda de sus clientes. Es decir que compro todo a tiempo, terminando su cosecha como el esperaba y comercializando todo su producto.

Desarrollo de Negocio:

Una cuadra que posee, le han permitido tener terreno propio para cultivar principalmente arroz. 20 años de experiencia avalan la calidad y cantidad de sus productos.

Información Personal :

Ángel tiene 43 años. Es soltero. No tiene hijos. Su vivienda es de construcción mixta caña y madera. Una de sus aspiraciones es comprar mas cuadras de tierra para tener mas producción

Uso de Segundo Préstamo:

Con este nuevo préstamo comprara abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, equipo menor, alquiler de maquinarias, contratación de mano de obra, y otros insumos necesarios para aprovechar la época invernal, y ahorrar el riego. La ventaja del sector es que esta en la parte alta de este sector costero.

Previous Profile: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=11780

loans.use: To invest in machines, supplies and fertilizer for agriculture

loans.name: Petesa

texts.en: Petesa K., 29, is married with 2 children.  She has 5 year(s) of experience in the Sewign and vegetable garden business. She sells to the villagers 3 days per week. She has previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 312 Tala (~130 USD).  SPBD loans are Petesa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She the wife of a Reverand, with three children, running a sewing business. She also does vegetables to support her weekly repayments

loans.use: purchasing materials, threads, needles, buttons, zippers and seeds.

loans.name: Chuacante I Group

texts.en:
The women from the mujeres Chuacante group live in a popular tourist destination, San Pedro La Laguna, Lake Atitlan. They enjoy their community and are proud to have lived in it since childhood. Amongst the highlights of living in their town is the fact that they all own land there and enjoy a healthy church life and festive season, such as the town fair coming up in early June. The microcredit group that they are part of has brought them closer to each other through “unity and love amongst us,” as Norma G. described her experience.

When at home or in the workplace, these women, who are mostly mothers, dedicate their lives to weaving. Some are bead-workers and others are dedicated to selling fruit and vegetables. The weavers make traditional clothing such as colorful belts, aprons and tops (guipiles) and the bead-workers make bead belts and bracelets. They sell this merchandise to intermediaries who take it all over the region and re-sell it to stores, tourists and shoppers.

Norma G. began her business a few years ago and took out very small loans at high interest. Recently, she has switched over to loans of virtually no interest, which are generously provided online. She can now confidently take out large loans (and growing) of 340 USD and with it help pay the wages of her 6 employees who work with her to produce many more products than before, and sell them for cheaper, while still making a profit.

When asked about how their business was going, they complained about the rainy season and the drop in sales during this time of the year. They said that this lull in sales didn’t mean less work, but a whole other load to be taken care of. The credit that they receive from microlenders goes towards more cloth and string, which they can buy by bulk and get a cheaper deal. At the same time, they can invest in their business to produce better and more products. Secundina E. said that she “could see a difference” from the time she began to take out loans. She explained that she could now buy more, for less money, and realize larger profits.

The hard work, combined with the loans, allows them to successfully send their children to public school, and accomplish what Josefa B. described as one of her largest dreams: to create a successful business and make it grow to the point where loans are no longer needed, and financial self-sustainability of the family and business are reached and maintained.

loans.use: Purchase of materials such as thread, cloth,  dyes, weaving materials, bulk fruits and vegetables, beads

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
Maria Angélica lives on Franz Tamayo Street in the Cotahuma area of the city of La Paz. She lives with her husband and their two daughters who are 20 and 17 years old.

Maria owns the minibus her husband drives for fares. She is requesting a loan to repair the motor of the minibus. The minibus business is her only source of income.

Maria plans to use the loan to purchase replacement parts for the vehicle. This is her second loan from IMPRO, which performed an assessment qualifying her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Maria Angélica, vive en la calle Franz Tamayo de la zona Cotahuma, de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo y su dos hijas de 20 y 17 años respectivamente.

Posee un minibús con el cual trabaja su esposo; el crédito que ahora solicita es para la reparación del motor, ya que esta actividad es actualmente su única fuente de ingresos.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra repuestos para el vehiculo. Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of replacement parts to repair minibus

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: Béatrice A. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est coiffeuse et revendeuse de mèches destinées à sa propre clientèle depuis des années à Kpalimé une ville située au sud-ouest du Togo à 120 Km de Lomé la capitale Togo. Avec ce troisième crédit, Mme Béatrice désire acheter plus de produits de beauté, des mèches et un séchoir pour augmenter la capacité de son activité et par là participer davantage à la prise en charge des besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Béatrice A., 39, is married and the mother of four children. She is a hairdresser and has sold hair extensions for use by her own clientele for a number of years. She lives and works in Kpalimé, a town situated in the southwest of Togo, 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo.

With this, her third loan, Béatrice wants to buy more cosmetics, hair extensions, and a hair dryer so as to expand her business and thus to be able to do more to support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hair extensions, cosmetics, and a hair dryer

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Mrs. Yim K. is a food seller in the village of Sala Lek Pram in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Vann Heng, is a village chef who makes a small income to support the family. Although Mrs. K. and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot improve their living conditions. To improve their standard of living, Mrs. K. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to start a new pig-breeding business. Mrs. K. is 52 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one helps the mother in business. The third one is attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a pig-breeding business

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma es natural del pueblo de Chuchito, tiene 45 años y vive con sus hijos Nélida de 22, Ivan de 17 y Yesica de 8. Se dedica a la venta de licores, los cuales trae desde otras ciudades, esta labor la realiza hace 20 años, tiempo en el que le ha ido muy bien y sigue prosperando. A Irma le gusta la venta de Licores, ya que son muy consumidos en la ciudad y casi siempre vende toda su mercadería, lo dificultoso está, en transportar los licores, ya que a veces por el movimiento de los carros las botellas resultan quebradas. Irma sabe que si sigue trabajando podrá brindarles mejores oportunidades a sus hijos. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará licores y viajará a adquirir más, En el futuro, quiere tener una gran tienda con productos de las mejores marcas.
texts.en:
Irma is from the town of Chuchito. She is 45 years of age and lives with her children Nélida, a 22 year-old, Ivan, a 17 year-old, and Yesica, an 8 year-old. She works in the sale of liquor which she brings from other cities. She has done this work for 20 years, time in which she has done well and continues prospering. Irma likes the sale of liquor now that it is highly consumed in the city and she almost always sells all of her merchandise. What is difficult is transporting the liquor as sometimes, with the movement of the vehicles, bottles end up breaking. Irma knows that she will continue working to be able to provide her children with the best opportunities. With the money from this loan she will buy liquor and will travel to acquire more. In the future, she wants to have a large shop with products of the best brands.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of liquor that she sells.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine U. is 40 years old. She is married and has three kids who are currently in school. She is a retailer of Chinese herbal medicine. She buys from her Chinese suppliers at Spintex Road in Accra and retails the herb products to her customers. As a result of her rich persuasion skills, she has built up the trust and confidence of the numerous clients who come to buy medicine from her.  She enjoys her trade very much; however, she does not have adequate funds to support her business, especially with the current hikes in the wholesale cost of herbal drugs. 

She therefore needs the loan to remain in business. With the loan, she wants to purchase new stock of herbal medicine to serve her customers. She believes the loan would enable her to save more to finance her kids’ education and also to build her own shop. She is a member of the community group called The Ark Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan. Her picture was taken when she was visited.

loans.use: To buy wholesale Chinese herbal medicine supplies

loans.name: Sergio Rene

texts.es: El señor Sergio Rene Castro tiene la edad de 40 años, habita en el reparto Juan Ramón padilla, ubicado en municipio de ticuantepe, junto a su esposa , la cual le apoya con las cosas del hogar , ellos tienen a su cargo una niña de siete años , la cual estudia su primaria , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia , don Sergio trabaja en Ineter desempeñándose como Idromensor desde hace diez años , el solicita el apoyo de nuestra institución para la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, para terminar de construir su casa, y así tener un poco de comodidad ya que es pequeña.
texts.en:
Mr. Sergio Rene Castro is 40 years old and lives with his wife in Juan Ramon Padilla, an area in the Ticuantepe municipality. Sergio's wife is a homemaker; they care for a seven year old girl who attends primary school. Sergio wants to improve living conditions for his family, so for the last decade, he has been working at INETER (The Nicaraguan Institute of Earth Studies) as a hydrology technician. He's seeking your support so that he can purchase construction materials like stone, sand, cement and iron. These will allow him to finish building his home and make it a little more comfortable, because it is a bit small.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials to finish building his house

loans.name: Leam

texts.en: Leam S., 37, sells groceries in a small store next to her house and she can earn an income of US$2 per day to support her daily expenses. She currently lives in Banteay Meanchey Province with two children, both single.  Her husband, Touch Yana, age 38, is a motorcycle seller. He buys motorcycles to fix and sells them for an income. To earn extra money and to improve the business, S. has requested a loan to purchase more groceries to sell.  The remainder of the loan will help her husband expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Brenda Irene

texts.es: La señora Brenda es madre de familia de 3 hermosos niños, ella trabaja como ama de llaves de un prestigioso hotel, su esposo trabaja para una empresa realizando las conexiones eléctricas, a Brenda le acaban de entregar su casita pero antes de mudarse desean proporcionarle mas seguridad mediante las protecciones en puertas y ventanas y la construcción de una barda lateral; es por ello que están solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Brenda is a mother of three beautiful children. She works as a housekeeper at a prestigious hotel. Her husband performs electrical repairs for a business. Brenda just bought her house, but before moving in, she would like to improve its security by building a fence and installing door and window security. That is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of fence, door and window security

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel,

texts.es:
Rosa, a sus cuarenta y dos años es madre de tres hijos, el mayor de veinticuatro, el segundo de dieciocho y el último de seis años. Los dos mayores son independientes económicamente. Por lo que solo se dedica a cuidar y criar a su menor hijo junto con su es poco, quien trabaja como mecánico.
Siempre se ha dedicado a su casa. Sin embargo, gracias a los consejos de una amiga se animó a convertirse en consultora de productos de belleza, vendiendo a través de la muestra de catálogos. Poco apoco ha ido aumentado la mercadería que tiene como stock y gracias a que consiguió reunir un capital extra se animo a vender otras dos marcas mas de cosméticos.
Las ganancias de su trabajo las comparte con su esposo para los gastos de su casa. Ha pensado en el futuro poner un negocio de comida, tal vez un restaurante en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Rosa, at 42, is mother of three children, the oldest one is 24, the second one is 18 and the youngest is six. The two older children are financially independent and Rosa along with her husband, who works as a mechanic, only have to take care of their youngest son. She has always been a housewife, however, thanks to the advice of a friend she decided to become a beauty products consultant, selling through a catalog. She has slowly increased the stock of merchandise and thanks to some extra capital she started selling other brands of cosmetics. The earnings from her work are shared with her husband to cover the house expenses. She thinks of starting in the future a food business, maybe running a restaurant from her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay fees for the cosmetics she sells

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia es una mujer que desea progresar en la vida, a sus 45 años es madre de 2 hijos Katherine de 24 años y Anthony de 14, a quienes cuida con mucho amor y dedicación, vive en su casa propia de manera independiente y quiere darle unos buenos estudios a sus hijos. Se dedica a alquilar habitaciones a las personas que desean tener un lugar seguro donde quedarse, es una dueña de casa muy alegre, le gusta su negocio porque se divierte mucho conversando con sus inquilinos. Lleva 6 años en esta actividad y lo más difícil de su trabajo, es tener que tratar con algunos inquilinos que no quieren pagar el alquiler de la habitación, aun así sabe que tiene que ponerle todas sus ganas y esfuerzo para salir adelante, puesto que quiere brindarles a sus hijos una buena vida y unos adecuados estudios. Adicionalmente, en un futuro cercano,  desea poner una tienda de abarrotes donde pueda vender diversos productos a sus vecinos y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Es el tercer préstamo de Sonia con MFP y es muy puntual en sus cuotas, ya que siempre ahorra para poder pagarlas, en su banco comunal es muy activa y siempre está pendiente del bienestar de las demás socias. Sonia invertirá los mil quinientos soles que requiere en arreglar las habitaciones que alquila, para así poder subir el alquiler de sus habitaciones.
texts.en:
Sonia is a woman who wants to get ahead in life, and at 45 years old is the mother of two children: 24 year old Katherine and Anthony, who is 14. She takes care of them with a lot of love and dedication, and she lives in her own house, independently, and wants to give her children a good education. She rents rooms to people who want a safe and secure place to stay, and she is the owner of a very happy home. She likes this business because she really enjoys chatting with her tenants. She has been doing this for six years, and the toughest part of her work is dealing with tenants who don't want to pay the rent. She knows that she has to motivate herself and make a strong effort to keep moving forward, because she wants to give her children a good life and an adequate education. Additionally, in the near future, she would like to have a little grocery store where she could sell a variety of products to her neighbors and in this way increase her income.

This will be Sonia's third loan with MPF, and she is very punctual with her payments, because she always saves in order to make them on time. She is a very active member of her communal bank and she is always concerned with the wellbeing of the rest of the group. Sonia will invest the 1500 soles in fixing up rooms to rent in order to increase the rental rate of her rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs to the rooms that she rents out

loans.name: Juraboy

texts.en:
S. Juraboy is 51 years old, married, and has six children. For more than 30 years, Juraboy has been raising calves and selling them at the market. This is the way he feeds his family. Since his business is doing well, he wishes to expand it. Thus, Juraboy has decided to ask for a loan of $1200 US to buy more calves. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions with this loan. The purchase will enable Juraboy to increase his sales, earn more, and to meet the needs of his dear children, for whose sake he is working so hard.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Hakika Group

texts.en:
Fatuma has been an animal keeper and has owned a small shop in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for five years. She belongs to Maendeleo A2 group loan (Group code 2014). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more eggs for resale. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Fatuma is 38 years old, married, and has three children: ages 14, 12 and 4. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member Rukia who also owns a small shop in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more eggs for resale

loans.name: Shodmonkul

texts.en:
Shodmonkul U. is in the livestock business. He breeds livestock, which provides sustenance for his humble home. Shodmonkul is married with three children. It's important to note that since he started his business, he has acquired an abundance of experience and knowledge because of his great dedication to breeding his animals. Shodmonkul is looking for support from IMON International to purchase livestock to sell in order to continue with his arduous work with cattle in his sector.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Santos Agustin

texts.es: Santos Agustín A. A. tiene la edad de 26 años, es un hombre casado. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo y estudia. La actividad económica de Santos ofrece los servicios de disco móvil. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Comenzó realizando pequeñas fiestas locales en su comarca, y con el paso del tiempo fue obteniendo los equipos necesarios para su negocio, mas tarde realiza un contrato con el dueño de un restaurante para entretener las fiestas bailables. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo ya que este trabajo requiere que sus aparatos sean mucho más modernos por lo que serán invertidos en su negocio. El deseo de Santos es de proporcionarle  su familia todo lo necesario para que no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Santos Agustín A. A. is 26 years old and married. He has 1 child who is in school. Santos is a deejay and has been working at this for more than 9 years. He started by working small local parties in his county and over time acquired equipment for his business. Later on he signed a contract with the owner of a restaurant to entertain at dance parties. He is asking for a loan for working capital to invest in the business, as this job requires that his equipment be much more up-to-date. Santos´ wish is to be able to provide his family with everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Khut

texts.en:
Khut N., 37, has been involved in a business selling Khmer noodles (a very common Cambodian food) in the nearby local markets in Battambong province since 2000 with an income of US$ 6. She lives with her husband and her two children. Her husband makes a living by operating a motor taxi with an income of US$ 4 per day.

Together N. and her husband plan to take a loan of US$ 800 to create another business selling groceries at her house. (N. is pictured in the photo with her noodle business.)

loans.use: buying more groceries for her store

loans.name: Sandra María

texts.es:
Sandra P. V. es una joven señora de 28 años de edad, vecina de  una comunidad  rural de Costa Rica situada 45 kilómetros al sur de San José llamada San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal es una zona un poco montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, café y otros, artesanía, ganadería y muchas otras actividades. Doña Sandra vive con su esposo y sus tres pequeños hijos: Allan, Esteban y Alvaro. 

Con el deseo de mejorar su condición de vida ella y su esposo buscaron alternativas diferentes y desde hace poco más de un año iniciaron  juntos un negocio exactamente un bazar en el cual ofrecen: cosméticos, ropa, accesorios para el hogar entre muchas otras cosas. Al principio no conocían nada del negocio así que fueron experimentando poco a poco. Actualmente doña Sandra es la que le dedica más tiempo al bazar ya que su esposo trabaja y le dificulta un poco ayudarla por el horario de su trabajo. Su negocio ha hecho que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado mucho.
 
En estos momentos lo que desea doña Sandra es solicitar un préstamo  por ¢300,000 (trescientos  mil colones) para comprar mercadería para su bazar ya que quiere variar y mejorar su inventario. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida. 
Doña Sandra  es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. . Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Sandra V. P. is a 28 year old woman who is a resident of the Costa Rican rural community of San Cristóbal Norte, located 45 kilometers south of San José. San Cristóbal is a slightly mountainous area where you will find different types of businesses such as vegetable farms, coffee plantations, arts & crafts, livestock farms and more. Doña Sandra lives with her husband and three young sons: Allan, Esteban and Alvaro.

Wanting to improve their living conditions, she and her husband looked at different alternatives and decided to start a business together at a bazaar. They offer cosmetics, clothes and accessories for the home among many other things. At first they did not know anything about running a business, but they eventually learned after gaining experience little by little. Doña Sandra currently devotes more time to their shop because her husband works and his schedule makes it difficult for him to help. The business has greatly improved her family’s living conditions.

At the moment, Doña Sandra is requesting a loan of 300,000 colones ($525 USD) to buy merchandise for her store because she wants to change and improve her inventory. She expects this will help her microenterprise grow and generate more income to improve her living conditions. Doña Sandra is a member of the Community Credit Corporation of San Cristobal Norte (SACRIN), one of the 100 partner organizations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica. This is her first loan, and she hopes to continue to grow personally and economically. She would like to offer her thanks to these types of organizations and credit facilitators who devote their time to promoting these productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in more inventory

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa D. est âgée de 30 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle a un congélateur et sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité de vente de rafraîchissant comme crème glace. Elle pourrait ainsi augmenter son capital d’investissement et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awa D. is 30 years old, married, and the mother of three. She has a freezer and is requesting a loan to bolster her business selling refreshments, such as ice cream. She would thus be able to increase her investment capital and to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell ice cream

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Marinel

texts.en:
Marinel D. is a 30-year-old and mother to four; two girls and two boys. The eldest daughter is eight years old while the youngest is two years old.  She is happily married to Eddie who is 31 years old and a hired welder. She lives in the beautiful town of Tanay, Rizal province in the Philippines.
As a mother she dreams nothing but to bring good future for children, to bring her family out from poverty. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2008. Her previous loan was used as rolling capital on her rice-resale business. The business is performing well since rice is the staple food for Filipinos.
Now on her 2nd loan, she is proposing a loan of 10,000 pesos as additional capital for her rice-resale business. This will be used to pay for 13 sacks of rice and its transportation expenses. She believes that she will gain more from this business. She dreams of expanding her business. She also aspires of sending her children to school until they all finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: To pay for 13 sacks of rice  for resale and its transportation expenses.

loans.name: Nuevo Milenio Group

texts.es: El grupo “Nuevo Milenio” es un grupo compuesto por 13 socias que se dedican a L. venta D. productos D. belleza, Abarrotes, dulces, CDs, y variedad D. productos que les generen ingresos para poder sustentar a sus familias, este grupo ya esta trabajando con L. institución bajo esta modalidad D. crédito por cuarto ciclos, tiempo en el que han demostrado responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas D. trabajar. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe L. competencia D. L. oferta y L. demanda, pero las socias saben como salir adelante para obtener mejores ingresos para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. Este crédito esta destinado para L. diversificación D. productos y para invertir en L. compra D. materiales insumos y herramientas que ayuden a mejorar L. calidad D. sus productos parque estos puedan combatir a L. competencia Las socias van cursando su cuarto ciclo dentro D. L. institución por lo que cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios y saben como administrar los fondos, es por esta razón que L. fundación les brinda un apoyo económico para que puedan sacar adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
The New Millennium Group is composed of 13 members dedicated to the sale of beauty products, groceries, sweets, CDs, and a variety of products that generate income to sustain their families. This group has already worked with their micro-finance organization through four loans, during which time they have demonstrated responsibility, honesty and a willingness to work. In every type of commerce the competition of supply and demand always exists, and the members know how to forge ahead to proviD. a better quality of life for their families.

This loan is destined for diversification of products, and to invest in supplies and tools that will improve the quality of their products and help them keep up with the competition.

The fact that the members are in their fourth loan cycle with their institution is because they can count on experience in solidarity groups and they know how to administer funds. This is why the foundation offers its economic help, so they and their families can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: FOR OPERATING CAPITAL FOR A VARIETY OF BUSINESSES

loans.name: God Friend Group

texts.en:
God Friend is a group of five borrowers led by Grace S.. She is 51 years old and married with six children aged 19-29 years old.  Their educational levels are 10th grade-University level.
Grace is a 9th grade dropout due to poverty.
She and her family live and work in Water Side, a commercial area in downtown Monrovia, Liberia.
 
Grace's business is preparing and selling food to residents of downtown Monrovia, Liberia.
She started this business with LD $1000.00 and has been running this business for eight years. She hopes to expand to a restaurant.
Grace gives her customers a good manner of approach and prepares her food nicely and cleanly. That's why she has so many customers and has reached this far.
She needs this loan in order to purchase more food ingredients to serve her customers.
Grace dreams of giving her children a good education and better medical care.

loans.use: To purchase more food ingredients

loans.name: Mr. Srurn Khai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank consists of sixteen people who live in the village of Tao Chanthy in the province of Takeo.

Mr. Srurn K. is the village bank president, elected by the members. He is a farmer who has a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice to earn his living. In his farming work, he presently faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizers to support the field. For this reason, he has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers in order to make his crop more productive.

His wife, Mrs. Choeuk Phall, helps him with his business. They have five children, two of whom are blacksmiths. The younger ones attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers in order to make his crop more productive

loans.name: Namjilsuren

texts.en:
Namjilsuren E. is 50 years old and lives with her husband and son in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son, Narangerel, is 20 years old and a university student.

E. operates a firewood-selling business in her town. She purchases wood from various suppliers throughout her province and transports it to Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia, to sell.

E. started her business in 2008 with capital of 1,000,000 MNT. She has made good progress with her business in her first year of operation, and continues to gain much experience. In just one year, she has doubled her working capital to a level exceeding 2,000,000 MNT. She hopes to continue to increase her earnings in the future and says, "I work hard so that I can pay tuition for my son." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood to sell.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to sell

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Oumou Boré a 41 ans et vit avec son époux et ses 7 enfants, à Wayerma I, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Oumou après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès, s’initia à l’activité de restauration  apprise auprès une tante depuis maintenant quinze ans. Elle mène son activité  à Wayerma I Sikasso devant le domicile conjugal toutes les nuits. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses plats alimentaires. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après 8 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel et tous  les prêts  précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce quatrième prêt, 26 paquets de spaghetti, 40kg de poissons frais, 40kg de haricot, 40 sachets d’Attièkè, 25 poulets, 1 sac de pomme de terre, 30kg de haricot vert et un stock de bananes plantain. 
Elle achète ses marchandises sur place et effectue ses ventes au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée des femmes, des jeunes (célibataires) surtout de noctambules. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce , contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Oumou Boré is 41 years old and lives with her husband and seven children in Wayerma I, the downtown of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  After having run many businesses unsuccessfully, she got introduced to the business of food service, which she learned from an aunt, fifteen years ago.  She runs her business in Wayerma I Sikasso in front of her conjugal home every night.  She is much in demand by her customers for the quality of the dishes she serves.  To satisfy the growing number of patrons, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago.  After eight solidarity loans (group loans) with a women's association in her district, she is now on her fourth individual loan.  All the preceding loans have been properly repaid.  She intends to use this fourth loan to buy:  26 packets of spaghetti, 40 kg of fresh fish, 40 kg of beans, 40 pouches of attièkè (a couscous made of fermented cassava), 25 hens, a sack of potatoes, 30 kg of green beans, and a stock of plantains.  Supplies are purchased locally, and sales are made in cash or on credit to customers composed of women and youngsters (unmarried), especially night owls or moonlighters.  She envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially for augmenting her working capital, helping to cover family expenses, and paying the interest on her loan.  The rest will be invested into her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chickens, beans, bananas, fresh fish, spaghetti, "attièkè", potatoes

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
This is Virgie B., a 42-year-old store owner from Executive Village, Dasmariñas, Cavite. She is also in the food business. She has five children; one is in college, two in high school, and two in grade school. Her husband drives a tricycle (local three-wheeled transport vehicle).

Virgie has been in business for ten years. She cooks and sells food while attending to her general store. She makes a net profit of more than to P30,000 per month which she uses to sustain the studies of her children.

She has just finished repaying a previous loan with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative which qualifies her for a new loan so she applied for a new loan in the amount of P17,000. This would be her eight loan with CCT. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase additional merchandise for her store so she won’t need to come to the market so often. Virgie dreams of owning a bigger grocery store.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Basoga Tweyambe Group, Jinja

texts.en: W. Rajab is the leader of his lending group in Jinja. He is a married man and his children go to school.  He has a retail shop that he has been running for a long time and a motorcycle business where he hires out men to help with bringing in an income. In his shop, he sells sugar, salt, cooking oil, bread, maize flour and muffins to his customers and the profit he gets helps him pay school fees for his children. He has also been able to buy a plot of land for his family and now they are in better shape. Rajab needs a loan to be able to buy more goods for his shop.

loans.use: Restocking his retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mr. Kong S. has used his old motorcycle to pick up the passengers for a profit and generate a daily income to support his family’s needs. Another source of family income is provided by his wife, who works cultivating rice on the land next to their house. This couple was married many years ago and has three children, one of whom works in garment factory and other two are students. Kong S. is taking out his loan to purchase a plot of neighboring farmland, well located for farming, on which he will plant a variety of crops.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of neighboring farmland

loans.name: Hayde

texts.es:
Hayde, de 20 años, es una joven muy sencilla y alegre, vive en la casa de sus familiares y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.
La venta de hoja de coca es el negocio al que se dedica, esta actividad le ha sido muy rentable y le ha dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse por sí sola. Ella compra estas hojas al por mayor, ya que le sale más barato, para luego venderlas en el pequeño puesto que tiene en la puerta de la casa donde vive alquilada.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para dedicarse a sus estudios, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta, ya que le es muy estresante. 
Hayde espera que con el tiempo su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y desea ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy querida por sus compañeras debido a la alegría que pone en el grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más bolsas de hoja de coca, ya que últimamente está teniendo mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Hayde, 20, is a cheerful and very unassuming young woman who lives with her family; what she most desires is to improve her quality of life. She sells coca leaf. This has been a very profitable business and has produced enough profits for her to be able to support herself. She buys the leaves at wholesale, because it's less expensive that way, and then she sells them at a small stand she has at her rented house. On the other hand, what she likes best about her work is that it gives her time to dedicate to her studies. She has been in this line of work for 2 years and considers the most difficult part of it to be having to stay at her sales stand all day because this is very stressful. Hayde hopes that her business will grow in time and produce higher income. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she wants to be very punctual with her payments. Her fellow communal bank members like her very much because of the cheerfulness she brings to the group. The 1000 new soles requested will be used to buy more bags of coca leaves since demand has been growing lately.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of coca leaves.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Mavis is forty – five years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two of them are currently attending school. She lives with her family in an old family house. Mavis is a trader. She trades cereals such as maize, rice and beans. She buys bags of maize, rice and beans from the farmers in her community and nearby villages. She says food vendors come from the cities to buy from her. She also sells in the local market. She has been in business for over three years. She wants to purchase stock of cereals in bulk so that she can supply to the increasing number of her customers and increase her profit margin. She desires to help her children climb the academic ladder to higher levels.

loans.use: To purchase cereals in bulk

loans.name: Katumu

texts.en:
Katumu M. is a trader selling at the heart of the Central Market Building in Bo. She is married to an Agro-Forestry worker and has two kids and six other dependents.

She has been in the business of selling cooking condiments for the past eleven years. Katumu intends to expand her business through wholesale purchasing and selling. She has a very good credit history in her group loan. 

She hope to use the proceeds of the loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more food ingredients to sell

loans.name: Liz Carol

texts.es:
La señora LIZ CAROL A. A. tiene 27 años, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LA PERBOLA II. La socia  presenta estudios hasta 5to de Secundaria, es casada, tiene 2 hijos pequeños quienes dependen económicamente de ella. Liz   se dedica venta de calzado para damas como: sandalias, zapatos y zapatillas. Compra el calzado a su tío para posteriormente llevarlos a vender a CHIMBOTE, HUARMEY Y CHICLAYO, ella refiere que prefiere vender el calzado fuera de Trujillo porque actualmente hay mucha competencia y las ventas han bajado.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró zapatos y zapatillas.
Con este crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles comprará zapatos escolares para niñas y niños, calzado para jóvenes niños y adultos.
Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas y alquilar un stand en un centro comercial en donde pueda vender  con mas tranquilidad, para lo cual esta trabajando arduamente y ahorrando.
texts.en:
Mrs.Liz Carol A. A. is 27 years old and lives in the Florenica de Mora district, in the Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She is a member of the communal bank "La Perbola II." This member went o school through the fifth grade, is married, and has two young children who depend on Liz economically. She sells women's shoes like: sandals, shoes, and sneakers. She buys shoes from an uncle and then takes them to Chimbote, Huarmey, and Chiclayo to sell. She prefers selling shoes outside of Trujillo because there is currently a lot of competition and sales have gone down. With her first loan of 300.00 soles she bought shoes and sneakers. With this loan of 500.00 soles she will buy school shoes for children, children's shoes, and shoes for adults. She dreams of increasing her sales and renting a stand in a mall where she could sell with greater calm so she is working very hard and saving

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school shoes for kids, children's and adult shoes

loans.name: Roubatou

texts.en: Roubatou A. K. is a trained seamstress. She is married to a taxi driver and has two children. She works from home in the Agoé district of Lomé, Togo and has been running her business since 2002. She is currently requesting her first loan from WAGES. She will use this loan to purchase 4 hemming machines and use the remainder to buy any haberdashery needed to keep her business running smoothly. This loan will help Mrs. K. support both her business and her family.

loans.use: To purchase hemming machines and haberdashery.

loans.name: Mario Antolino

texts.es:
el Sr. Mario Antolino Z. tiene 58 años de edad, vive en el barrio el Puente salida hacia Arenales, Trojes El Paraiso. Mario se dedica a la venta y compra de leña tambien vende materiales de construccion. tiene mas de 10 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
el credito lo utilizara para la reparacion de su pick up, vehiculo que nesecita para el acarreo de madera 
y materiales,  neceseta repararle el motor ya que este carro es el alma de su trabajo.  
Según nos comento se siente bien satisfecho con su negocio.
texts.en:
Mario Antolino Z., 58, lives in the neighborhood near the exit bridge to Arenales in Trojes, El Paraiso. He is a firewood merchant and also sells building materials and supplies; he’s been in this line of work of over 10 years. He will use the funds to repair his pick-up truck that he uses to haul wood and supplies; he needs to repair the motor because the truck is the soul of his work. He stated that he is very content with his work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy engine replacement parts.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a 30 year old medical practitioner who operates a clinic in Nairobi. He has been in this business for two years and describes it as good. He has requested a second loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to add stocks of medicine, buy a sterilizing machine, and renovate the clinic. He also practices farming to earn extra income. He hopes to have a nursing home complete with wards and a financially stable family in future. He describes himself as determined, hard-working, and focused.

loans.use: To buy a sterilizing machine, medicine and renovate the building

loans.name: Sallay

texts.en: Sallay K. sells used clothing along Campbell Street. She is married to a trader and has eight dependants. She has 15 years' experience in business. She spends her entire time in business and is requesting a loan to buy additional used clothing.  She hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to educate her children and construct a house.

loans.use: To buy used clothing for resale

loans.name: Min

texts.en:
Mrs. Min S. is a 27-year-old married woman who lives in Preal village in Takeo province. She is a farmer and also breeds pig at home, while her husband, Mr. Phirun Eang, breeds ducks for eggs. With their businesses, they earn a small income to support their family. 

To support these businesses, Mrs. Min S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farming; duck food for the duck breeding business; and piglets and pig food for pig breeding. 

This couple has three children; one is attending in the local school while the other two are two young to study or work. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, duck food, and piglets and pig food

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
la sra. Ana Cristina M. tiene 23 años de edad, tiene un hijo y su esposo se encuentra trabajando en los Estados Unidos de donde le envia dinero para que termine la casa que estan construyendo. en estos momentos vive comodamente con su hijo y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en donde vende granos basicos, manteca, frescos y otros productos de la canasta basica familiar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de otros productos que le hacen falta en su negocio para tener una mejor variedad y asi poder darles una mejor atencion a sus clientes.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y salir adelante con su hijo.
texts.en:
Ana Cristina M. is 23 years old. She has one son and her husband is working in the United States from where he sends her Money to finish the house that they are building. She currently lives comfortably with her son and she sells general food products. She has a store where she sells basic grains, butter, sodas and other basic products that a family needs.

She will use the loan for the purchase of other products that she does not have in her business so that she has better variety and this way, she can provide better service to her customers. She needs the earnings to cover housing costs and to get ahead with her son.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of butter, oil, beans, tortillas, corn flour, coffee, bread, cookies, sugar, rice, toilet paper, sanitary pads, batteries, candles, eggs, churros, sodas, juices, salsas, pastas, soaps, and pills

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana T. es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive por el sector de Narancay Bajo a unos 10 minutos de la ciudad de Cuenca siendo característica de este lugar la agricultura, muchos de sus habitantes han migrado a varios lugares del mundo para obtener mejores ingresos para  sus familias. Nuestra socia es comerciante hace 30 años, se dedica a la venta de jeans los días miércoles, sábados y también en las expo ferias que existen en la ciudad.

Nuestra socia tiene 49 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijas quienes se encuentran de 33, 31 y 23 años, sus dos hijas son casadas y viven de manera independiente, su segunda hija es soltera  y trabaja  para solventar sus gastos, su esposo es comerciante  de ropa, y con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

 Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo y ha sido una amiga del bankito quien le ha invitado a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercadería, su meta es ayudar a su hija para que realice la tesis.
texts.en:
Ana T. is a member of the Siempre Amigas (Always Friends) Communal Bank. She lives in the Narancay Bajo area, which is ten minutes from the city of Cuenca. This is a farming area, and many of the inhabitants have migrated to various places in the world in order to get better incomes for their families. Ana has been a merchant for 30 years. She sells jeans on Wednesdays and Saturdays. She also sells at the expo-fairs in the city. She is 49, married, and has three daughters. Her daughters are 33, 31, and 23 years old. Two of them are married and live independently. Her second daughter is single and works to pay her expenses. Her husband is a clothing merchant. Thanks to their combined work, they have managed to build their own home. She is in her third cycle. It was a friend from the communal bank who invited her to be part of this group of tenacious and enterprising women. She will use her new loan to buy more merchandise. Her goal is to help her daughter complete her thesis.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jeans

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 30 años, vive con su hijo en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 8 años se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando papa y también alfalfa, ya que es necesaria para la alimentación de cuyes que tiene y que están cercadas en un espacio dentro de la casa de su padre. Asimismo posee vacas, en donde extrae la leche que diariamente vende. Estos ingresos le sirven para poder sostener a su familia y también invertir en sus chacras, con el fin de aumentar su producción. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su padre, pero generalmente lo hace sola, por lo que se siente muy satisfecha, ya que la venta de cuyes y papa va en aumento, ante esto trata de sembrar variedad de papa ya que es más rentable. Sus planes es  industrializar su granja de cuyes y tener más extensiones de terreno. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece además aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de madera y rejillas de metal para ampliar su granja con nuevos galpones de cuyes y sacos de abono para sembrar papa y alfalfa.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 30 years old and lives with her son at her parents’ house. She’s been farming for eight years; raising potatoes. She also raises alfalfa, which she needs to feed her Guinea pigs, which she raises in a dedicated area at her father’s home. She also has cows which produce milk that she sells each day. This income helps to support her family and also allows her to invest into her land in order to increase her production. She sometimes gets help from her father, but she usually does the work herself. It makes her feel very satisfied, especially because her sales of Guinea pigs and potatoes are increasing. She tries to plant more varieties of potatoes because it’s more profitable. Her goals are to industrialize her Guinea pig farm and acquire more extensions to her land. This will be her seventh loan through MFP and she is very happy to know that she has some financial backing. She has proven to be responsible in making her payments and she really enjoys being part of a communal group because all of its members are responsible and very supportive. She also very much appreciates the people who will make this loan possible, which will be very helpful to her business. She will use the money from this loan to buy lumber and metal fencing in order to expand her farm with new sheds for her Guinea pigs. She will also buy sacs of fertilizer in order to plant more potatoes and alfalfa.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Carmen Pilar

texts.es:
Carmen Pilar B. A., tiene 23 años.  Es soltera y vive con los padres y hermanos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene  hijo.

Carmen es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Carmen se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz y maíz en ciclo cortó. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas en Fertiza y en el comercial Peña y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de  arroz y maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es prosperar en el trabajo. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Carmen Pilar B. A. is 23 years old. She is single, and she lives with her parents and her siblings. She lives in the Ventanas province in Los Ríos. She does not have children. Carmen is a member of the “Valle Alto” (High Valley) Communal Bank. It is located in the Voluntad de Dios precint, which is an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 23 members in all, and most of them devote themselves to agriculture. This is their second loan with the Cooperativa San José. Carmen is a farmer, and she grows rice and corn in a short cycle. She makes her purchases every month at Fertiza in the city of Ventanas and at the Peña market, and she sells her products at the same place She is requesting the loan to buy rice and corn seeds. She thinks that the loan is an opportunity go get ahead. Her dream is to prosper in her work. She faces challenges like pest infestation. She likes to play sports.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and corn seeds

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.en:
Rosa Angelica C. M. is 61 years old. She lives in Chillanes, in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. Rosa has 5 children, ages 41, 37, 35, 34, and 33. 

Rosa is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members. Most of the group, including Rosa, work in agriculture. Rosa buys and sells products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther.

Rosa hopes to use the loan to buy compost for her cacao crops. The loan would enable her to be more productive. In the next five years, her goal is to improve her home and add a well for water.

She spends her free time in the house doing domestic chores.

loans.use: Purchase compost for cacao crops

loans.name: Faauluuluga

texts.en:
Faauluuluga T. T. S. is 29, married, and has three children. She owns a business venture planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Faauluuluga has two years of experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 320 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
Faauluuluga joined Kiva partner, SPBD, in 2010, and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are Faauluuluga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a fifty-eight year old father of five children and married to Mrs Juliana, who is forty-nine years old. He runs a busy hotel at his home centre called Kapkangani, and in his free time he practices farming with the help of his wife. He has been in the hotel business for one year now and from it he makes a good profit.

He was introduced to Kadet through an existing client and with this first loan he plans to buy more stock for his hotel and acquire new furniture.

His future plan is to own a big hotel in the centre and to buy a plot and develop it.

loans.use: To buy stock for his hotel, i.e baking flour, cooking oil.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 46 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Salvador (52), y de  sus 2 jóvenes  hijos, juntos se esfuerzan a diario para salir adelante. Desde hace varios años esta trabajadora mujer se dedica en la venta de tortas y kekes, ella empezó desde su casa, vendiendo chupetes, yogurt, golosinas  y todo lo que la imaginación se lo permitía, ya que siempre ha mostrado estar dispuesta en ayudar a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar. Al cabo de dos años tuvo la iniciativa de estudiar repostería y desde entonces emprendió su propio negocio, es así que se encuentra preparando tortas, bocaditos y helados, disfruta mucho la actividad que realiza, ofreciendo los más deliciosos postres a sus habituales compradores, que en su mayoría son comerciantes de las  tiendas de su zona. Ni bien termina de preparar ya tiene toda su producción vendida, y para aumentar su producción, se asoció con una amiga para vender en mayor cantidad, pues sola no se abastecía. Así transcurren los días de esta laboriosa mujer que siempre busca mejorar su negocio, es por eso que para el futuro tiene planeado comprar un horno nuevo, para vender ella misma sus tortas, kekes y bocadillos a los grandes centros comerciales de su ciudad. Es el 13 avo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente como siempre, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de ingredientes al por mayor, pues necesita para preparar sus postres porque  que tiene varios pedidos por cumplir,  de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María is 46-years-old. She lives in the house she owns with her husband Salvador (52-years-old). They have two young children and everyday the family works together to get ahead. For several years this hardworking woman has sold cakes and kekes (pastries). She began working out of her house, selling pacifiers, yogurt, candy, and everything else you can imagine because she's always been willing to help her husband earn money for the family expenses. After two years she took the initiative to study baking and since then she's opened her own business. That's how she found herself making cakes, pastries, and ice creams. She enjoys her occupation and she offers the most delicious desserts to her loyal customers, who are primarily shopkeepers from the neighborhood stores. As soon as she makes her products they're sold. To increase her production she teamed up with a friend to sell a greater quantity. She couldn't do it all on her own. 

That's how the days pass for this hardworking woman who's always looking to improve her business. She's planning to to buy a new oven in the future so that she can sell her cakes, kekes, and other products to big commercial centers in the city. This is her 13th loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually, as always. She's very grateful to everyone who's made this money possible. It will allow her to continue working in search of progress. María plans to invest the loan in wholesale ingredients that she needs to make her desserts because she has various orders to complete and in this way she hopes to improve her income.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to prepare her cakes and bocaditos

loans.name: Ana Suheildy
