texts.es: La Señora Ana tiene 34 años, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, ella empezó a trabajar cuando tenía 10 años de edad con su hermano vendiendo frutas en el mercado con el paso del tiempo fue mejorando su negocio y por medio de una amiga que vendía cosméticos inicio su negocio. Tiene muchos clientes pues siempre esta brindándole muy buen servicio a sus clientes. El crédito lo utilizara para comprar mercadería y así surtir bien su negocio. Con su mercadería bien surtida tendrá muchas ventas y por ende más ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Ana is 34 years old and works selling general merchandise.  When she was 10 years old, she began to work with her brother selling fruit in the market and over time, she improved her business and with the help of a friend who sold cosmetics, she began her merchandise business.  She has many customers and is always providing good service to them.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise and stock her business.  With more varied merchandise, she will have many sales and therefore, more earnings, which she needs to cover the household expenses.

loans.use: General merchandise

loans.name: Gibson

texts.en:
Gibson is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where he has been farming for five years. He has a mixed farm which produces maize, milk and beans which are all sold locally. He is also employed as a casual worker in the same region. His biggest challenges have been diseases which are too costly to treat and fluctuation in the market prices of produce.

Gibson is 30 years old. He is married with three children who are now between the ages of 18 months and 6 years old. Two of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested this loan of 34,320 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to meet the basic needs of his family. He hopes to purchase more dairy cows in future that will increase his productivity.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther, de 39 años, vive al lado de sus 3 hijos menores y de su madre, juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. El día para esta laboriosa mujer empieza con los primeros rayos de luz, pues la venta de bebidas calientes, que es el oficio al que  se dedica no puede esperar. Desplaza  su modulo especial para esta labor hasta la esquina de una transitada avenida, y en ese lugar empieza a las 5 de la mañana con la venta de emoliente, quinua, ponche de habas, maca (bebidas energizantes), y su actividad se prolonga hasta las 11 de la mañana. Con el tiempo sus clientes le sugerían más opciones de productos comestibles, desde entonces ofrece diversos sanguches que complementan su exquisita propuesta.  En la tarde empieza otra vez con la venta de bebidas calientes, desde las 6 de la tarde hasta las 11 de la noche. A ella le gusta mucho su labor pues le genera regulares ganancias. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio, pues ya esta analizando vender también otro tipo de bebidas que sabe tendrán mucha acogida. Es el  primer  crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Esther tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales (ladrillos, cementos entre otros) para terminar de construir un baño e instalar una cochera en su casa, y con el alquiler de esta pieza espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Esther is 39 years old.  She lives with her 3 dependent children and her mother.  Together they work hard every day to get ahead.  This hard-working woman's day begins with the first rays of light since her business is selling hot drinks and it can't wait.  She moves her special unit to the corner of a busy avenue and there she begins, at 5 in the morning, to sell 'emoliente' (a traditional, medicinal drink), 'quinua' (quinoa drink), 'ponche de habas' (hot drink made from bean flour, milk, water, sugar, vanilla, cloves, cinnamon), and 'maca' (similar drink but made with 'maca' – a native root vegetable).  The last two drinks are energizing drinks.  She finishes at 11 in the morning.

Over time, Esther's customers suggested she sell food products too.  Since then, she also offers different sandwiches.  In the afternoon, Esther begins selling her hot drinks again from 6 in the afternoon to 11 at night.  She likes her work a lot since it makes her regular income.  As she is an enterprising woman, in the future she plans to expand her business.  She is already looking at selling another type of drinks which she knows will be very popular.

This is Esther's first loan with MFP and she promises to make her repayments punctually as she doesn't want to disappoint the people who made this support possible since it will enable her to continue working in search of progress.  Esther is planning to invest her loan in buying materials (bricks and cement among other things) to finish building a bathroom and install a garage in her house.  By renting out the garage, she hopes to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy building materials to adapt her bathroom and build a garage which she will then rent out

loans.name: Bihija

texts.en:
Bihija is a single woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.
Bihija has operated a business selling handbags and shoes from home for the past two years. Neighbors and passers-by are her major customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. In the future, she hopes to establish a beauty salon and boutique.
With this 35,000 KES loan she wants to purchase a bale of handbags and shoes for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of handbags and shoes

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg B. is 48 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Hovd Province in Western Mongolia. She and her family have lived together in their own apartment for past 5 years. Her older daughter attends university and youngest two daughters both attend a local secondary school.

Narantsetseg operates a machinery parts trading business at the local technical market in her town with the help of her husband. She started her business in 2008 and has built a stable operation since then. Her earnings have enabled her to pay her two children's tuition fees. 

Narantsetseg is a modest and hardworking person. Her main goal is to provide for her children's educations and to help them become a good and responsible persons. In the future, she hopes to expand her business by increasing her working capital. She is requesting a  800,000 MNT loan to buy supplies for her machinery parts trading business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her machinery parts store

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Badenya sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 3 enfants et qui  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à MAMASSONI  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur huitième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Les prêts précédents ont été  bien soldés. Elles font la vente de fruits et légumes  avec YOUMA K., la restauration, etc. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, YOUMA compte acheter, 10 paniers de fruits et légumes.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de SIKASSO.
Elle vend à domicile, au marché de Sikasso et dans les villages voisins, au comptant souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle compte avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The members of the group Badenya are essentially married women averaging 36 years of age and three children living in monogamous families in MAMASSONI, a district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are on their eighth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers.  The previous loans have all been settled.  

The group members sell fruit and vegetables, as is the case with Ms. YOUMA K., and they are active in food service, etc.  With her loans YOUMA plans on buying 10 baskets of fruit and vegetables.  She gets her supplies at the big market of Sikasso.  Accepting cash and often credit from a customer base composed of men and women, she makes her sales out of her home, at the Sikasso market, and in neighboring villages.  

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 37,500 francs CFA. Part of the profits will be put into savings and used for meeting family needs. The other part will be invested in her business.  She is counting on having more capital in order to satisfy her customers further.

loans.use: Buying fruit

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 29 year-old Fatmata C.. She is married and has two children, ages four and seven. In 2000, Fatmata C. established her cooking utensils business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband support their family. Working six days a week and six hours a day, she earns about Le 300,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more assorted food. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 500,000. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a bigger shop in order to sell wholesale to other traders and she would like to hire sales people. Fatmata is very determined and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more assorted food.

loans.name: Maliza

texts.en:
Maliza N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Maliza has a small cosmetics shop business, which she has run for five years.
To help expand her business, Maliza has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase cosmetics for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Maliza hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a plot of land.
Maliza is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by assisting her in improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Rakhatbek

texts.en:
Rakhatbek A. is the only bread-winner for his small family, which consist of an aged mother and younger sister. They live in Zhan-Bulak village and earn their living through breeding cattle.  Rakhatbek started this business with the initial capital of 25,000 KGS and managed to earn about 2,000 KGS in a month. Today Rakhatbek’s farm amounts to two cows, two bull-calves, fifteen goats and one horse.  With the revenues from this activity, he was able to buy a plot of land. 

In order to further develop the farm, Rakhatbek applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS. With the revenues, he plans to start building a house for his family. 

About Bai-Tushum and Partners
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Loyda

texts.es:
Loyda, de 32 años, vive en la casa de su madre al lado de ella, su hermana y sus dos pequeñas hijas; y cada día es de lucha constante para salir adelante. 

Desde hace 10 años, esta trabajadora mujer instaló en una pieza de su casa una tienda de comestibles variados y el tiempo le ha permitido surtirla cada vez más. Le gusta mucho su negocio pues no hay competencia cercana en su zona lo que le permite obtener regulares ganancias. Ella atiende la mayoría de veces sola, pero en las oportunidades que debe salir a comprar mas mercadería deja en el negocio a su sobrina; y como es una mujer que siempre piensa en el futuro ya planeo abastecer su negocio de útiles escolares, pues  se acerca la campaña escolar y quiere ofrecer lo mejor a sus habituales clientes, que muchas veces requieren de útiles para sus hijos y por lo alejado de la zona no lo pueden realizar. 

Loyda tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de cantidad de variada mercadería en útiles escolares, pues desea ampliar su negocio y mejorar sus ganancias. 

Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca  del progreso.
texts.en:
Loyda, age 32, lives with her mother in her home along with her sister and her two young daughters. Each day is a constant struggle to get ahead.

Ten years ago, this hardworking woman set aside part of her home in order to open a store where she now sells various food products. She was able to stock her business over time. Loyda enjoys managing her business since there is no other competition in her area, which allows her to generate steady income. Most of the time she manages her business by herself, but there are times when she leaves her niece in charge because she must go out to buy merchandise. Since she is a woman who is always planning for the future, Loyda will stock her business with school supplies for the upcoming school year. She always wants to offer the best to her regular customers, who often need supplies for their children but cannot buy them because they live in a remote area.

Loyda plans to invest the money she invested in the purchase of a wide variety of school supplies. She wants to expand her business and improve her earnings.

This is her third loan with MFP. She promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to look bad in the eyes of those who made this loan possible so that she can continue working and making progress.

loans.use: Purchase various school supplies to sell in her store

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Marta E. D. P. tiene un taller D. costura, donD. confecciona uniformes para colegios, posee un local en su domicilio desD. hace un cierto tiempo y solicita el préstamo para comprar más telas y seguir trabajando D. forma independiente en su local, ya que posee mucha demanda D. ropas para esta época D. colegio.
La  señora agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya, porque gracias a ella anteriormente pudo aumentar más su stock D. telas para satisfacer la demanda D. los clientes y ahora espera recibir la misma ayuda económica D. Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Marta E. D. P. has a sewing workshop where she produces school uniforms. This business has occupied a space in her home for some time. Maria is requesting a loan to buy more fabrics so that she can continue working independently in her shop. There is great demand for clothes for the school season.

Sra. Maria is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya because her previous loans were used to increase her inventory of fabrics so that she could meet the demand of her customers. Now she hopes to receive the same financial support from Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Jose Juan

texts.es: El Señor José Juan tiene la edad de 24 años, es originario de la comunidad de Francisco Serrato en el estado Michoacán, el está pidiendo su préstamo a Fundación Realidad para la compra de frutas y legumbres como plátanos, aguacates, zanahorias, etc. Don Juan tiene su puesto en la ciudad de México, en el mercado de la Merced, desde hace 8 años, pero tiene una experiencia desde hace 17 años ya que él empezó a trabajar en el puesto de sus papás a la edad de 8 años, y comenta que ya no siguió estudiando por ayudarles a ellos. El señor José Juan vive en unión libre desde hace 8 años con la señora Crisanta que se dedica a ayudarle a su marido en el puesto que tienen en el mercado de México, ellos tienen 2 hijos  de nombres Jacqueline de 5 años y Emmanuel de 2 años. Él es una persona muy trabajadora ya que se levanta diariamente a las tres de la mañana para surtirse en la central de abastos de la ciudad de México. Don Juan comenta que ahorita uno de sus retos es terminar su casita que está haciéndole a su familia que poco a poco le ha estado metiendo ya que a ahorrado para hacerlo y gracias a los préstamos, él a surtido muy bien su puesto de frutas y legumbres y así le da mas ganancias y así va poder terminar su casa para sus pequeños hijos. Comenta que sus planes y metas  en la vida es terminar su casita y que espera pronto lograrlo, seguir invirtiéndole a su negocio y poder rentar un local para vender sus frutas y legumbres. El señor Juan dice que con las ganancias que saque de la venta de la fruta va a comprar varilla, cemento, arena y otras cosas más para la construcción y poder terminar su casa.
texts.en:
José Juan, 24, is originally from the community of Francisco Serrato in the state of Michoacán.  He is asking Fundación Realidad for a loan to buy fruit and vegetables like, bananas, avocadoes, carrots, etc.  He has had a stand in Mexico City’s La Merced Market for 8 years and comments that his experience goes back 17 years because he started working in his parents’ stand when he was 8 years old.  He comments that he did not stay in school because he was helping them.

José Juan has lived for the last 8 years in a common law relationship with Crisanta who helps her husband with the stand they have in the market in Mexico City. They have two children: Jacqueline, 5 and Emmanuel, 2.

He is a very hard working person who rises daily at 3am to stock up at Mexico City’s wholesale foodstuffs market.  Juan comments that right now one of his challenges is to finish his house that he’s building for his family.   He’s been investing his savings into it bit by bit and, thanks to the loans, he has been able to stock his fruit and vegetable stand very well which produces more profits.  This way he will be able to finish his house for his little children.

He comments that his life plans and goals are to finish the house, which he hopes to do soon, and to continue investing in the business to be able to rent a locale to sell his fruit and vegetables.  Juan says that he will use the profits he makes from the fruit and vegetable sales to buy iron rods, cement, sand and other building materials to finish his house.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a hardworking married woman with three children living in her own permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda, with a family dream of educating her children up to the university level.  She raises poultry and also runs a shop in a nearby trading centre.  She is so proud of her businesses as she has been able to educate her children despite challenges like the current inflation in the country.  Her desire is to become a wholesale seller.  Margret intends to use the loan facility to buy feed and medicine for her poultry.

loans.use: To buy feed and medicine for her poultry.

loans.name: Chrispus

texts.en: Chrispus M., a 39-year-old father of three married to Mariamu, a housewife, has been operating a retail shop in Mariakani for the last two years. This will be Chrispus’s first loan from KADET with which he plans to add stocks of bread, maize flour, wheat flour and soft drinks to his shop. He will direct the extra income generated from his business to the repayment of the loan. Chrispus’s dream is to expand his business.

loans.use: to add stocks of bread, maize flour, wheat flour and soft drinks

loans.name: Fiorella Del Carmen

texts.es:
Fiorella tiene 25 años de edad, ella es conviviente.  Vive en casa propia con su esposo, la casa está ubicada en una zona rural llamado Caserío Pedregal Alto  Distrito de  Tambogrande del departamento de Piura, donde no cuentan con los servicios básicos. 

Fiorella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros los cuales los vende recorriendo caseríos cercanos donde tiene clientela conocida y cobra semanalmente, Esta actividad la realizan desde hace más de 1 año. Su esposo agricultor, aportando de esta manera en la canasta familiar.

Fiorella esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 para que ella pueda comprar mas mercadería (prendas de vestir),pueda innovarlo con ropa de temporada y por consiguiente pueda incrementar sus ventas y seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Fiorella es conocida en su comunidad por su entusiasmo y empeño de salir adelante día día, ella es una madre muy entregada a su familia y es por eso que se esfuerza por darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fiorella is 25 years old and lives together with her common-law husband, in their own home, which is located in a rural area called Pedregal Alto, in Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  They do not have basic services.

Fiorella sells men's and women's clothes.  She sells her products in nearby villages where she has established customers and collects payment every week.  She has been in this business for more than one year and, through her work, she helps cover her family's basic expenses.

Fiorella is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy more merchandise, refreshing her business with seasonal clothing.  This will enable her to increase her sales, continue growing in her business and improve her quality of life.

Fiorella is known in her community for her enthusiasm and commitment in getting ahead day by day.  She is a mother who is very committed to her family and, for this reason, she works hard to provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise so that she can refresh her business with seasonal clothing

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years in Kitale town in western Kenya. His farm produces milk, bananas, eggs, and maize which are all sold to the local market. He earns additional income from his food kiosk in the same location. 

Alex has made his fourth loan request of 40,000 Kes from Juhudi Kilimo in order to expand his poultry farm. He intends to use this loan to purchase additional stock of poultry and construct a better poultry house. He says that this will help him practice commercial poultry farming and this will increase his profits. The extra income from this loan will help improve his family's livelihood. In the future, he would like to keep exotic breeds of poultry for both broilers and layers.

Alex is 35 years old and married with seven children.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farm.

loans.name: Chingiz

texts.en:
Chingiz is married and has 3 children. He is 41 years old. Chingiz needs 2000 AZN to buy spare parts for his car. 
Chingiz lives in Absheron region with his wife and 3 children. He learned this business from his friend who has a taxi too. , Chingiz has been working in the Taxi business for the last 9 years.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 15 years. He is 41 years old, married to Hannah and they have three children who attend school.. 

John was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.  He will sell his produce in the local market.

In future, John hopes to become a successful farmer in Olkalou and also to open a clothes shop to boost his income.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Narmine

texts.en:
Narmine is a 26 years old married woman and the owner of a baby clothing shop.  Narmine is a hard working woman.  She  sells accessories in addition to baby clothes in order to attract more customers and to increase her profits.

Narmine is a woman with good reputation and she is liked by most of her customers and friends,  Narmine is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner for the second time in order to increase her summer clothes collection.  Her previous loan had a positive effect on her business.  This time she hopes it will have the same effect.  In addition to that, Narmine might do a certain treatment for her face.  Narmine hopes to expand her business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To increase her stock of summer clothing

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, tiene la edad de 44 años, está divorciada, vive con su hija que es su mayor prioridad. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para su asistencia de su cafetal. Ella cuenta con el terreno sembrado de café en una zona apta para la explotación del cultivo en buenas condiciones por lo cual es que ella quiere invertir en estas mejoras. Ella quiere poder obtener mejores cosechas este año y así poder seguir generando el bienestar de su hija y el de ella en su futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Sonia is 44 years old. She is divorced and lives with her daughter, who is her top priority.

With her loan, she intends to buy supplies for her coffee farm. She has the land sown with coffee in an area that is good for coffee-growing, which is why she wants to invest in these improvements. She wants to get better harvests this year so she can continue ensuring her own and her daughter's well-being in the future.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has never had loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow coffee

loans.name: Munduli Group

texts.en:
Sinajumu is in her early 50s and married with four children, two of whom go to school, and two grand children, one of whom goes to school.  She has been running a business selling fruits and vegetables, plus dry food like wheat flour, sugar and baking flour (this business is called genge duka). She works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her first Motisha loan from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She wants a loan to increase her business. Her dream is to one day be able to add two other rooms to her house. She has built two rooms so far and she wants to be able to have four rooms altogether.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Munduli B" which has a total of 10 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fruits, vegetables and dry foods

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a 30-year-old married woman with 4 children and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. Oliver has been operating a retail shop for 5 years. She started with 500,000 UGX and now has 3,500,000 UGX. Her hardship is bad debts and her vision is a wholesale business, a residential house, plus educating children. Oliver needs the loan to buy sodas, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: To buy sodas, sugar and soap

loans.name: Nelly Soraya

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unión De Mujeres se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par” por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nelly, tiene 41 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación que tuvo tiene dos hijos de 17 y 9 años de edad, los dos estudian en colegio y escuela. Nuestra amiga esta en el Banco Comunal desde que se inicio y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó su negocio que le ha permitido sacar sola a sus hijos adelante.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y así sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además en ciertas ocasiones también se dedica a la compra y venta de gallinas criollas. Trabaja todos los días ya que realiza trabajos domésticos en una casa de la localidad, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Tiene 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. 

Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos sean profesionales y personas de bien.
texts.en:
The Women's Union Community Bank meets every two weeks in the charming city of Calceta. It is known as "Calceta without equal" because of its beautiful women and because locals think there is no place more beautiful on Earth. 

Here we meet Nelly, who is 41 years old. She is separated from her spouse, but they have two children, ages 17 and 9. Both are in school. Our friend Nelly is part of the Women's Union Community Bank, which she helped found. She appreciates the loans she has received, which have allowed her to start her own business and look after her children on her own. 

Nelly is a homemaker who, in order to earn her own income and raise her children, sells clothing (via catalogue) and Yanbel merchandise (beauty products, makeup, perfume, women's accessories). She occasionally buys and sells chickens, and also works every day cleaning houses in her neighbourhood. Nelly works on credit and collects her payment each weekend. She has been doing this for 10 years and it's still going very well. 

Nelly will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, makeup and all sorts of clothing. 

She dreams of seeing her children become professionals who are also good people.

loans.use: buy perfumes, creams, makeup and clothing.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 51 год. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж находится в России. Сама Фотима имеет высшее образование. Она по профессии товаровед. В этой области она проработала 25 лет. Кроме того в свободное от работы время Фотима занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Кредит берет для приобретения тканей и цветных ниток.
texts.en: Fotima lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 51 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is in Russia. Fotima has a higher education.She is a merchandiser by profession. She has worked in her profession for 25 years.  Additionally, in her free time she sews traditional dresses. She is taking out a loan to buy fabric and different-colored thread.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is aged 56 and married with six children with only the last two still schooling. He lives with his family in Kitale, Western Kenya where he has been practicing mixed farming. His farm currently produces milk and eggs for the local market.

Philip has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to  buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the cow will provide milk both for family consumption and commercial purposes. He says he will use the income to improve his family living standard as well as venture into the motorcycle business.

Philip laments animal feed shortages which limit dairy output significantly. He is keen on repaying the loan to acquire more amounts.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Flor De Mayo Chuisuc Group

texts.es:
La señora Ana Maria es casada, tiene 41 años de edad, , cursó los 4 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a presta el servicio de molino de mixtamal, con 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para invertirlo en la apertura de una tienda, la compra de agua gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, dulces, agua pura, comida en lata, lácteos, etc. Espera en el futuro ver su negocio prospero. Las demás integrantes se dedica a la tejeduría, crianza de animales, atención a tienda.
texts.en:
Ms. Ana Maria is married, 41 years old, and studied for four years in primary school. She has three children, two of which are in school. She offers a corn milling service and has five years of experience. She counts on the support of her husband, who supports her economically.

She organized a group so that they would be able to request a loan, which she will use to invest in opening a store. She will buy soda water, juices, candies, sweets, still water, canned food, dairy products, etc. She hopes to see her business prosper in the future.

The other group members are weavers, shopkeepers, or raise animals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to open her store

loans.name: Jose Pepe

texts.es:
EEl socio pertenece al banco comunal ”LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Jose; El socio tiene 45 años de edad, el socio es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 15, 8 años de edad; el socio  trabaja por las tardes y noches tocando en un grupo de música llamado “ALMENDRA”, el socio integra junto a tres amigos músicos este grupo el cual anima en todos los eventos matrimoniales y otros compromisos en el bello poblado de Andahuaylillas, el socio toca, batería, guitarra, órgano, cajón, el socio y sus amigos trabajan animando estos eventos semanalmente, el socio también tiene terrenos de cultivos de maíz, y junto a sus conyugue trabajan vendiendo lo que producen sus terrenos, en esta ocasión el socio desea invertir el crédito en uso de su hogar en la comida diaria, él desea poder comprar víveres para las dos semanas siguientes y dar una parte a su conyugue para que ella invierta en un nuevo negocio para apoyar en casa al conyugue. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en el hogar en viveres.

El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the communal bank “Las Emprendedoras de Andahuaylillas” (The Entrepreneurs of Andahuaylillas). The communal bank is located in the Andahuaylillas district in the Cusco province, department of Cusco. 

The borrower is Jose. He is 45 years old, and he lives with his life partner and has two children who are 15 and 8 years old. In the afternoons and evenings he plays in the musical group called “Almendra.” He and three musician friends got together to make this group which plays at all the weddings and other events in the beautiful valley of Andahuaylillas. Jose plays the drums, guitar, organ, and crate. He and his friends liven up these weekly events. 

Jose also has corn fields, and together with his partner they work selling what their fields produce. At this time Jose would like to invest his loan into his household’s daily food. He would like to be able to buy supplies for the next two weeks and give a portion to his partner so that she can invest it into a new business to supply the household. He asks for a loan to invest in household supplies. 

Jose is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the terms of the agreement according to the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to invest in household supplies

loans.name: Sebastina  Hermila

texts.es:
La señora  Sebastiana  Hermila se  dedica a  la venta de artesanías   desde  hace  ocho años  desde chica le gustaba tejer y bordar  y le da las  gracias a dios cumplir sus sueños de tener su propio negocio 
Lo que más le gusta  hacer son los huipiles lo disfruta más, antes le costaba mucho trabajo  hacerlos pero con el paso del tiempo aprendió  combinar mas colores y diseños.
 Tiene  cuarenta y nueve años de edad  y está felizmente casada con el señor  Renato  Sacarías de  cincuenta años de edad  con quien tiene  una hija  Marlene de dieciocho  años de edad a quien también le gusta tejer y bordar.
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar más: hilos de colores, manta y  listones, ya que las batas   que elabora  son muy coloridas y  necesitan llevar muchos  hilos  de colores y listones.
Uno de sus sueños es   que todas las personas  vean  sus huipiles  y batas  y admiren su trabajo y  que las usen la ropa la usen  con orgullo por que  ella las hace con amor y dedicación.
Si quisiera tener otro negocio seria  tener una tienda de abarrotes pero sin dejar de tejer  que es  lo que más le gusta  y la llena de orgullo.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudar a las personas que tiene  deseo de empezar su propio negocio  y a las personas que desean engrandecerlo.
texts.en:
Señora Sebastiana Hermila has been selling handicrafts for 8 years. As a girl she liked to weave and embroider and thanks god for fulfilling her dream of owning her own business.

What she likes and enjoys making the most are the traditional embroidered dresses. Before she found making them to be hard work but with the passage of time she learned how to combine more colours and designs.

She is 49 years old. She is happily married to Señor Renato Sacarías who is 50 years old and with whom she has a daughter Marlene who is 18 years old and also likes to weave and embroider.

She asked for the loan to buy more: coloured threads, blankets and ribbons as the housecoats she makes are very colourful and need many different coloured threads and ribbons.

One of her dreams is that everyone who sees her traditional embroidered dresses and housecoats admires her work and wears her clothes with pride as she makes them with love and dedication.

If she were to have another business it would be a grocery store but without leaving her weaving as this is what she likes doing the most and fills her with pride. She gives her thanks to the Fundacion for helping people who have the desire to start their own business and those who want to expand them.

loans.use: to buy coloured threads, blankets and ribbons to make traditional embroidered dresses, blouses and housecoats.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David, aged 36, is a single, hardworking businessman. For the last three years, he has been quarrying to make a living. He describes his business prospects as favorable since his potential customers are local residents. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. To that end, David has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a piece of land for quarrying. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for quarrying.

loans.name: Egnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe EGNON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la première  fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Guillaume est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Guillaume est âgé de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Guillaume a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Guillaume est célibataire. Afin de subvenir à ses diverses charges, Guillaume vend depuis une dizaine d’années, des vêtements de façon ambulante. Guillaume désire agrandir et diversifier son activité par la vente de tissus et de produits de mercerie. Guillaume s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Guillaume sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe EGNON, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The EGNON group is made up of three people who live in the same area. It's the first time that the group is asking for financial assistance from Alidé, in order to increase their activity levels. The representative of the group, named Guillaume, est the one with his hand raised in the photo. Guillaume is thirty-six years old and lives in Benin. Guillaume stopped school at the secondary level. Guillaume is single. In order to meet his various expenses, Guillaume has sold clothing on a traveling basis for around a dozen years. Guillaume wants to increase and diversify his activity with the sales of fabrics and notions. Guillaume stocks up in a market in Benin. With the goal of the satisfaction of his customers and to increase his turnover and his profits, Guillaume is asking for a first loan from Alidé, together with the other members of the EGNON group.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and notions.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga owns a 2-rooms apartment which is built early in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He works as a accountant in a private food company and lives with his wife and son. 

Gantulga always thinks about renovating and making improvements to his apartment because it has become very old and is damaged everywhere. Last September, he started the renovation of his apartment, but he could not finish it due to lack of money to purchase the necessary building materials. The loan he is taking out will be used to purchase the building materials needed to complete the renovation of his apartment.

loans.use: renovate his apartment

loans.name: Zoumana

texts.fr:
Âgé de 40 ans et ayant deux épouses, père de 3 enfants, ZOUMANA  vit dans une famille polygame dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso).  
ZOUMANA n’a pas eu la chance d’être instruit  raison pour laquelle il s’est basé sur les  activités  génératrices de revenus  depuis sa jeunesse qu’il apprit  auprès de son feu père commerçant. Il est spécialisé dans le commerce d’articles divers de boutique. 
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle en nette croissance et l’agrandissement de son activité,  Monsieur ZOUMANA a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  depuis 3 ans.  Il est à son  sixième  prêt individuel et tous cinq les prêts  précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté. 
Ce prêt sixième prêt sera  utilisé pour l’acquisition des stocks de  diverses marchandises (lait en poudre, sucre, thés, cigarettes, boîtes de conserves, biscuits). Il s’approvisionne auprès  des grossistes de Koutiala et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique où il habite à une clientèle mixte au comptant.
Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, Monsieur compte réaliser un  bénéfice mensuel de 150.000 FCFA  qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro, satisfaire le besoin de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
At 40 years old Zoumana has two wives, is the the father of three children, and lives in a polygamous family in the town of Koutiala (in the Sikasso region).

Zoumana was not given the opportunity to pursue his education, which is why he has focused since his youth on income-generating activities learned from his late merchant father. He specializes in selling sundry shop items.

To ensure the satisfaction of an increasing number of customers and the expansion of his business, Mr. Zoumana approached the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution three years ago. He is now on his sixth individual loan and all five previous loans were repaid without difficulty.

This sixth loan will be used to acquire a stock of various commodities (milk powder, sugar, tea, cigarettes, canned goods, cookies). He resupplies at Koutiala wholesalers and sells retail in his home-based shop, for cash only to a mixed clientele .

With the expansion of his business, Mr. Zoumana expects a monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA, that will be used to repay Soro loan interests, meet family needs and reinvest the remainder in the business.

loans.use: Buy various products

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 25-year-old, single woman. She runs a retail shop, which she has been operating for four years. The business earns her a monthly income of approximately 8,500 KES.

This is her first loan requested through KADET. She plans on using the funds to buy sugar, rice, and wheat flour for re-sale purposes. Mercy would like to open a hotel with the anticipated profits generated as a result of the loan, and she hopes to own a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods (e.g., wheat flour, sugar, and rice)

loans.name: Nedy

texts.es: Nedy, de 23 años, convive con Freddy de 25 años de edad,  viven en una casa alquilada y espera que en el futuro les vaya muy bien. Nedy, a pesar de su corta edad es una persona de negocio, que sabe cómo administrar entre las labores de su casa y su pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Es por eso que atiende a la clientela desde muy temprano para así quedar bien con la gente que acude a su negocio. Para Nedy el puesto de su bodega le es muy  rentable porque vende su mercadería a precios cómodos y sabe cómo conquistar a sus consumidores. Su negocio se incio hace 05 años en su propia casa situada en el distrito de Kimbiri, con el poco tiempo que lleva en el negocio ya obtuvo buenos ingresos,  razón por la cual piensa ampliar su casa y disponer mayor cantidad de productos. Este es el crédito número 06 con MFP, está  comprometida para pagar sus cuotas, ya que no quiere ocasionar problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles, mejorará su quiosco, a la vez comprará más mercaderías.
texts.en:
Nedy, is 23, and lives with Freddy, who is 25. They live in a rented house, and hope that things will go very well for them in the future. Nedy, in spite of her young age, is a business person, who knows how to manage between her household chores, and her small grocery store.

That's why that she serves her clients from early in the day, in order to make a good impression on the people who come to her business. For Nedy, her grocery stand is very profitable, because she sells her merchandise at affordable prices, and knows how to win over customers.

She started her business five years ago in her own home, located in Kimbiri district. In the short time she has been in business, she has already earned a good income. This is why she is thinking of expanding her home, and having a greater quantity of products available.

This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she promises to pay her instalments, as she doesn't wish to cause problems for the members of her communal bank, where she feels very happy. With the 2,500 nuevos soles, she will improve her kiosk, and at the same time buy more merchandise.

loans.use: To improve her kiosk, and buy more goods for stocking it.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina lives in the coastal town of Changamwe. She is a married mother of three children and runs a food stall marketing meat directly from the slaughter houses. She started the business from an $18 capital.

Tina faces the challenge of lack of proper storage methods and would like to have storage facilities and proper display. The others are fragile business climate and some clients not paying on time. She also looks forward to owning a soft drinks depot. Tina is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to purchase/rent a coca cola sales agency. This will help increase her income/earnings for the developments she aspires to make.
Her customers have continued to grow and her ambition is to build a permanent stall.

loans.use: To purchase/rent a coca cola sales agency.

loans.name: Edwin Oswaldo

texts.es: Edwin de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al transporte de carga desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar y  por los precios accesibles, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su camión para poder continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ganancias.

loans.use: compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth N. is 28 years, a mushiga by tribe and a member of Life in Africa. He hails from western part of Uganda and married with one child and his area of residence is kisaasi – Kampala. He joined Life in Africa early January 2006 by then he was working as a security officer with a private organization.

His joining Life in Africa was a blessing to him because he got to learn many things that he would not if he continued with security work. Much interesting one to him is his involvement in the community activities like bracelet making where he now earns some reasonable amount of money compared to that one of security. With this quick progress, Kenneth has three months ago opened a bar and sells a variety of drinks such as royal vodka, beer, soda and mineral water. Kenneth has saved at least three hundred thousand shillings that they wish to add in quantity of their stock because they have found that this business is profitable.

His wife who is a bar attendant has at least five years experience in this business and handling drunkard people is like her professional job. On top of their 300000/= and what is in the bar, He is seeking a loan amount of 800000/= so that to have reasonable bar. Below is his total budget:

Beer 15 Crates of beer @ 30,000/=... 450000/=
20 Crates of soda @ 9600/=... 192000/=
Mineral water 15 Cantons @ 7000... 105000/=
Safi 15 boxes @ 6500... 97500/=
Vodka 3 boxes @ 5000...15,000/=
Plastic chairs 12...240,000/=
Total...1099500/=

shs. 300,000 of this budget will come from the bar\'s earnings so far; the rest is requested in the form of a kiva loan.

loans.use: restocking a bar

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria E. is a business woman who specializes in the sales of bags of water & drinks. She is happily married with five children. She needs  $800 for her business improvement.

loans.use: To buy more bags of water for sale

loans.name: Celida

texts.en:
Celida E. C. and her husband Victor have eight children and 14 grandchildren. Her small grocery store, named "Colmado Anaceli” after her second daughter, sells food staples, household items and cooking ingredients to her neighborhood of La Pacuala in the northern peninsula of Samana. She would like this loan to continue to restock her store with rice, salt, sugar, filtered water packets, etc. She puts everything that she saves back into the store and she hopes to expand with this loan to increase profits and therefore savings to provide better for her family.

NOTE: Celida is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, which have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their business and family.

loans.use: Purchase bulk inventory of rice, salt, sugar and filtered water.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: S. Mavluda is 46 years old. She is married and has 2 daughters and one son. Her husband is a driver with a private company. She sells children's clothes in a local bazaar in Panjshanbe. She started her business with 50 US dollars and now has 15 years experience in trade. Earlier she sold socks and now her business is improving. She wants to purchase new kinds of children's clothes from Istaravshan. Her son works for a construction company but Mavluda wants her son to go to university. She is teacher by education but her teaching salary is not enough to support her family.  This is the reason she decided to make a business and she will use her next loan to purchase seasonal children's clothes.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal children's clothes

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Rosa. I run a small outdoor food stand in the center of my city. I have a good clientele, and the majority of my customers visit me in the morning. Thanks to this business I have been able to help my husband with family expenses and fulfill my obligations with suppliers.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Hola mi nombre es Rosa, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de Golocinas (Prodoctos para sonsumo Humano), los que distribuyo de manera ambulante en el centro de mi ciudad, cuento con buena clientela. ya que mis clientes me esperan por lo general en la mañana, gracias a este negocio puedo ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos de mi familia y cumplir con otros comprimisos con los proveedores.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, lard, flour, beans, firewoord and eggs.

loans.name: Mahbob

texts.en: Mahbob lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a young and talented boy with a car repair shop. He has a lot of experience in his job, as he started this business when he was 9 years old. He has a big shop with lots of materials. He wants to take an individual loan to buy new machines and complete his stock. He wants to make a better future for his family and also for himself. He is happy now.

loans.use: To buy new machines and complete his stock

loans.name: Eldorjon

texts.en: Eldorjon is the father of three children. He lives in J.Rasulov and his trade place is located in the food market in his region. He buys his flour from Khujand by lots and sells them retail at his place. He has stabile profit and his business is developing every month. Also his wife is his business partner and sells flour with him. Presently flour is expensive in Khujand, Tadjikistan, and he needs extra capital for making the purchase of the next batch. In the future he plans to involve his son in this business and rent one more place for him.

loans.use: Purchase the next batch of flour to sell.

loans.name: Kazing A (Iii) Group

texts.en: Grace is 42 years old. She already has a poultry business, however, with the extra profits she will be able to start a mushroom growing business in addition.

loans.use: To invest in the poultry business.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 26 year-old Eliza M.. She is married with three children, aged 2, 5 and 9. In 2004 Eliza established a retail store. Eliza now requires a new loan in order to purchase inventory  in bulk. 

 
About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  For women with low incomes, there are few economic opportunities and poor access to basic needs and services 

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase inventory in bulk.

loans.name: Rejoice's Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Rejoice E..  she is currently in the business of beer and local breweries and is requesting a loan for capital investment.  Rejoice is 29 years old and she is married with a husband who is a peasant.  she has 3 children ranging from age 2 to 11 and her children go to school.  each week, Rejoice makes approximately 280 sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able  to open a deport. Rejoice is joined in her small group by Margaret A., Mary G., Tamara K. and Grace A..  Margaret A. has a business in bread and vegetable selling and wants to expand her business.  Mary G. is currently operating a business in bread selling and wants a loan to expand her business.  Tamara K. operates a business of selling charcoal and wants to expand the business.  Grace A. is currently in the business of selling beans and sugar and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: capital investment

loans.name: Njem

texts.en:
Njem M., age 47, is a widow, who works as a housewife and has three children. She and her children have lived in the central part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia since 1990. One of her daughters is a hairdresser in a busy market, and she always gives $5 a day to her mother. Most of Mrs. M.'s daily expenses are cover by her daughter.

So the family would like a load to get a booth for her daughter's business and to purchase hairdressing equipment. This will allow the child to save in the future and enlarge her business site, and they will have enough money to support the household.

In the photo, Njem M. is shown with her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase hair dresser equipment.

loans.name: Suryanah

texts.id:
Suryanah is one of Yamida's clients who lives in Bogor, West Java. This 31-year-old woman is married and have 2 children. She has been a tailor for 10 years, but because of her limited capital, Suryanah is having a hard time to expand her business. With her experience and her existing record of earning $8 daily, Suryanah is requesting a loan of $125 from Kiva to buy fabrics and threads.

Translated by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Suryanah adalah salah satu client Yamida yang tinggal di daerah Bogor, Jawa Barat. Wanita berumur 31 Tahun ini telah menikah dan memiliki 2 orang anak. Selama 10 Tahun menjadi Penjahit, akan tetapi dengan modal yang sangat kecil Suryanah kesulitan mengembangkan usahanya, maka dengan pengalaman dan pendapatan 8 dollar perhari suryati mengharapkan pinjaman melalui Kiva sebesar 125 dollar ,Untuk membeli Bahan-bahan kain dan benang.

loans.use: To buy fabrics ($100) and threads ($25)

loans.name: Sifaga

texts.en: Sifaga T., 51, is married with 5 children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and banana plantation business. She sells to the village people and public market 3 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Sifaga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will also help her with her many family obligations. Her husband also helps out with the business.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides, machetes, boots, etc

loans.name: Thi Huong's Group

texts.vi:
• Mrs. N. Thi Huong (ID number: 03040001), 54 years old, wants to borrow 265 USD to invest in her food shop. Her husband and her 2 children are both working, earning about 200 USD/month. Her income from the food shop together with the stable contribution of her husband and two children have made repaying not very problematic for her. Her family wants to borrow money so that they can better their life, and to expand the workshop.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hien (ID number: 03040004), 29 years old, wants to borrow 265 USD to sell rice.
  • Mrs. H. Thi Minh (ID number: 03040006), 30 years old, wants to borrow 265 USD to invest in her fruit shop.
  • Mrs. C. Thi Huong (ID number: 03040005), 37 years old, wants to borrow 75 USD to breed animals.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Mai (ID number: 03040002), 37 years old, wants to borrow 265 USD to breed chickens.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

    Nguyễn Thị Hướng, 54 tuổi(Ms03040001), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng ăn uống.Chồng và hai con cô đều đi làm có thu nhập bình quân khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng.Thu nhập từ cửa hàng ăn uống và lương ổn định của chồng và hai con giúp cô trang trải cuộc sống nên gia đình cô không gặp khó khăn gì khi hoàn trả vốn. Gia đình luôn mong muốn vay vốn tạo thu nhập để cuộc sống sung túc hơn, đồng thời vay vốn để mở rộng cửa hàng để người thân không phải đi làm thuê bên ngoài. Trong nhóm cô còn có: Nguyễn Thị Hiền, 29 tuổi(Ms 03040004), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để kinh doanh gạo. Hà Thị Minh, 30 tuổi(Ms 03040006), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng bán hoa quả. Nguyễn Thị Lợi, 44 tuổi (Ms 03040007), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi vịt. C. Thị Hương, 37 tuổi (Ms03040005), mức vay: 1.060.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Nguyễn Thị Mai, 37 tuổi (Ms 03040002), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà.

loans.use: small business, breed animals

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia K. is 37 years old. She is married with two children who are currently in school. She says selling lingerie especially for women is very profitable and therefore has been selling ladies' jean materials and lingerie for six years to support her husband in taking care of their family's needs. Afia wants to use the loan to buy bales of lingerie and jean materials to increase her inventory and sales for a better income. She believes this loan will help her save some money to start paying part of the children school fees and utility bills. Afia is a member of the group called Confidence. Members of the group agree to guarantee for one another and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bales of lingerie and jeans materials.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel A., popularly called Agyengo, is 32 years old. He is married with one kid who is currently in school. Emmanuel is a dealer in hardware such as assorted paints, nails, roofing sheets, hammers, PVC pipes, etc., in Goaso, the town where he lives with his family.

Emmanuel buys his supplies from importers in Kumasi, the regional capital Ashanti, at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He is requesting this loan to enable him to procure increased stocks of paints, nails, hammers, etc., to accelerate his business progress. With the loan, he hopes to increase his savings so as to expand his shop to include the sale of cement. He would be very grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more assorted paints, nails, sandpaper, hammers, etc.

loans.name: Maritta

texts.en: K. Maritta is an herbalist. She prepares local herbs for treatment of high blood pressure, diabetes, ulcers, syphilis, and many other sicknesses. She has been able to sustain the health of AIDS patients for a long time; her herbs prevent the skin disorders that usually affect such patients and this has won her more clients. She has three workers who help with looking for the herbs in the swamps and bushes around her area.  She sells from her home, and due to the efficiency of her drugs, many have come to her. She is proud to say that her driving force for doing what she does best is her late grandmother's spirit that gives her the wisdom to treat people using local medicine. Before becoming an herbalist, she sold used clothes by moving around to daily markets, a business she left for her daughter to manage. She is married with six children and cares for three grandchildren whose parents died without leaving them a penny. The loans help with the children's upkeep and school fees, plus paying her workers. The profits from the herbs help her to pay back her loans.

loans.use: Kizza Maritta plans to pay for school fees and upkeep for her children plus paying her workers.

loans.name: William Ernesto

texts.es: El Sr. William habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Campo Bruce, su esposa le tiene tres hermosos hijos que tiene 2,5 y 10 años de edad, dos de ellos están estudiando la primaria, el negocio de don William es la venta de CD y ropa tiene cinco años de vender, y trabaja junto con su esposa que siempre lo ha apoyado en las ventas, inicio con dinero prestado lo cual ha podido crecer en inventario. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en la compra de mercadería variada para ofertar a su clientela.  A largo plazo  es tener un modulo de ropa lovable en un mercado que se llama oriental, donde pueda captar mucha clientela ya que es el mercado mas visitado por los Nicaragüense por sus ventas variadas de productos, también desea mejorar su casa, y ver por su familia
texts.en:
Mr. William lives in a neighborhood called Campo Bruce in the capital of Managua. He and his wife have three beautiful children, who are 2, 5, and 10 years old. Two of the children are in primary school. Mr. William has sold CDs and clothes for five years. He works with his wife, who has always supported him in his business. He began the business with borrowed money, which he has put toward expanding the inventory. This loan request will allow William to invest in purchasing a variety of merchandise to offer his clients. In the long-run, he wants to have a unit of nice clothes in a market called Oriental, where he can gain many clients. The market is visited frequently by Nicaraguans because it sells diverse products. He also wants to improve his home and look after his family.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes for men and women and to buy CDs

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es:
La señora Clara pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Paraíso”, ubicado en la Av. San Fernando Nº 771,  distrito de Manantay, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años de edad, es madre de 8 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de frutas. Tiene 10 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de plátano, aguaje, limón y cuenta con 2 motokar como herramienta de trabajo. Estos negocios le brindan ganancias para pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará un saco de aguaje, dos racimos de plátanos, un ciento de limón, dos llantas, una docena de rodaje, 2 carburadores, etc.

Clara está muy contenta por todo lo que ha logrado en esta vida. Agradece a todas las personas que están cerca de ella.
texts.en:
Señora Clara belongs to the El Paraiso Communal Bank on Avenue San Fernando Nº 771, Manantay district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali Department. She is 31, the mother of 8 grown children, and married to a self-employed husband. With the first loan of $100 that she received from the Manuela Ramos organization, she decided to invest in fruit sales. She has been working with the communal bank for 10 years. Currently she sells bananas, aguaje fruit, lemons and has 2 motor carts for her work. These businesses provide earnings to pay back her loan punctually. With this loan of $500, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy a sack of aguaje fruit, two bunches of bananas, one hundred lemons, two wheels, a dozen gears, 2 carburetors, etc. Clara is very happy with everything she has achieved in this life. She is grateful to everyone close to her.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of aguaje fruit, two bunches of bananas, one hundred lemons, two wheels, a dozen gears, 2 carburetors, etc.

loans.name: Mr. Ny Souern Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan for eleven people who live in Damrei Chhlang village in Kandal province. The members will use the loan for different purposes. The group leader, Mr. Ny Souern, is the village bank president. He is 42 years old and the father of five children, who all attend the local school. He is a farmer who has a 2 hectare field, on which he cultivates rice for a living. He has insufficient rice seeds to cultivate rice. Therefore, he requests a loan to buy them. He will alS. use the funds to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to improve his crop yield. His wife, Mrs. Touch Pov, owns a small grocery store where she sells grocery products.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main loan type. Borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Borrowers can repay portions of the principal earlier than the end of the term if they are financially able, which most clients tend to do. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Mammad

texts.en: Mammad M. has been an agricultural producer for his whole life. He is the father of two sons and he is focused on their education. His wife is a very hardworking woman who supports Mammad in his production activities in order to improve their lives. Mammad raise vegetables such as tomatoes and cucumbers all year; on the photo you can see a hot house where he raises vegetables during the cold season. Mammad applied for a loan of 1200 USD to improve the hot house and purchase mineral fertilizer to raise more vegetables for sale. This loan will allow him to go on with his business and support his family.

loans.use: improve hot house and purchase mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta.
Marisol es soltera, tiene 33 años y 1 hija, Marisol tiene un cafetín en el aeropuerto de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de una persona. Además Marisol implementará un restaurante pollería.
Marisol necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de un horno.
Los sueños de Marisol son comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa, mejorar su negocio y tener otra pollería.
texts.en:
Marisol is a member of Banco Comunal Amauta. She's single, 33 years-old, and has one daughter. Marisol owns a small cafe in Ayacucho's airport where she works everyday with the help of one other person. Additionally, she is about to open a rotisserie chicken restaurant. She requests a loan of 2000 soles ($625 dollars) to purchase an oven. Marisol dreams of buying land so she can build her house, improving her businesses, and eventually owning another rotisserie chicken restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an oven

loans.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es: El señor Nelson Enrique  habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa e hijos, la esposa trabaja con él en el mercado Oriental de la capital, ellos con sus propios esfuerzos han logrado mantener su negocio, que es la venta de pollo, chorizo y otra variedad de carne blanca producto que es el consumo diario de los Nicaragüense por su rica carne, nutritiva, y por su precio que es mas accesible que la carne res. Con esta solicitud que esta haciendo es para invertir  más en su  inventario en la venta de pollo para ofertar a sus clientes la variedad, y cumplir con la demanda. Sus planes es captar clientes nuevos, y poner otro puesto de venta de pollo.
texts.en:
Nelson Enrique lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe together with his wife and children. His wife works with him at the Oriental market in the capital. With their own efforts, they have been able to maintain and sustain their business. They sell chickens, sausage and other varieties of white meat which are consume daily by the Nicaraguans because of its richness and nutritional content. Its price makes it more accessible than beef. With this request that they are making, they will invest it in getting more inventory for selling chickens and to offer a variety to their customers so they are able to supply the demand. Their plans are to get new customers and establish another stand for selling chicken.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying chicken, sausage, and other varieties of white meat

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La sra. Lidia se dedica desde muy pequeña a la venta de pescado frito y sopa  de pescado conocido como “wallake”, en las mañanas vende junto a su mamá en el cruce de las villas, populoso sector de la ciudad de La Paz, y por la tarde en la calle Illampu, centro de la ciudad, vive con su hija que está en edad escolar, quien le ayuda en la preparación de la sopa. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar la pieza en el lugar que su mamá le designó en la casa.
texts.en:
Señora Lidia, from the time that she was very small, has been selling fried fish and the Bolivian fish soup known as "Wallake". In the morning she is selling these with her mother at a busy crossroads in a populous area of the city of La Paz, and in the afternoons in Illampu Street in the city center. She lives with her school age daughter who helps her with preparing the soup. The loan will be invested in the purchase of construction materials to finish the bedroom area that her mother fixed up for her in their house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr:
H. Christine est née vers 1953 à Abomey, la cité historique du Bénin dans le Département du Zou. Christine n’est jamais allée à l’école. Christine est veuve et mère de trois enfants: deux filles, toutes mariées et un garçon qui est encore à sa charge. Dès son enfance Christine accompagnait sa mère pour vendre les tissus. A vingt cinq (25) ans  Christine s'est mise à son propre compte jusqu'au jour d’aujourd’hui. Christine a eu déjà trois crédits à ALIDé qu’elle a bien remboursé et grâce auxquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son commerce. Pour développer et diversifier son activité, Christine sollicite encore un nouveau prêt auprès de ALIDé. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
H. Christine was born around 1953 in Abomey, the historic city of Benin in Zou County. She never went to school. She is a widow and the mother of three children: two girls, both married, and a boy who is still in her care. Since her childhood, Christine used to accompany her mother selling cloth. At the age of 25, Christine got started on her own and still is today. She has had three loans with Alidé that she repaid. And thanks to these loans, she was able to raise her business activity. To develop and diversify her business, she's again requesting a new loan from Alidé.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. ALIDÉ offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bolts of HITARGET-brand cloth and fabrics for curtains and mosquito netting

loans.name: Mubina

texts.en:
U. Mubina runs a small grocery store. She sells a wide variety of foodstuffs, including canned foods, soft drinks, juices, sweets, tea, coffee, etc. Mubina has been in this business for about 11 years. She is also married and has three kids. One of Mubina’s goals is to be able to remodel her apartment and improve her living conditions. Mubina has requested a loan of $600 USD to buy additional foodstuffs, in order to increase the range of her goods. The loan will help Mubina increase her income and continue to operate a stable, sustainable business.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, the country has a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Boeun

texts.en:
Boeun M., 25, lives in Pursat province, Cambodia. She has owned a plot of land for years where grows both rice and vegetable crops. She can plant her crops twice a year, in the dry season and the rainy season -- a skill she learned from her grandparents.

She is married to Sophang, 24, who is a domestic marble carver. He normally collects marble from the mountains and sells it out of his house. His business is profitable. The couple has one minor child under their care. Mrs. Boeun M. will use the loan to buy a buffalo to connect with an existing cart in order to transport marble to sell more quickly.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to connect with an existing cart

loans.name: Junrey

texts.en:
Junrey A. is from the village of Dalacon. He is 20 years old and is single. To make a living, Junrey owns & operates a repair business for electrical appliances and equipment. Junrey is just starting this business.

In 2009, Junrey joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Junrey is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Junrey from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support his immediate family members. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
