Miriam de 46 años de edad es soltera, labora para el MINED-Acoyapa desde hace 14 años como docente de primaria. Habita en su casita junto a sus 5 nietos a los cuales cuida mientras los papas trabajan fuera.  

Esta solicitando  su 7mo credito con el objetivo de terminar de cercar su propiedad con malla y poder instalar el servicio de agua potable en su casa, pues actualmente no cuenta con el. 

Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y que sus nietos estudien y sean personas de bien que saquen adelante a nuestro pais.
texts.en:
Miriam, 46, is single and has worked as an Elementary School Teacher for the Ministry of Education-Acoyapa for 14 years.  She lives in her little house with her five grandchildren who she cares for while their parents work elsewhere.

She is requesting her 7th loan to finish fencing in her property with wire mesh and to be able to install potable water service to her house; she currently does not have it.

Her greatest wish is to provide her family with better living conditions and that her grandchildren go to school and become upstanding citizens who will help our country get ahead.

loans.use: To fence in the property and install electricty and running water.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 31 years old and married. He owns a printing service located in Kimironko, a suburb of Kigali. His business is open from 7am until 4pm every day and he has one years' experience.
Gilbert has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more paper, ink for printers, files, etc. and more internet broadband access. His dream is to buy more computers for his growing business.

loans.use: To purchase more paper, ink and internet access

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Née le 23 Décembre 1979 à Bamako (capitale du Mali), Mariam B. est mariée et mère 5 enfants. Elle réside dans une famille nucléaire avec son époux à Wayerma I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Mariam B. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et vente  des pagnes Wax,  de chaussures, de  Tissus brodés, de concentrée de tomate il y a environ cinq ans. Elle mène son activité à son domicile et de façon ambulante dans la ville de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant cinq ans avec laquelle elle a bénéficié  5 prêts solidaires dans un association des femmes de son quartier (Association DANAYA de Wayerma I). Tous ses prêts solidaires ont été tous correctement remboursés ce qui lui a valu un premier prêt individuel  qui fut également bien remboursé. 
Ainsi, elle sollicite ce deuxième  prêt individuel  pour acheter à Lomé (république du Togo) 25 paires de chaussures différentes, 10 pièces de pagnes Wax, 4 complets de tissus brodés et 10 complets de napperon. Ses marchandises sont vendues en détail de façon ambulante au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 130 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mariam B. was born on December 23 1979 in Bamako (capital of Mali). She is married and the mother of five children. She lives in a nuclear family with her spouse, in Wayerma I, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.)

After having unsuccessfully pursued various activities, five years ago Mrs. Mariam B. learned the business of purchasing and selling Wax pagnes [colorful traditional wrap around fabric], shoes, embroidered fabric and tomato concentrate. She is conducting her business form her home and door-to-door in the town of Sikasso. Her customers hold her in very high demand because of the quality of her products. Five years ago she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwasso in order to meet her ever-increasing customers’ demand. She has already received five group loans with a woman’s association from her neighborhood (Wayerma I Danaya Association). All her group loans have been fully reimbursed which got her a first individual loan that was also fully reimbursed.

She is requesting a second individual loan to buy 25 pairs of shoes, 10 pieces of Wax pagnes, 4 suits of embroidered fabric and 10 sets of doilies. Her merchandise will be sold retail door to door for cash and on credit to customers who are mostly women.

With this loan she is planning on making a monthly profit of 130,000 Francs CFA. It will be mostly used to increase her working capital, cover the family’s expenses and pay her loan.

loans.use: To purchase Wax pagnes, shoes, embroidered fabric and doilies.

loans.name: Clara Jaqueline

texts.es:
Clara Jaqueline P. A. tiene 35 años, Es casada vive con  el esposo y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito, perteneciente a la parroquia puerto pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul , esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Clara Jaqueline se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial García y Comercial López y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta realizar quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Clara Jaqueline P. A. is 35 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has 4 children.

The members of the JERUSALEN community bank are located in Caimito precinct, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Clara Jaqueline is a farmer who grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  She buys her products in the García and López shopping areas and sells her products in the Vaca shopping area.  She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her corn, rice and pigeon pea crops.

The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

Clara Jaqueline enjoys doing her household chores.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael  N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is not married and has no children.   Rachael has a business of selling fruits and vegetables, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Rachael has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more fruits and vegetables.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rachael hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Rachael hopes to own animals.        Rachael is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to play netball.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: La Cumbre Group

texts.es: Doña Maria C. P.. D. 32 Años, es la presidenta, tiene 5 Hijos, 2 D. sus Hijos van a la escuela, ella se dedica especialmente al comercio compra y venta D. consumo diario en la plaza D. Pologua Momostenango, el grupo son Tres integrantes  una  D. ellas se dedica a la venta D. refacion: arroz en leche y Chocolate. Necesitan ampliar sus producción D. animales y también la venta D. consumo diario, por lo que se acercaron a las oficinas D. la asociación ASDIR D. pologuá, para poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y D. sus familias. Este grupo D. señoras, son personas que se conocen muy bien, desD. hace 10 años han trabajado siempre juntas, en el cual lo integran D. la siguiente manera.
texts.en: The group has three members, including Doña María C. P., who is 32, is the president. She has 5 children, 2 of whom are in school. Her business is buying and selling food in the Pologua Momostenango plaza. Another member sells snacks: rice pudding and chocolate. They need to increase their animals' production as well as their food sales, so they came to the ASDIR Association offices in Pologuá for financing for their businesses, so they can improve the quality of life for themselves and their families. This group of ladies know each other well, having worked together for the last 10 years, and will continue to do so.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children. He has been working as a driver in a local furniture company since 2000. He works hard to be able to provide a good education for his children.  He has obtained three Kiva loans and was an excellent client with punctual payments.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay for his son's courses at the university. In that way, his son will have the opportunity to work in a proper company earning a good income, allowing him to help his father with family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for his son's courses at the university.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo, es agricultor en pequeño, vive con su esposa y sus hijos viven en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, tiene 41 años de edad, él tiene 4 años de estar cultivando ya que este oficio lo aprendió cuando ya era adulto y trabajaba como ayudante. Ricardo quiere comprar ganado y comprar materiales para sembrar maíz y ajonjolí.
Con esta inversión considera tener todo lo necesario para cultivar y mejorar las actividades agrícolas, dando su mejor atención y cuido durante el proceso, para Ricardo su principal objetivo es trabajar diariamente para proveer a su hogar todo lo necesario y no pasen dificultades.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a small farmer. He lives with his wife and their children in Jiquilisco, in the department of Usulután. He is 41 years old. He has been farming for four years, since he learned this skill when he was already an adult and was working as an assistant. Ricardo wants to buy livestock and materials for planting corn and sesame.

With this loan, he thinks he will have everything he needs for planting and for improving his agricultural activities and will give his best attention and care during the process. His principal objective is to work daily to provide his household with all the necessities and to not experience any difficulties.

loans.use: Buy livestock and materials to plant corn and sesame.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy back-to-school products.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Prior to owning her salon, Maria cleaned houses and provided health care services. These were just the means to saving up enough money to open her own business. After getting a job in a salon, she decided it was time to get her own beauty license and open a salon that catered to the Brazilian community. She has built incredibly strong ties within the community and is known for superb customer service. 

With this loan from ACCION USA, Maria will be purchasing new equipment for her salon. This will help upgrade her current equipment but, more importantly, it will put her one step closer to future expansion of her salon. Her dream is to expand her spa services and build on the already glowing reputation of her salon. 

In the end, Maria wants to provide herself with the opportunity to grow and have a strong foundation to rely on when she finally decides to retire.

loans.use: to upgrade salon equipment.

loans.name: Ildephonse

texts.en: Ildephonse, age 30 and married, owns and operates a motorcycle transport business that is open daily from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. His business is well-organized. Ildephonse has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy a new motorcycle. With this profit, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Querubín De Jesús

texts.es:
Querubín S. trabaja desde hace 8 años como productor y comercializador de escobas y traperos. Comenzó con este oficio desde hace ya vario tiempo gracias a las enseñanzas de su hijo mayor quien estuvo en un centro de rehabilitación y dentro de su proceso de reinserción a la sociedad, aprendió técnicas para la elaboración de este implemento de limpieza.
 
Para poder fabricar las escobas, Querubín debe comprar más insumos teniendo en cuenta que si hace compras al por mayor puede reducir costos, es por esto que necesita un capital adicional que le permita obtener más materias primas. Este hombre, que sacó a sus hijos adelante él solo después de haber quedado viudo, sueña cada día con hacer crecer su microempresa para poder ayudar a otros.
texts.en:
Querubín has been working for 8 years as a producer and marketer of brooms. He started in this trade some time ago thanks to instruction from his oldest son who was in a rehabilitation center and, as part of his training for reintegration into society, learned techniques for making this cleaning tool.
In order to make the brooms, Querubín must buy more materials, keeping in mind that if he buys in bulk he can reduce his costs. This is why he needs some additional capital that will enable him to buy more raw materials. This man, who raised his children alone after he became a widower, dreams every day of growing his micro-enterprise in order to be able to help others.

loans.use: to purchase material to make brooms and mops

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Sixty-two-year-old Ibrahim J., who is a married father of three children, established his bread, tea and provisions business In 2007 in order to earn income to support his family. His business is open 7 days a week for 12 hours each day.

Ibrahim is requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more provisions and hopes that it will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 900,000. In the future, he plans to build a modern bakery. Ibrahim thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions such as milk, sugar, and margarine for his business.

loans.name: Miranda

texts.en:
Miranda is a 42-year-old woman married to a utility worker named Mariano and together they raise their three children. Miranda has had a food selling business for three years. She sells fruits and vegetables to the people in her community. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 monthly.

Miranda is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fish and meat to sell and hogs to raise. In the future, Miranda hopes to earn more profit and lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy fish and meat to sell and hogs to raise.

loans.name: Mkwenye

texts.en:
Mkwenye is a 33-year-old married man and father of four children. He has been  practising crop farming in Narok. Mkwenye is requesting a loan for the third time from KADET in order to buy fertilizer and prepare the land, both necessary means to support his main source of earning a living.

Mkwenye hopes to improve his business by expanding his crop production's variety, quality and quantity. He is a hardworking man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and prepare the land

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 21  años, es soltero vive con los padres no tiene hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla tiene 10 socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz y frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. Su sueño es tener terrenos propios para trabajar y con las ganancias comprar una casa.

Se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable y le gusta jugar boly e indor, ademas una de las costumbres del recinto es realizar las fiestas patronales en Octubre.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 21 years old, single, and lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He does not have any children.

This community bank is called "26 de Noviembre" and it is located in Las Blancas, in Ventanas canton.  The group has 10 members who work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Juan is a farmer.  In particular, he grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas every month and makes his sales in the street market in the town.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs and increase production.  He faces challenges in his business such as pests which attack his crops.  His dream is to own his own land which he can work and then use the profits to buy a house.

Juan is noted as being a responsible person and he enjoys playing volleyball and indoor soccer.  In addition, one of the customs in his town is to celebrate the local fiesta in October.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed, 46, is married and has six children. He lives in the Biet Lahia area of the Gaza Strip. 

Mohammed took out a $3,000 loan in order to buy new home furniture. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee who receives a decent salary, but it isn't enough to allow him to buy furniture with cash. FATEN's loan, which is repaid on monthly basis, will allow him to purchase new home furniture to live in better conditions, as what he has is 30 years old. 

Mohammed is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: to buy new home furniture.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 34 años de edad, ella es casada, y tiene 02 hijos. Ella vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el caserío Nueva Esperanza Hualtaco III del distrito de Tambogrande. Bertha vive en una zona rural  de este distrito. Y no cuenta aún con servicio básicos.

Bertha dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo para ello cuenta con experiencia en el negocio, ella realiza sus ventas de forma diaria ya que  sale a ofrecer sus productos y  deja a pedido y le van pagando de forma diaria o semanal según sea el caso. Adicionalmente se dedica a la comercialización de animales menores los cuales al alcanzar su tamaño y peso ideal los vende en el mercado local   Con estas actividades ella  ayuda aportando para algunos gastos  familiares.

Actualmente Berta desea ampliar su negocio por ello esta solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para que compre más productos de belleza, y que de esta manera  ella pueda contar con productos en almacén para que pueda satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes en menor tiempo y también comprando alimento balanceado para sus animales.  

Bertha es mujer bastante trabajadora y empeñosa, las personas que le conocen admiran sus ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
texts.en:
Bertha, 34, is married and has two children.  She lives in her own house located in Nueva Esperanza Hualtaco III in Tambogrande District. Bertha lives in a rural part of this district and still does not have basic utilities.

Bertha sells catalogue beauty products and has experience in the business.  She sells daily going out to offer her items and placing orders.  She gets repaid daily or weekly according to each case.  In addition, she also sells small farm animals that she sells at the local market when they reach ideal size and weight.  She is able to cover some of the family’s basic needs through these activities.

Currently, Bertha would like to expand her business so is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy more beauty products so that she can have products in stock to meet customer need in a shorter amount of time; she also wants to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals.

Bertha is quite a hard working, enterprising woman.  People who know her admire her drive to get ahead and to make progress.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of beauty products.

loans.name: Sergio David

texts.es: Sergio, un joven de 24 años tiene su negocio llamado “Peleteria Planet Suelas”, donde comercializa materiales e insumos que utilizan los zapateros, y microempresarios dedicados a este oficio, quienes son su principal mercado. Así el vende capelladas, suelas, plantillas evillas y accesorios varios que adornan el calzado que otros fabrican. Su negocio lo aprendió por tradición familiar, pues su familia hace lo mismo, desde cuando vivieron en su natal Bucaramanga,  lugar llamado también, “la ciudad de los parques” y ubicada en el departamento de Santander del Sur. Aunque construyó esta  experiencia desde sus 15 años de edad, pues siempre trabajado en el negocio familiar, hace un año se independizó para generar ingresos independientes; pues en su mayoría de edad y con un hijo de 1 año debió ir pensando en el desarrollo de su familia en compañía de su cónyuge. Su mayor desafío es el capital de trabajo insuficiente, que no lo hacen muy competitivo, pues pierde clientes. Este es la razón por la cual accede a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará accesorios para calzado y materiales e insumos como capelladas, suelas, plantillas  y evillas en mayor volumen, para obtener descuentos y sobre todo para tener un surtido que le permita una mayor visión de su negocio por parte de nuevos clientes. Mientras esto ocurre maneja una rotación de inventarios de 55 días,  y una rentabilidad no menor de 20% y también aspira a dejarle un legado tradicional a su familia, fortaleciendo su negocio y logrando su sostenibilidad en el tiempo.
texts.en: Sergio is a 24 year-old youth who has a business named “Peleteria Planet Suelas” where he sells materials and supplies used by shoemakers and small businessmen in this trade, who are his main market.  He sells uppers, soles, insoles, buckles and a variety of accessories that are used by shoemakers to adorn their shoes. He learned this business through family tradition, as his family has been in the same line of work ever since they lived in his hometown of Bucaramanga, a place also called "the city of parks," which is located in the department of Santander del Sur.  Although he has been building up experience since he was 15 years old, he had always worked in the family business.  A year ago, he became independent so that he could generate his own income, because as he is an adult with a 1 year-old child, he had to start thinking about the development of his family with his wife.  His main challenge is that he doesn't have enough capital, and this makes him less competitive since he loses customers.  This is the reason that he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that he has gotten through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the loan, he will buy accessories for shoes and materials and supplies such as uppers, soles, insoles and buckles in large quantities so that he can get a bulk discount.  But above all, he will be able to have a greater assortment of items that will allow his new customers to have a better view of his business.   Meanwhile, he maintains a 55 day inventory turn-over, and profitability of no less than 20 percent.  Also, he hopes to leave a traditional legacy to his family by strengthening his business and achieving sustainability over time.

loans.use: to buy accessories for shoes and shoe making materials and supplies such as uppers, soles, insoles, and buckles in bulk

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
27-year-old Maria Luz lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Maria Luz has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Maria Luz has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Maria Luz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy other kinds of drinks so that she can increase her earnings

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a mother of two adult-aged children and is separated from her husband. She is 58 years old and lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Nelly sells several snack items in their place to earn a living. She sells sweet puto, rice cakes, doughnuts and many more. She has received recognitions from her customers for having made the food deliciously. She has had this business for five years and gets PHP 5,000 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional food items to sell. 

Nelly joined GDMPC earlier this year to have access to financial services. In the future, Nelly hopes to expand and improve her product offerings to elevate sales and the daily cash inflow of the household.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items to sell.

loans.name: Sadek

texts.en: Sadek is a 21-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and three siblings. He has owned a car repair shop in his town since 2008 and has seven years of experience working in the field; he began to learn this occupation when he was very young. And today, with his requested loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l he will be able to purchase a scanner machine and new mechanic's tools. In the future, he is planning to enlarge his store and start a car spare parts sales business.

loans.use: to purchase a scanner and new mechanic's tools.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 58 years old and widowed. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Leonora runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 19,500 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.
Leonora has borrowed and paid back 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and corn.
Leonora aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mary Njamiu

texts.en:
Mary is a 38 year old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 14 years and 18. She describes herself as loving. 

She operates a flower sales business in a busy shopping center in Mombasa.  Mary has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Mary says her biggest business challenge is a lack of finances.  She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to add to her stock of flowers.  Her business goal is to grow it into a wholesale operation within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she can afford to educate her children and build a home for her family.

loans.use: to add stock of flowers

loans.name: Siyambula Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Siyambula Group in Western Kenya!  Florence is the facilitator of the Siyambula group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Florence  takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Florence had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Florence was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Florence and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Florence will pay for major annual expenses such as school fees for her children.

In 2012, the members of Siyambula group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the picture, the field officer is standing on the far left holding a child.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more provisions and crate drinks.

loans.name: Khakosi B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Khakosi B Group in Western Kenya! Alice is the facilitator of the Khakosi B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alice takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 11 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest four bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Alice will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Khakosi B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian is married with one child. He is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines.

To earn a living, Ian runs a business, providing transport services to the local community.  He has been doing this for three years, and makes PHP 9,248 monthly from his business. He has asked for a loan of PHP 10,000 in order to repair a vehicle he owns so that it can give a better service. 

Ian has been a member of GDMPC for two years. Ian hopes that he will be able to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle so it provides a better service.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a middle aged lady who lives in Gweru town with her family. She is in the business of buying and selling cellphone accessories, such as chargers, batteries, memory cards and handsets. 

Christine started doing business five years ago. She is requesting a loan of $800.00 so that she can buy more stock to maximize on profits. With the income from this loan, she will manage to purchase furniture and fittings for her shop. She will also buy food and clothing for her family. Christine is planning to diversify into selling electrical goods in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy cellphone accessories.

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es: Maria Lucrecia tiene 65 años de edad, su actividad económica a la que se dedica es a la venta de mercadería en general. Maria Lucrecia ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000, y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y mantiene un record crediticio muy bueno. Actualmente  está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de mercadería como variedad de ropa y estilos, cosméticos, plata y oro entre otros productos que sus clientes le solicitan.
texts.en:
Maria Lucrecia, 65, earns a living selling goods in general.  She already received a loan through Fundación León 2000 and demonstrated that she is a responsible person with a very good credit record.  

Now she is requesting a loan to invest in her business buying merchandise such as different styles of clothing, cosmetics, silver and gold, among other items that her customers request.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as different styles of clothing, cosmetics, silver and gold.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a married woman who has two children. Anabelle is 40 years old, residing at Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Anabelle sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community to earn a living and she has been six years in this business. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this business. 

She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. 

In 2008, Anabelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en:
Stephanie is 45 years old. She is married with 9 children aged between 15 and 35 years, 6 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 8 years.  Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio Mario  pertenece al banco comunal SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA.
El socio tiene 54 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltero, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  a  ejercer su carrera profesional de derecho, él socio es abogado, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a ejercer su carrera  como docente el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para  de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar un vivieres para su hogar como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mario belongs to the communal banking group "Sayhua de Chichubamba." He is 54 years old and has two children. He is single.  He works as a legal professional, as he is a lawyer, and he has been working by teaching school. He has been in this field for many years.  Things are going well thanks to the efforts he puts into his work.  He wants to continue working and in this way continue to support his family.  

Mario is asking for a loan in order to purchase food items for his family such as rice, sugar, milk and other items.  He is thankful for this assistance and promises to comply with the repayment of his loan.

loans.use: to purchase food items for his family such as rice, sugar, milk and other items.

loans.name: Krasimir

texts.en: Krasimir C. is 50 years old. He lives in Sliven. Long years he has worked in mining industry and construction but a serious disease made him stop these activities.  Being without a job Krasimir started thinking of finding a own business. A friend of his offered him to work together so two years ago Krasimir started his home delivery business. He bought a bus and started to do two tours a week Each tour goes through  5 cities. Now Krasimir need to take another smaller bus to make deliveries in the city he lives in. He can find such a bus for $ 2 000.

loans.use: To take a smaller bus

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is a second-hand clothing seller and a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She is involved with the TEACH Lending program. She also has record-keeping skills. Afia needs a loan of US$700 to buy more new and second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes

loans.name: Kenedy Wanami

texts.en: Kennedy started his business in 2004.   He is a retailer and his shop is located at the local community center. Although he is a qualified driver, he has chosen to go into business. This has enabled him to support his family’s basic needs.  His wife is a housewife and sometimes she assists him in running the shop. Kennedy is also a photographer. With a loan from PEMCI, Kennedy plans to increase the stock of his shop and improve the profits he gets. Through his business, he has been able to bring services near to the community.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe is married and she has 2 little girls. Alejandra is 9 years old and Daniela is 6 years old. Guadalupe loves to sell. She is resourceful and a hard-worker. She decided to start her own business after she quit working for a company. Her income was crucial to the family, so about 6 years ago, she started selling clothes to her friends and family. She has been able to help her husband pay the bills and to pay for her girls' schooling. Her business has grown little by litte as well as her clientele. She sells seasonal clothes so that she can offer a new variety of inventory to her existing clients and attract new ones.

Guadalupe is requesting a loan in the amount of $650 USD to purchase more seasonal clothes. She commits to repay the loan within 5 months. Guadalupe and her family thank you for your support. They hope that their businees continues to grow so that her and her family can move ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Guadalupe es una mujer casada y tiene dos pequeñas hijas, Alejandra y Daniela de 9 y 6 años de edad respectivamente, a Guadalupe le gustan mucho las ventas y es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella decidió poner su negocio por que se retiro de la empresa en la que trabajaba, entonces ese ingreso adicional que aportaba a la economía familiar era necesario; por ello hace 6 años atrás, empezó vendiendo ropa entre sus amistades, y con esto ha podido ayudar con los gastos del hogar, y poder brindarles educación a sus pequeñas hijas. Poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo y con ello su cartera de clientes también, que son las personas que le solicitan sobre el tipo de ropa que ella vende y a ella le gusta tener ropa de temporada para así mantener y atraer a nuevos clientes.

Guadalupe está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 650 para poder adquirir ropa de temporada y tener un mejor surtido que ofrecer a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen tu apoyo y espera continuar creciendo con su negocio y poder sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en: Ilgar is a 40 year old local resident of Saatli. He is married and has two children. He has been engaged in cattle breeding for more than 15 years and is now quite experienced in this business. He has a shed in his yard where he keeps cattle. He buys cattle, raises them, and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. As cattle breeding is traditional in the region, this business can be developed and it can bring good income. Ilgar wants to develop this business by increasing the number of cows. He wants to buy two more calves to add to his livestock. (His son is shown in the picture.)

loans.use: To Buy Two more Calves

loans.name: Gusti Ayu Nyoman Rat

texts.id:
She lives with her husband and 3 children who are still schooling. To help ease her family burden Gusti Ayu Nyoman Ratniti started pig farming. However before this she didn't had the right knowledge to farm pigs, and didn't acquire maximum yield. She used to feed her pigs leftovers. However after receiving financial assistance from Dinari, she now rears 4 pigs and separate them into two sty to ease the job of cleaning. She also buys better pig feedings so that her pigs grows fat and healthy. Now with these improvements, she can now fetch higher prices for her pigs.

Translated from Bahasa by Bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Hidup dengan suami dan tiga orang anak yang masih duduk di bangku sekolah, tentunya membutuhkan banyak biaya. Begitu juga hal yang dialami oleh Gusti Ayu Nyoman Ratniti. Sudah menjadi tradisi wanita di desa, salah satu usaha yang dilakukan untuk menambah perekonomian keluarga adalah beternak babi. Namun yang menjadi kendala adala kurangnya pengetahuan akan beternak babi yang baik dan benar sehingga usaha yang ditekuni tidak menghasilkan dengan maksimal. Sebelumnya, Gusti Nyoman Ratniti hanya memelihara satu babi penggemukkan dan hanya diberi pakan tradisional yang berupa dedaunan dan sisa makanan di dapur. Hal seperti itu menyebabkan pertumbuhan babi tidak optimal dan tentunya berpengaruh terhadap harga jual. Setelah mendapat pembinaan dan pinjaman modal, sekarang Gusti Ayu Nyoman Ratniti memelihara 4 ekor babi yang dipisah dalam dua kandang. Hal itu dilakukannya untuk memudahkan perawatan dan pembersihan kandang. Pinjaman itu digunakan juga untuk membeli pakan yang berkwalitas sehingga sekarang pertumbuhan babinya pesat dan sehat. Dengan adanya perubahan cara beternak, hal ini berpengaruh terhadap pendapatan keluarganya, karena sekarang ia dapat menjual babinya dengan harga yang lebih

loans.use: Membeli bibit dan pakan - Buying piglets and pig feedings

loans.name: Subgroup B Of Tuwezeshane

texts.en:
Halima, age 42, is married with 4 children (ages 24, 20, 16, and 14). She has had a small café for 10 years and has been selling powered soap and fabrics for 2 years. She starts selling food at her cafe, which is located on someone else’s veranda, from 6am to 2pm daily. She pays the owner a small amount for the use of the veranda, depending on her profit. She charges around 70 cents per plate, making a total of about $5 to $5.50 in profit per day. After 2pm each day, she sells powered soap and fabrics door-to-door, making a profit of around $36 per week. Her children are helping her in these businesses. Her husband has a small business of selling fish and mangoes.

Halima is the leader of Subgroup B of Group Tuwezeshane (Swahili for “Let's help each other”), which totals 24 members. She will be sharing this loan with subgroup members: Lydia V. (sells food), Habiba Z. (sells charcoal), Halima S. (sells food), Regan M. (sells radios), and Clementina N. (sells clothes). Halima and her subgroup have taken 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to enhance their businesses and were able to pay them back successfully.

Halima used the previous loans on her business, which has allowed her to purchase land and start building a 3-roomed house. With the new loan, she hopes to increase her businesses’ stock and to finish the construction of their new home.

In the picture, Halima is in the back row, second from the right.

loans.use: To expand businesses

loans.name: Jorahon

texts.ru:
Jorahon T. is 67 years old, has finished high school, is married and has 5 children. Jorahon has been selling fruits and vegetables at the local market "Hiloli" for the last 5 years. He is planning to use the loan to purchase a large batch of produce, since during winter months the mountain pass is sometimes closed due to snow and Jorahon cannot always replenish his merchandise. With this loan the people living in the region will be able to purchase the produce they need even in the case the mountain passes leading to the region are closed. Mr. T. is planning to pay back the loan within the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Точиев Чорахон, возраст – 67 год, образование среднее, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Чорахон занимается продажей продуктов сельского хозяйства на базаре «Хилоли». Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 5 лет. На полученный кредит он планирует увеличить свой товарный запас селскохозяйственной продукции, так как в зимнее время не всегда функционирует перевал в связи с выпадом снегопада, и он не всегда сможет ездить за пополнением запасов. Жители данного района будут иметь возможность приобрести необходимый им товар, даже в случае закрытия перевала. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 15 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience E. is 55 years old and married with 9 children. She and her family live in Benin City, where she sells wood and Ogogoro (local gin) to her community. She has been a LAPO client for 3years. She is requesting a loan of $425 to enable her to buy more wood and Ogogoro. This is a business she started in 2000 and she thanks Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: To buy more woods and Ogogoro (local gin) for sale

loans.name: Hai Tarawa Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Linda D.. She is currently in the business of beer and local drinks and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Linda is 38 years old and is married with a husband who is a farmer. She has 4 children ranging from age 16 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Linda makes approximately 200 Sudanese pounds in profits. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

Linda is joined in her small group by Raida G., Rose R., Joice D. and Jenty B.. Raida G. has a business selling beer and wants to expand the business. Rose R. is currently operating a business selling vegetables and wants a loan to expand the business. Joice D. operates a business selling breads and wants to expand the business. Jenty B. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Expand their businesses.

loans.name: Khairiya's Wastara Group

texts.en:
Khairiya is 47 years old and is a married woman with 1 child aged 12 years old. Khairiya runs a small business that she started in 2003. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Fatma and Amina, who have businesses dealing in small business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica E. is 33 years old and married. She has 2 children. She has been borrowing from LAPO Micro Finance for 4 years. She owns a provisions store, which she started 10 years ago. Monica needs a loan of $450 to buy more provisions for her store to enable her to meet the demands of her customers. She says thanks to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Sinaleimoa

texts.en: Sinaleimoa T., 40, is married with 4 children.  She has 1 year of experience in the taro plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 4 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (approximately 250 USD).  SPBD loans are Sinaleimoa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use all of the loan to start her business. Her husband is involved in farming.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and equipment needed for the plantation.

loans.name: Sokhanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhanthy E., 25, and her husband were married in 2007 and live with her mother, who grows rice in the village. The family lives along National Road Number Five, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Mrs. Sokhanthy has been working in a garment factory since 2000, and her husband is also a garment factory worker.. The family lives in a Khmer wooden house, but its staircase is old and broken. Now Sokhanthy is requesting a loan of $600 to build a new staircase.

loans.use: To build a staircase for her house.

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Justa rents a house and lives with her two daughters on Marcelo Quiroga Santa Cruz street in the neighborhood of Pasankeri in La Paz. She is 71 years old and receives retirement, which is small and isn't sufficient to live on. The loan that she is requesting is to increase her capital since she installed a small store in the place where she lives. This initiative allows her to augment her income, therefore, she can improve her quality of life as well as that of her family.

She doesn't have previous loan with Impro but her determination in her work qualifies her to obtain one.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Justa renta una casa y vive con sus dos hijas en la calle Marcelo Quiroga Santa Cruz D. la zona D. Pasankeri D. la ciudad D. La Paz, tiene 71 años D. edad, percibe una renta D. jubilación la cual es mínima y no le alcanza para subsistir. El crédito que solicita es para aumento D. capital ya que en el lugar donD. vive instaló una pequeña tienda, dicha iniciativa le permite aumentar sus ingresos, por lo tanto, podrá mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia. No tiene créditos con Impro pero su empeño en el trabajo la califica para obtener uno.

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Oysha

texts.ru:
Хусаинова Ойша родилась 1956 году. Она занимается торговлей подарочных товаров 8 лет. На данный момент она арендует магазин на рынке «Шохмансур» города Душанбе. В ее ассортименте большое количество подарочных наборов, подарочные ножи, картины, часы, музыкальные инструменты, настенные часы. А также хозяйственные товары, кастрюли, какзаны и т.д. Большую часть своей выручки Ойша пускает в оборот увеличивая ассортимент товаров. В ассортимент продаваемых ею товаров добавились женские халаты. Большую часть своих товаров она закупает у поставщиков из Китая и на оптовом рынке «Корвон». Ножи ей приносят постоянные поставщики из Истаравшана.
С целью расширения ассортимента и оборота своего бизнеса она хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони.
texts.en:
Oysha H. was born in 1956. She has been selling gifts for eight years. Presently, she rents a shop in the Shokhmansur market in Dushanbe. In her inventory, she has a considerable assortment of gift sets, gift knifes, pictures, watches, musical instruments, and clocks. She also carries household goods, pans, cauldrons, etc. Most of the profit Oysha puts back into her business to increase her product assortment. She has recently added women’s dressing gowns to her product line. She buys most of her goods from Chinese suppliers and in the wholesale market Korvon. She buys her knives from her regular suppliers from Istaravshana. To further expand her inventory and to put money into her business, she wants to take out a loan for 4,100 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing souvenirs

loans.name: Essofalafia Group

texts.fr:
Créée en 2007, l’association ESSOFALAFIA est un regroupement de femmes qui mettent en commun leurs moyens financiers pour la réussite de leur foyer. Elles sont mariées et mères de familles. Elles exercent les activités commerciales différentes telles que la vente des céréales (maïs, haricot), des nattes et de savons. Comme leur activité essentielle se repose sur les céréales, elles ont un magasin commun dans lequel elles stockent leurs marchandises.
Elles sont très dynamiques et aident leurs maris dans les dépenses de la famille.
Le premier crédit que les membres de cette association sollicitent leur permettra d’acheter 11 sacs de maïs, 6 sacs d’haricot, 35 nattes et 8 cartons de savons. Avec ce nouveau stock, elles pourront bien vendre et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Created in 2007, the ESSOFALAFIA association is a group of women who share their financial means for the benefit of their households. They are married and have children. They have different businesses such as selling cereals (corn, beans), mats and soaps. Since their main business is related to cereals, they have a common shop where they stock their goods. They are very energetic and help their husbands with the family expenses. The first loan that the members of this association are seeking will enable them to buy 11 sacks of corn, 6 sacks of bean, 35 mats and 8 boxes of soap. With this new stock, they will be able to make more sales and to provide for the family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell corn, beans, mats and soaps

loans.name: Roeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Roeurn R., 29, lives in the Chek village in the Kandal province. She is the mother of five childR., a preschooler and four who are enrolled in the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Nhor Dos, are farmers who have a 1.3-hectar field to cultivate rice to earn their living. They face a problem because their field is infertile, which has a bad effect on their crops. To deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to help make their crops more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to help make their crops more productive.

loans.name: Luz Paquita

texts.es:
La señora Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mi Génesis”, ubicado en el Jr. 9 de Diciembre Mz. 19 Lt. 21, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 50 años de edad y es madre soltera con 6 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de salchipapa. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad trabaja en una vivienda brindando sus servicios y en su hogar cuenta con un motokar como herramienta de trabajo.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 2 pares de amortiguadores, 2 llantas, tapizará los asientos, arreglará el motor, etc. 

Luz manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es una ayuda para ella. Agradece a Dios por brindarle vida y salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz S. belongs to the communal bank "Mi Génesis", located in the Coronel Portillo Province at Jr. 9th of December Mz. 19 Lt. 21, Callería District, in the Ucayali Region of Peru. She is a 50-year-old single mother of six grown children. With the first 300 soles loan she received from Manuela Ramos she invested in selling salchipapa (a fried dish of mixed sliced hotdogs and potatoes). She has worked for two years with the communal bank. She currently works out of her home and uses a motokar (3-wheeled motorized rickshaw) as part of the business. With this 1,500 soles loan, to be paid back in 4 months, she will invest in purchasing two pairs of shock absorbers and two tires, cover the seats, fix the engine, etc. Luz has stated that Manuela Ramos has been a help to her and gives thanks to the Lord for blessing her with life and health to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy parts and make repairs to the motokar (buy two pairs of shock absorbers and two tires, cover the seats, fix the engine)

loans.name: Ni Kadek Juli Asih

texts.id: Dirumah yang sangat kecil dan sederhana yang hanya terbuat dari batako,Ibu Kadek Juli asih tinggal dengan suami dan satu orang anak perempuan yang masih kecil berumur 2 Tahun.Setiap harinya Ibu Kadek hanya mengurusi keluarganya.padahal kadang ibu kadek ingin membantu suami bekerja sebagai buruh tani harian.tetapi anak ibu kadek tidak ada yang menjaga.kebutuhan yang dirasakan tidak mencukupi,karena suami ketut sudiana hanya bekerja sendiri.Hasil kebun yang dimiliki tidak seberapa.Setelah ada program bantuan dari Dinari Ibu kadek ingin ikut program tersebut.Ibu Kadek akan memelihara 1 babi  penggemukan.Walaupun belum punya kandang,Ibu kadek berusaha akan membuat kandang sederhana.Program ini sangat membantu Ibu Kadek untuk bisa mendapat keuntungan yang akan bisa menutupi kebutuhan rumah tangganya.Sehingga Ibu kadek sangat semangat bila modal itu akan diberikan dalam waktu yang cepat.Semoga bisa dipakai untuk usaha dan bisa berkembang dengan baik.Sehingga Bisa untuk tambahan keluarga.
texts.en:
In a very small and simple hut made from batako, Mrs. Kadek Juli Asih lives with her husband and 2 year old daughter. Every day Mrs. Kadek is only concerned about her family, however sometimes Mrs. Kadek likes to help her tenant farmer husband who is paid daily. Yet nobody is taking care of Mrs Kadek's daughter. Daily needs are not met, since husband Ketut Sudiana works alone. Farm results are meager. After there is an assistance program from Dinari, Mrs kadek like to join that program. Mrs. Kadek will raise 1 fattening pig. Although they have no stall, Mrs kadek tries to make a simple stall. This Program very much help Mrs Kadek to obtain profit that could help cover household expenses. Therefor Mrs kadek is enthusiastic if the capital could be obtained speedily. So that it could be used for business and expand quickly, hence could add family's income.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mother pig & feed (Induk babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Khalida Parveen Munir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Khalida Parveen baji is a 46-year-old married lady. She has resided in a city called Vehari, Pakistan for the past 35 years. She is an uneducated lady. She mentions the reason: she belongs to a very poor family, who could hardly buy food from their income, so how they could they pay her education expenses? She is married to a man whose name is M. A. and he has a scrap business. He collects scrap (plastic bottles, waste papers, and rough wooden furniture) and then sells it.

Khalida Parveen baji is the mother of three kids: one son and two daughters. All of her children are getting an education from a school which is located near their house. She promised herself that she would give her children a good education so that they could get respect from people. And to achieve that promise she does embroidery on dresses on order; she gets the orders from her neighbors. She successfully repaid her first two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy scrap for her husband’s scrap business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Shamim Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Sabran baji wants a loan to buy electric tube lights to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy scrap for her husband's scrap business

loans.name: Mrs. Lun Phoung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people living in Tropaing Mortes village in Kampong Chhnang province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Lun P., the 53-year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a rice middleman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy more rice to earn income. Mrs. Lun P. is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. 

Two members in this loans group are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy more rice to earn income.

loans.name: Nargis Wazir Shah Group

texts.en:
Nargis baji is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been a citizen of Riwind, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband, W. S., has been selling vegetables for the past 6 years. Nargis baji helps to share his financial burden  by sewing clothes. She takes order from her neighbors and charges them $2 per dress. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. 

She is the leader of a group of women in her locality. Googi baji wants a loan to buy razors and scissors for her barber shop. Shahida baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy bangles to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Farzana Kosar

texts.en:
My name is Farzana K. and I am a citizen of a historical place named Yadgar in Lahore, Pakistan. I have been a part of this city for the past 35 years. I am a widow and I have the responsibility of two daughters on my shoulders. My husband left me six years ago, then my brother and I started a shoe-making business.

We started taking orders from the shoe companies and now earn income from it. Now we’ve seven employees working with us in our shoe-making business and we pay them bimonthly. Through this business I was able to marry off my daughter.

I have successfully repaid my five loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and Kiva's partner). Now I am applying for the sixth time to buy material (leather, polish and nails) to expand my shoe-making business and to complete the orders of companies.

loans.use: To buy materials for shoe-making business

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Mariée à un menusier et mère de 04 enfants, madame Z. abla a ouvert depuis 2005 un bar qu’elle a appelé « ROYAL AG », son commerce marche bien surtout les week-ends. C’est cette activité qui lui permet de bien subvenir aux charges de sa famille. Elle souhaite s’approvisionner en casiers de boissons pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, pour cela elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 25 casiers de boissons non alcoolisées et des casiers de bière
texts.en:
Married to a furniture maker and the mother of 4 children, Mrs. Z. Abla opened a bar called "ROYAL AG" in 2005. Her business is doing well, especially during the weekends, and enables her to provide for her family. She would like to resupply by buying cases of beverage, in order to better meet customer demand. She's therefore seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, to buy 25 cases on non-alcoholic beverages, as well as cases of beer.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 25 cases of non-alcoholic beverages, and cases of beer

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet D. is 50 years old. She is married and mother to two daughters and a son who are all independent. Janet lives with her husband and two grandchildren at Oda, a town located in the Eastern region of Ghana. Janet’s husband is food crop farmer. She runs a grocery shop and charcoal sales to help her husband provide for the family. It was through this business that Janet sponsored all her children to graduate from school. They are all now working. She has been in business for twenty-five years. She sells items such as tins of milo (milk beverage), milk, sugar, bread, tinned fish, etc. Janet buys her goods from wholesalers in the big cities around such as Accra. She also purchases charcoal from the neighboring villages in bulk. She seeks a loan to expand the size of her shop and also to buy goods in bulk. She hopes to increase her profit margin to enable her to save more to support her family, especially her grandchildren’s education.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 40 years old, married, and the mother of three. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Linda sells drinks and cooked foods. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo is 39 years old and married with 4 children. She has a shop where she sells body cream, juice and drinks.  She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more drinks to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en: At just 19 years old, Jean Baptiste H. from Kigali, Rwanda has run a tailoring business for 3 years and employs 2 people! He works about 12 hours per day to generate a monthly profit of 130,000 Rwandan francs (FRW). He has just requested his first loan (of 500,000 FRW) from Vision Finance Company to expand his business.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of material for her tailoring business

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es: La señora María de la Luz vive con su esposo el señor Adrián Villarreal, quien es pensionado. La señora María tiene su negocio propio de nombre “Abarrotes Imax” establecido desde hace un año, negocio que ha dado ganancias y tiene ya su clientela, por tal motivo la familia esta solicitando este crédito para la inversión en la compra de mas mercancía y seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de los clientes
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria de la Luz lives with her husband, Mr. Adrian Villrreal, who is on pension. Mrs. Maria has her own business called "Abarrotes Imax", which she established a year ago. This business is turning a profit, and she already has her own regular customers. The family is seeking a loan for investment in the purchase of additional merchandise in order to continue meeting the needs of their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Veang

texts.en: T. T. is a housewife with strong confidence who manages a struggling life with her service business. T. T. runs a business selling coffee, fried meatballs and sausage, and junk food in front of her house. She has operated this business for years. She is married to Phuk who operates a service of selling ice, and pure water to his neighbors. T. T. earns much more income than expected as she is good at making delicious fried meatballs and toasted sausage, with her special sauce. As they lack transportation, T. and Phuk have decided to request a loan of $ 300 to buy a motorbike that they will use to aid in business transactions. This family has two young children.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to aid in selling and operations.

loans.name: Phlorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Phlorng D., age 60, is a widow with three sons and seven daughters. Six of them are married and live outside the family home and another two have full-time employment in Phnom Penh City. Phlorng’s family lives in a small village on National Road Number 2 about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Phlorng has been a farmer since 1979. She grows rice. Two of her daughters are garment factory workers and they spend a lot of money on transportation costs, so it’s difficult for them to manage income to support the family. To improve the situation, Phlorng is requesting her first loan of $1,000 in order to purchase a motorbike for her daughters to use to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her daughters to use to commute to work

loans.name: Francisca Fabiola

texts.es: Fabiola esta preocupada por la educación de su esposo, el quiere entrar ala universidad para superarse y estudiar una carrera para cuando termine ganar mas dinero. Ellos quieren dar lo mejor a sus hijos y sobre todo al que viene en camino. Fabiola quiere un crédito para comprar una computadora ya que es un instrumento muy importante para la educación de su marido. Sobre todo cuando se trabaja y se estudia es un gran esfuerzo para la familia.
texts.en:
Fabiola is very concerned with her husband’s education. He would like to attend a university in order to better himself and get a degree so that he can make more money. Fabiola and her husband want to give the best to their children, especially for the baby who is on the way. Fabiola is seeking this loan in order to purchase a computer, which is a very important tool for her husband’s education. When a person works and studies, it is a great strain on the family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Mrs. Navy S., 44, and her husband, Mr. Pho Pheng, 47, have been married since 1988 and have four children: three daughters and one son. One of their children has full-time employment, two are in school and the other one stays at home. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Navy has been a silk weaver for 23 years, while her husband has been a construction worker for 22 years. He works in his village. Because silk weaving is the main business for supporting Navy’s family, as well as for other people who live in the same area, Navy is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase silk materials for continuing her business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.name: Olubola

texts.en: Olubola sells medicine and has been in the business for the past 8 years. She  is 45 years old  and married with 4 children.  She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She say thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: S. is 29-year-old married man and father. He lives with his family members in his own small family home in Pursat Province. He owns a piece of land that he inherited from his grandmother on which he grows different kinds of crops. These crops, such as cabbages, cucumbers, and morning glories, he sells to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. His wife has grown these crops with him. The couple is married and has two school-aged children. S. needs a loan to buy a cow and other farming supplies for his business.

loans.use: To buy more farming supplies for his business.

loans.name: Blanche

texts.fr: N. Blanche est née en 1975 à Abomey-Calavi, non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à HOUESSOU Albert, un électricien moto, Blanche est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Blanche vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari depuis neuf ans, au quartier Cococodji, à proximité de Cotonou. Blanche a arrêté les classes au cours secondaire. Seul le conjoint de Blanche supporte les charges de la famille. Il y a sept ans de cela que Blanche mène comme activité, la vente de tissus, sacs et de chaussures par le système de distribution. Blanche s’approvisionne à Lomé, capitale du Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. Blanche a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. En vue d’augmenter davantage la taille de son activité et de satisfaire plus sa clientèle à l’approche des fêtes, Blanche sollicite un deuxième crédit de ALIDé. Blanche ambitionne ouvrir sa propre boutique pour y vendre ses articles.
texts.en:
Blanche N. was born in 1975 in Abomey-Calavi, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Albert Houessou, a motorcycle electrician, Blanche has two children, both in school. Blanche has lived together with her husband and children for nine years in the Cococodji area, close to Cotonou. Blanche ended her education in secondary school. Only Blanche's husband provides for the family. For seven years, Blanche has run a business selling fabric, bags, and shoes through the distribution system. Blanche gets her supplies in Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Benin. Blanche has already benefited from one loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), which she repaid properly. To further increase the size of her business and better satisfy her clientele with the upcoming holiday season, Blanche is seeking a second loan through ALIDÉ. Blanche aspires to open her own shop in which to sell her items.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one dozen pairs of shoes, 3 dozen bags, and 13 bolts of fabric

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Mrs. Elvira S. is 30 years of age and is a resident of Guinalaban, Tangub City. She is married to Ricky S. who is a merchandiser for Juanita Enterprise with an average salary of not less than P6,180 per month. The couple is blessed with two children who are now of school age.

In order to help her husband, Elvira decided to engage in a sari-sari (variety) store. For a period of two years to the present day she was able to sustain the business and earn an average net income of not less than P5,000 per month.

Elvira joined Paglaum MPC just this year because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao, and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006. 

Being on her first loan, Elvira was given the privilege of obtaining P5,000 to add to the capital of her sari-sari store. The future income from this loan will be used for her daily needs, for repayments to Paglaum MPC, and for savings.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina Q.  is a 56-year old married woman who lives in Barangay 1 in Siaton, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by selling fish. Josefina’s husband helps to run the business and they have six adult children who are all employed, but sometimes help in their parents' business.

Josefina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (PD) in 2002 to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family's income by selling fish. Now she earns an average monthly income of  Php 45,000 from her business.

Josefina is a member of good standing. She used her previous loan of Php 19,500 to fund her fish business. The loan has improved her business and her family’s living conditions. Now, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing Php 19,500 for her fish-selling business. Josefina works hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. She hopes that, when she has reached retirement age, the business and their savings can provide them with a better life.

 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. ("Dungganon" is a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable.") Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "dungganon," a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Ulziibayar

texts.en:
D. Uzliibayar is 44 years old and lives with her daughter in Zavhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her daughter is 13 years old and currently attends a local secondary school.

Ulziibayar operates a small bakery out of her home, making and selling a variety of baked goods to residents living in the surrounding countryside. She also works at a local insurance company to supplement her income.

Ulziibayar started her bakery seven years ago and has built a stable operation over the years. She says, "I must work hard in order to better my daughter and youngest sister's living conditions."

Ulziibayar has many plans for the future and hopes to one day own her own workplace. She is requesting an 850,000 tugrug  loan to purchase an oven for her bakery and to pay her younger sister's school tuition.

loans.use: To purchase an oven for her bakery and to pay her younger sister's school tuition

loans.name: Fulgencio

texts.es:
Fulgencio C. P. tiene 46 años de edad, su estado civil es casado, y vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.  Sus hijos son María, Laura, Miguel, Manuel, Carmen, Arrelio, Esteban, y Transito.  La mayor María tiene 20 años y el menor Transito tiene 7 años.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Yagui Grande.  Son 38 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.
Fulgencio se dedica a la agricultura toda su vida como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los cultivos que sobresalen son maíz y papas.  Los vende en la feria del cantón los días jueves.  Solicita el crédito para insumos agrícolas y semillas.  Su esperanza es que pueda comprar su terreno propio para construir una casa para sus hijos.  Su mayor motivo de trabajo es mejorar la calidad de vida para su familia.
Vive en una comunidad tranquila, unida, y responsable.  Les gusta colaborar con todos los miembros.  A la familia le gusta trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Fulgencio C. P. is 46 years old and he is married. He lives in the canton of San Miguel, in Bolívar Province. His children are María, Laura, Miguel, Manuel, Carmen, Arrelio, Esteban, and Transito. María is 20 years old and is the oldest, and the youngest, Transito, is 7 years old. He is a member of the Yagui Grande communal bank. There are 38 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture and raise small animals. Fulgencio has worked in agriculture as his family’s primary source income for his whole life. The crops he grows most are corn and potatoes. He sells them in the canton’s Thursday market. He is requesting the loan for agricultural inputs and seed. His hope is to be able to buy his own land so he can build a house for his children. His greatest motivation is to improve his family’s quality of life. He lives in a community that is quiet, close-knit, and responsible. He likes to work collaboratively with all of the members. His family likes working in the fields.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For agricultural inputs and seed

loans.name: Juan Enrique

texts.es:
